column1: # According to https://scriptures.nephi.org/ this is licensed under public domain

column8: bookLongTitle
column9: volumeSubtitle
column17: scriptureText

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O Lord, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the Lord shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O Lord; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Put them in fear, O Lord: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why standest thou afar off, O Lord? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the Lord abhorreth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the Lord put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord's throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Help, Lord; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long wilt thou forget me, O Lord? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Consider and hear me, O Lord my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will sing unto the Lord, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his refuge.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the Lord bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O my soul, thou hast said unto the Lord, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will bless the Lord, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have set the Lord always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear the right, O Lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O Lord, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From men which are thy hand, O Lord, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will love thee, O Lord, my strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the Lord was my stay.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore hath the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou wilt light my candle: the Lord my God will enlighten my darkness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For who is God save the Lord? or who is a rock save our God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the Lord, but he answered them not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The law of the Lord is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The statutes of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The fear of the Lord is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the Lord are true and righteous altogether.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the Lord fulfil all thy petitions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Now know I that the Lord saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save, Lord: let the king hear us when we call.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the king trusteth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He trusted on the Lord that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother's breasts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother's belly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But be not thou far from me, O Lord: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save me from the lion's mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye that fear the Lord, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the Lord that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the Lord: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the kingdom is the Lord's: and he is the governor among the nations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? or who shall stand in his holy place?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This is the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shew me thy ways, O Lord; teach me thy paths.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember, O Lord, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' sake, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Good and upright is the Lord: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy name's sake, O Lord, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What man is he that feareth the Lord? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The secret of the Lord is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eyes are ever toward the Lord; for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Consider mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Judge me, O Lord; for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the Lord; therefore I shall not slide.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me; try my reins and my heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes: and I have walked in thy truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with dissemblers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have hated the congregation of evil doers; and will not sit with the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will wash mine hands in innocency: so will I compass thine altar, O Lord:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all thy wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honour dwelleth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In whose hands is mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My foot standeth in an even place: in the congregations will I bless the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: One thing have I desired of the Lord, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to inquire in his temple.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord, will I seek.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto thee will I cry, O Lord my rock; be not silent to me: lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief is in their hearts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because they regard not the works of the Lord, nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is their strength, and he is the saving strength of his anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give unto the Lord, O ye mighty, give unto the Lord glory and strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name; worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters: the God of glory thundereth: the Lord is upon many waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars; yea, the Lord breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord divideth the flames of fire.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord shaketh the wilderness; the Lord shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of the Lord maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: and in his temple doth every one speak of his glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord sitteth upon the flood; yea, the Lord sitteth King for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord will give strength unto his people; the Lord will bless his people with peace.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will extol thee, O Lord; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto the Lord, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried to thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou my helper.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name's sake lead me, and guide me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have mercy upon me, O Lord, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies' sake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let me not be ashamed, O Lord; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O love the Lord, all ye his saints: for the Lord preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for praise is comely for the upright.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise the Lord with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the word of the Lord is right; and all his works are done in truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let all the earth fear the Lord: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he spake, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The counsel of the Lord standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: An horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our soul waiteth for the Lord: he is our help and our shield.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will bless the Lord at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul shall make her boast in the Lord: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt his name together.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I sought the Lord, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The angel of the Lord encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O taste and see that the Lord is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O fear the Lord, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The face of the Lord is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord chase them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This thou hast seen, O Lord: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Trust in the Lord, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Delight thyself also in the Lord; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the Lord upholdeth the righteous.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the Lord upholdeth him with his hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wait on the Lord, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the salvation of the righteous is of the Lord: he is their strength in the time of trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the Lord shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For in thee, O Lord, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord, thou knowest.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yet the Lord will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou art the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O send out thy light and thy truth: let them lead me; let them bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy tabernacles.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
