column17: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies' sake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Kings' daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favour.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The king's daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king's palace.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Come, behold the works of the Lord, what desolations he hath made in the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord most high is terrible; he is a great King over all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall subdue the people under us, and the nations under our feet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is gone up with a shout, the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For God is the King of all the earth: sing ye praises with understanding.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled, and hasted away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Walk about Zion, and go round about her: tell the towers thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The mighty God, even the Lord, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother's son.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou lovest evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O Lord; for it is good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In God will I praise his word: in the Lord will I praise his word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities be overpast.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will cry unto God most high; unto God that performeth all things for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen themselves. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing unto thee among the nations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou wilt prolong the king's life: and his years as many generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God be merciful unto us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then shall the earth yield her increase; and God, even our own God, shall bless us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name Jah, and rejoice before him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the Lord will dwell in it for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto God the Lord belong the issues from death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother's children.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Lord, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear me, O Lord; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This also shall please the Lord better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O Lord, make no tarrying.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother's bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Lord, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Vow, and pay unto the Lord your God: let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terrible to the kings of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will remember the works of the Lord: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the Lord, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore the Lord heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Man did eat angels' food: he sent them meat to the full.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy's hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

column8: The Book of Psalms
