column17: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long, Lord? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling place.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name's sake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine forth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the river.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is burned with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lust: and they walked in their own counsels.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The haters of the Lord should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver the poor and needy: rid them out of the hand of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the most High.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which perished at En-dor: they became as dung for the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is Jehovah, art the most high over all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Lord of hosts!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the Lord: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O Lord of hosts, my King, and my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shew us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will hear what God the Lord will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, the Lord shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bow down thine ear, O Lord, hear me: for I am poor and needy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like unto thy works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Teach me thy way, O Lord; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, Lord, hast holpen me, and comforted me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me: behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this man was born there.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the highest himself shall establish her.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this man was born there. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall be there: all my springs are in thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: Lord, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But unto thee have I cried, O Lord; and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will sing of the mercies of the Lord for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Lord: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the Lord? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the Lord?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord God of hosts, who is a strong Lord like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long, Lord? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which groweth up.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years, yet is their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Return, O Lord, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen evil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will say of the Lord, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because thou hast made the Lord, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, Lord, art most high for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For, lo, thine enemies, O Lord, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Those that be planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To shew that the Lord is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the Lord is clothed with strength, wherewith he hath girded himself: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yea, than the mighty waves of the sea.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O Lord, for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They break in pieces thy people, O Lord, and afflict thine heritage.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yet they say, The Lord shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of thy law;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unless the Lord had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the Lord is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the Lord our God shall cut them off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O come, let us sing unto the Lord: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the Lord our maker.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O sing unto the Lord a new song: sing unto the Lord, all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto the Lord, bless his name; shew forth his salvation from day to day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For all the gods of the nations are idols: but the Lord made the heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Honour and majesty are before him: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give unto the Lord, O ye kindreds of the people, give unto the Lord glory and strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give unto the Lord the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Say among the heathen that the Lord reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before the Lord: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols: worship him, all ye gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Zion heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou, Lord, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye that love the Lord, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O sing unto the Lord a new song; for he hath done marvellous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto the Lord with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the Lord, the King.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before the Lord; for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world, and the people with equity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord reigneth; let the people tremble: he sitteth between the cherubims; let the earth be moved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them praise thy great and terrible name; for it is holy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The king's strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Exalt ye the Lord our God, and worship at his footstool; for he is holy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name; they called upon the Lord, and he answered them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance that he gave them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou answeredst them, O Lord our God: thou wast a God that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the Lord our God is holy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all ye lands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Serve the Lord with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Know ye that the Lord he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will sing of mercy and judgment: unto thee, O Lord, will I sing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou, O Lord, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So the heathen shall fear the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the Lord shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the Lord behold the earth;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To declare the name of the Lord in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle's.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Like as a father pitieth his children, so the Lord pitieth them that fear him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But the mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children's children;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless ye the Lord, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the Lord, O my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man's heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The trees of the Lord are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the Lord, O my soul. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the Lord; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Seek the Lord, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Until the time that his word came: the word of the Lord tried him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord? who can shew forth all his praise?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember me, O Lord, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord commanded them:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the redeemed of the Lord say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: These see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits' end.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. I will praise the Lord with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The works of the Lord are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His work is honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
