column17: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Praise, O ye servants of the Lord, praise the name of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the name of the Lord from this time forth and for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the Lord's name is to be praised.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who is like unto the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth's sake.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Israel, trust thou in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He will bless them that fear the Lord, both small and great.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye are blessed of the Lord which made heaven and earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The heaven, even the heavens, are the Lord's: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The dead praise not the Lord, neither any that go down into silence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But we will bless the Lord from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then called I upon the name of the Lord; O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Gracious is the Lord, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will walk before the Lord in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said in my haste, All men are liars.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the courts of the Lord's house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the Lord endureth for ever. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them now that fear the Lord say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I called upon the Lord in distress: the Lord answered me, and set me in a large place.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord will I destroy them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the Lord helped me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The right hand of the Lord is exalted: the right hand of the Lord doeth valiantly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the Lord:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This gate of the Lord, into which the righteous shall enter.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This is the Lord's doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Save now, I beseech thee, O Lord: O Lord, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: God is the Lord, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O Lord, put me not to shame.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Teach me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy mercies come also unto me, O Lord, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I remembered thy judgments of old, O Lord; and have comforted myself.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have remembered thy name, O Lord, in the night, and have kept thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art my portion, O Lord: I have said that I would keep thy words.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I entreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O Lord, according unto thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For ever, O Lord, thy word is settled in heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O how love I thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O Lord, according unto thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Lord, and teach me thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is time for thee, Lord, to work: for they have made void thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Righteous art thou, O Lord, and upright are thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O Lord: I will keep thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy judgment.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou art near, O Lord; and all thy commandments are truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great are thy tender mercies, O Lord: quicken me according to thy judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O Lord, according to thy lovingkindness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my cry come near before thee, O Lord: give me understanding according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My help cometh from the Lord, which made heaven and earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hand.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Jerusalem is builded as a city that is compact together:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord, unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Because of the house of the Lord our God I will seek thy good.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until that he have mercy upon us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, now may Israel say;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If it had not been the Lord who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that trust in the Lord shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the Lord is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Do good, O Lord, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the Lord shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When the Lord turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The Lord hath done great things for them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Turn again our captivity, O Lord, as the streams in the south.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lo, children are an heritage of the Lord: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord; that walketh in his ways.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, thou shalt see thy children's children, and peace upon Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you: we bless you in the name of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If thou, Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let Israel hope in the Lord: for with the Lord there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let Israel hope in the Lord from henceforth and for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How he sware unto the Lord, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Until I find out a place for the Lord, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Arise, O Lord, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron's beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the Lord commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Behold, bless ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord, which by night stand in the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Praise ye the name of the Lord; praise him, O ye servants of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Ye that stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God,

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise the Lord; for the Lord is good: sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For I know that the Lord is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whatsoever the Lord pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And gave their land for an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy name, O Lord, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O Lord, throughout all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They that make them are like unto them: so is every one that trusteth in them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel: bless the Lord, O house of Aaron:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi: ye that fear the Lord, bless the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To him which smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How shall we sing the Lord's song in a strange land?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord, when they hear the words of thy mouth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O Lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O Lord, thou knowest it altogether.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: O God the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: But mine eyes are unto thee, O God the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear my prayer, O Lord, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Quicken me, O Lord, for thy name's sake: for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Blessed be the Lord my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Lord, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Bow thy heavens, O Lord, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: All thy works shall praise thee, O Lord; and thy saints shall bless thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Praise the Lord, O my soul.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: While I live will I praise the Lord: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the Lord his God:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The Lord looseth the prisoners:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind: the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down: the Lord loveth the righteous:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Praise ye the Lord from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them praise the name of the Lord: for he commanded, and they were created.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them praise the name of the Lord: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Sing unto the Lord a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: For the Lord taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise ye the Lord. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

column8: The Book of Psalms
column17: Let every thing that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the Lord, and depart from evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Honour the Lord with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

column8: The Proverbs
