column17: My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord; neither be weary of his correction:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For whom the Lord loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the froward is abomination to the Lord: but his secret is with the righteous.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord, and he pondereth all his goings.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: These six things doth the Lord hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of the Lord is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A false balance is abomination to the Lord: but a just weight is his delight.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the Lord: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A good man obtaineth favour of the Lord: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lying lips are abomination to the Lord: but they that deal truly are his delight.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the way of righteousness is life; and in the pathway thereof there is no death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise son heareth his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The ransom of a man's life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The eyes of the Lord are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hell and destruction are before the Lord: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better is little with the fear of the Lord than great treasure and trouble therewith.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the Lord weigheth the spirits.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The Lord hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When a man's ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man's heart deviseth his way: but the Lord directeth his steps.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A just weight and balance are the Lord's: all the weights of the bag are his work.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the Lord trieth the hearts.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Many will entreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the Lord hath made even both of them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Divers weights are an abomination unto the Lord; and a false balance is not good.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Man's goings are of the Lord; how can a man then understand his own way?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make inquiry.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the gray head.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the Lord pondereth the hearts.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the Lord.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The rich and poor meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By humility and the fear of the Lord are riches, and honour, and life.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

column8: The Proverbs
column17: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the Lord all the day long.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest the Lord see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: My son, fear thou the Lord and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?

column8: The Proverbs
column17: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

column8: The Proverbs
column17: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

column8: The Proverbs
column17: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

column8: The Proverbs
