column17: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

column8: The Song of Solomon
column17: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

column8: The Song of Solomon
column17: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

column8: The Song of Solomon
column17: Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the Lord hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master's crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the Lord, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hear the word of the Lord, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the Lord: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the Lord shall be consumed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the Lord's house shall be established in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And many people shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall judge among the nations, and shall rebuke many people: and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they be replenished from the east, and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children of strangers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the mean man boweth down, and the great man humbleth himself: therefore forgive them not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for fear of the Lord, and for the glory of his majesty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the day of the Lord of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty, and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be made low: and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the idols he shall utterly abolish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for fear of the Lord, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they made each one for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for fear of the Lord, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be accounted of?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For, behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their tongue and their doings are against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Say ye to the righteous, that it shall be well with him: for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord God of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover the Lord saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The rings, and nose jewels,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the veils.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; and burning instead of beauty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel: only let us be called by thy name, to take away our reproach.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall the branch of the Lord be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the earth shall be excellent and comely for them that are escaped of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that he that is left in Zion, and he that remaineth in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, even every one that is written among the living in Jerusalem:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory shall be a defence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and for a covert from storm and from rain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the vineyard of the Lord of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In mine ears said the Lord of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the Lord, neither consider the operation of his hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge: and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That say, Let him make speed, and hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Which justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the Lord of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent, their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea: and if one look unto the land, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord have removed men far away, and there be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said the Lord unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-jashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord God, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah's son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be established.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover the Lord spake again unto Ahaz, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ask thee a sign of the Lord thy God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he said, Hear ye now, O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign; Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil, and choose the good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father's house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, namely, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet: and it shall also consume the beard.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall nourish a young cow, and two sheep;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, it shall even be for briers and thorns.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: With arrows and with bows shall men come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And on all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns: but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of lesser cattle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover the Lord said unto me, Take thee a great roll, and write in it with a man's pen concerning Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the Lord to me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be taken away before the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord spake also unto me again, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria, and all his glory: and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries: gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Take counsel together, and it shall come to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand: for God is with us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Say ye not, A confederacy, to all them to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Sanctify the Lord of hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And many among them shall stumble, and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will wait upon the Lord, that hideth his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, I and the children whom the Lord hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the Lord of hosts, which dwelleth in mount Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And when they shall say unto you, Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep, and that mutter: should not a people seek unto their God? for the living to the dead?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To the law and to the testimony: if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall pass through it, hardly bestead and hungry: and it shall come to pass, that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall look unto the earth; and behold trouble and darkness, dimness of anguish; and they shall be driven to darkness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Nevertheless the dimness shall not be such as was in her vexation, when at the first he lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, and afterward did more grievously afflict her by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, in Galilee of the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou hast multiplied the nation, and not increased the joy: they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thou hast broken the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, as in the day of Midian.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Of the increase of his government and peace there shall be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to order it, and to establish it with judgment and with justice from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of the Lord of hosts will perform this.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it hath lighted upon Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in the pride and stoutness of heart,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones: the sycomores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the Lord will cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush, in one day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The ancient and honourable, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the leaders of this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows: for every one is an hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For wickedness burneth as the fire: it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Through the wrath of the Lord of hosts is the land darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire: no man shall spare his brother.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall snatch on the right hand, and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand, and they shall not be satisfied: they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh: and they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off nations not a few.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For he saith, Are not my princes altogether kings?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For he saith, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I am prudent: and I have removed the bounds of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth eggs that are left, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself, as if it were no wood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standardbearer fainteth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return: the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord God of hosts shall make a consumption, even determined, in the midst of all the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian: he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord of hosts shall stir up a scourge for him according to the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb: and as his rod was upon the sea, so shall he lift it up after the manner of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, shall lop the bough with terror: and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the Lord: and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice' den.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain: for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day there shall be a root of Jesse, which shall stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the Gentiles seek: and his rest shall be glorious.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west; they shall spoil them of the east together: they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind shall he shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over dryshod.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And there shall be an highway for the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria; like as it was to Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day thou shalt say, O Lord, I will praise thee: though thou wast angry with me, thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid: for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he also is become my salvation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day shall ye say, Praise the Lord, call upon his name, declare his doings among the people, make mention that his name is exalted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Sing unto the Lord; for he hath done excellent things: this is known in all the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Cry out and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger, even them that rejoice in my highness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the Lord of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, even the Lord, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Howl ye; for the day of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore shall all hands be faint, and every man's heart shall melt:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined unto them shall fall by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees' excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land: and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the people shall take them, and bring them to their place: and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the Lord for servants and handmaids: and they shall take them captives, whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in the day that the Lord shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord hath broken the staff of the wicked, and the sceptre of the rulers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into singing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming: it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: All they shall speak and say unto thee, Art thou also become weak as we? art thou become like unto us?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! how art thou cut down to the ground, which didst weaken the nations!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the most High.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and consider thee, saying, Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof; that opened not the house of his prisoners?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: All the kings of the nations, even all of them, lie in glory, every one in his own house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and as the raiment of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcase trodden under feet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land, and slain thy people: the seed of evildoers shall never be renowned.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For I will rise up against them, saith the Lord of hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name, and remnant, and son, and nephew, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord of hosts hath sworn, saying, Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That I will break the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot: then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth: and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that smote thee is broken: for out of the serpent's root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety: and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved: for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: What shall one then answer the messengers of the nation? That the Lord hath founded Zion, and the poor of his people shall trust in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Moab. Because in the night Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to silence; because in the night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to silence;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He is gone up to Bajith, and to Dibon, the high places, to weep: Moab shall howl over Nebo, and over Medeba: on all their heads shall be baldness, and every beard cut off.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In their streets they shall gird themselves with sackcloth: on the tops of their houses, and in their streets, every one shall howl, weeping abundantly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Heshbon shall cry, and Elealeh: their voice shall be heard even unto Jahaz: therefore the armed soldiers of Moab shall cry out; his life shall be grievous unto him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: My heart shall cry out for Moab; his fugitives shall flee unto Zoar, an heifer of three years old: for by the mounting up of Luhith with weeping shall they go it up; for in the way of Horonaim they shall raise up a cry of destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the waters of Nimrim shall be desolate: for the hay is withered away, the grass faileth, there is no green thing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have laid up, shall they carry away to the brook of the willows.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the howling thereof unto Beer-elim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the waters of Dimon shall be full of blood: for I will bring more upon Dimon, lions upon him that escapeth of Moab, and upon the remnant of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from Sela to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For it shall be, that, as a wandering bird cast out of the nest, so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Take counsel, execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that wandereth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Let mine outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the face of the spoiler: for the extortioner is at an end, the spoiler ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud: even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his wrath: but his lies shall not be so.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab, every one shall howl: for the foundations of Kir-hareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come even unto Jazer, they wandered through the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir-haresh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: This is the word that the Lord hath spoken concerning Moab since that time.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But now the Lord hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned, with all that great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and feeble.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The cities of Aroer are forsaken: they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The fortress also shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria: they shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day it shall come to pass, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the corn, and reapeth the ears with his arm; and it shall be as he that gathereth ears in the valley of Rephaim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yet gleaning grapes shall be left in it, as the shaking of an olive tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost fruitful branches thereof, saith the Lord God of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: At that day shall a man look to his Maker, and his eyes shall have respect to the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall not look to the altars, the work of his hands, neither shall respect that which his fingers have made, either the groves, or the images.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall his strong cities be as a forsaken bough, and an uppermost branch, which they left because of the children of Israel: and there shall be desolation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and hast not been mindful of the rock of thy strength, therefore shalt thou plant pleasant plants, and shalt set it with strange slips:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the day shalt thou make thy plant to grow, and in the morning shalt thou make thy seed to flourish: but the harvest shall be a heap in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to the multitude of many people, which make a noise like the noise of the seas; and to the rushing of nations, that make a rushing like the rushing of mighty waters!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The nations shall rush like the rushing of many waters: but God shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And behold at eveningtide trouble; and before the morning he is not. This is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that rob us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to the land shadowing with wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of bulrushes upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation scattered and peeled, to a people terrible from their beginning hitherto; a nation meted out and trodden down, whose land the rivers have spoiled!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: All ye inhabitants of the world, and dwellers on the earth, see ye, when he lifteth up an ensign on the mountains; and when he bloweth a trumpet, hear ye.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For so the Lord said unto me, I will take my rest, and I will consider in my dwelling place like a clear heat upon herbs, and like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For afore the harvest, when the bud is perfect, and the sour grape is ripening in the flower, he shall both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks, and take away and cut down the branches.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall be left together unto the fowls of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth: and the fowls shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that time shall the present be brought unto the Lord of hosts of a people scattered and peeled, and from a people terrible from their beginning hitherto; a nation meted out and trodden under foot, whose land the rivers have spoiled, to the place of the name of the Lord of hosts, the mount Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Egypt. Behold, the Lord rideth upon a swift cloud, and shall come into Egypt: and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at his presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will set the Egyptians against the Egyptians: and they shall fight every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbour; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst thereof; and I will destroy the counsel thereof: and they shall seek to the idols, and to the charmers, and to them that have familiar spirits, and to the wizards.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Egyptians will I give over into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall turn the rivers far away; and the brooks of defence shall be emptied and dried up: the reeds and flags shall wither.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The paper reeds by the brooks, by the mouth of the brooks, and every thing sown by the brooks, shall wither, be driven away, and be no more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The fishers also shall mourn, and all they that cast angle into the brooks shall lament, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover they that work in fine flax, and they that weave networks, shall be confounded.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall be broken in the purposes thereof, all that make sluices and ponds for fish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Surely the princes of Zoan are fools, the counsel of the wise counsellors of Pharaoh is become brutish: how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Where are they? where are thy wise men? and let them tell thee now, and let them know what the Lord of hosts hath purposed upon Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Noph are deceived; they have also seduced Egypt, even they that are the stay of the tribes thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord hath mingled a perverse spirit in the midst thereof: and they have caused Egypt to err in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggereth in his vomit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Neither shall there be any work for Egypt, which the head or tail, branch or rush, may do.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall Egypt be like unto women: and it shall be afraid and fear because of the shaking of the hand of the Lord of hosts, which he shaketh over it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the land of Judah shall be a terror unto Egypt, every one that maketh mention thereof shall be afraid in himself, because of the counsel of the Lord of hosts, which he hath determined against it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall five cities in the land of Egypt speak the language of Canaan, and swear to the Lord of hosts; one shall be called, The city of destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall there be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto the Lord of hosts in the land of Egypt: for they shall cry unto the Lord because of the oppressors, and he shall send them a saviour, and a great one, and he shall deliver them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord shall be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know the Lord in that day, and shall do sacrifice and oblation; yea, they shall vow a vow unto the Lord, and perform it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord shall smite Egypt: he shall smite and heal it: and they shall return even to the Lord, and he shall be entreated of them, and shall heal them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall there be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians shall serve with the Assyrians.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, even a blessing in the midst of the land:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Whom the Lord of hosts shall bless, saying, Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel mine inheritance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the year that Tartan came unto Ashdod, (when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him,) and fought against Ashdod, and took it;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: At the same time spake the Lord by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, Go and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, and put off thy shoe from thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and wonder upon Egypt and upon Ethiopia;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: So shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians prisoners, and the Ethiopians captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, even with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the inhabitant of this isle shall say in that day, Behold, such is our expectation, whither we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria: and how shall we escape?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will inquire, inquire ye: return, come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the Lord God of Israel hath spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou that art full of stirs, a tumultuous city, a joyous city: thy slain men are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: All thy rulers are fled together, they are bound by the archers: all that are found in thee are bound together, which have fled from far.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore said I, Look away from me; I will weep bitterly, labour not to comfort me, because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For it is a day of trouble, and of treading down, and of perplexity by the Lord God of hosts in the valley of vision, breaking down the walls, and of crying to the mountains.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Elam bare the quiver with chariots of men and horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that thy choicest valleys shall be full of chariots, and the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he discovered the covering of Judah, and thou didst look in that day to the armour of the house of the forest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And ye have numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses have ye broken down to fortify the wall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ye made also a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: but ye have not looked unto the maker thereof, neither had respect unto him that fashioned it long ago.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
