column17: And in that day did the Lord God of hosts call to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen, and killing sheep, eating flesh, and drinking wine: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we shall die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it was revealed in mine ears by the Lord of hosts, Surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you till ye die, saith the Lord God of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord God of hosts, Go, get thee unto this treasurer, even unto Shebna, which is over the house, and say,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: What hast thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here, as he that heweth him out a sepulchre on high, and that graveth an habitation for himself in a rock?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord will carry thee away with a mighty captivity, and will surely cover thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He will surely violently turn and toss thee like a ball into a large country: there shalt thou die, and there the chariots of thy glory shall be the shame of thy lord's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will drive thee from thy station, and from thy state shall he pull thee down.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will clothe him with thy robe, and strengthen him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand: and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder; so he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none shall open.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place; and he shall be for a glorious throne to his father's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father's house, the offspring and the issue, all vessels of small quantity, from the vessels of cups, even to all the vessels of flagons.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day, saith the Lord of hosts, shall the nail that is fastened in the sure place be removed, and be cut down, and fall; and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off: for the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Be still, ye inhabitants of the isle; thou whom the merchants of Zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And by great waters the seed of Sihor, the harvest of the river, is her revenue; and she is a mart of nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Be thou ashamed, O Zidon: for the sea hath spoken, even the strength of the sea, saying, I travail not, nor bring forth children, neither do I nourish up young men, nor bring up virgins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As at the report concerning Egypt, so shall they be sorely pained at the report of Tyre.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days? her own feet shall carry her afar off to sojourn.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning city, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honourable of the earth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord of hosts hath purposed it, to stain the pride of all glory, and to bring into contempt all the honourable of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Pass through thy land as a river, O daughter of Tarshish: there is no more strength.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He stretched out his hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms: the Lord hath given a commandment against the merchant city, to destroy the strong holds thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon: arise, pass over to Chittim; there also shalt thou have no rest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold the land of the Chaldeans; this people was not, till the Assyrian founded it for them that dwell in the wilderness: they set up the towers thereof, they raised up the palaces thereof; and he brought it to ruin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Howl, ye ships of Tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king: after the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Take an harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the Lord will visit Tyre, and she shall turn to her hire, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the Lord: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the Lord, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of usury to him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and fadeth away, the haughty people of the earth do languish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, changed the ordinance, broken the everlasting covenant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are desolate: therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The city of confusion is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the people, there shall be as the shaking of an olive tree, and as the gleaning grapes when the vintage is done.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty of the Lord, they shall cry aloud from the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore glorify ye the Lord in the fires, even the name of the Lord God of Israel in the isles of the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even glory to the righteous. But I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto me! the treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the windows from on high are open, and the foundations of the earth do shake.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The earth is utterly broken down, the earth is clean dissolved, the earth is moved exceedingly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be removed like a cottage; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall punish the host of the high ones that are on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the Lord of hosts shall reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, and before his ancients gloriously.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things; thy counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thou hast made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in this mountain shall the Lord of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the veil that is spread over all nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord God will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For in this mountain shall the hand of the Lord rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Trust ye in the Lord for ever: for in the Lord Jehovah is everlasting strength:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O Lord, have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lord, when thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: but they shall see, and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lord, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lord, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For, behold, the Lord cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day the Lord with his sore and great and strong sword shall punish leviathan the piercing serpent, even leviathan that crooked serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day sing ye unto her, A vineyard of red wine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I the Lord do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He shall cause them that come of Jacob to take root: Israel shall blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debate with it: he stayeth his rough wind in the day of the east wind.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder, the groves and images shall not stand up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yet the defenced city shall be desolate, and the habitation forsaken, and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off: the women come, and set them on fire: for it is a people of no understanding: therefore he that made them will not have mercy on them, and he that formed them will shew them no favour.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall beat off from the channel of the river unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the great trumpet shall be blown, and they shall come which were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and shall worship the Lord in the holy mount at Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For with stammering lips and another tongue will he speak to this people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To whom he said, This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But the word of the Lord was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore hear the word of the Lord, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a vexation only to understand the report.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now therefore be ye not mockers, lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord God of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the clods of his ground?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rie in their place?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Bread corn is bruised; because he will not ever be threshing it, nor break it with the wheel of his cart, nor bruise it with his horsemen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: This also cometh forth from the Lord of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in working.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! add ye year to year; let them kill sacrifices.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yet I will distress Ariel, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow: and it shall be unto me as Ariel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust, and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt be visited of the Lord of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of devouring fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It shall even be as when an hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers, the seers hath he covered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth, and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the Lord, and their works are in the dark, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter's clay: for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The meek also shall increase their joy in the Lord, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name, and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the Lord, that take counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my spirit, that they may add sin to sin:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came to Hanes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I cried concerning this, Their strength is to sit still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That this is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Which say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And therefore will the Lord wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the Lord is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver, and the ornament of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that the Lord bindeth up the breach of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the name of the Lord cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holy solemnity is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the Lord, to the mighty One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Lord shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For through the voice of the Lord shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass, which the Lord shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps: and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the Lord, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help; and stay on horses, and trust in chariots, because they are many; and in horsemen, because they are very strong; but they look not unto the Holy One of Israel, neither seek the Lord!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words: but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; and their horses flesh, and not spirit. When the Lord shall stretch out his hand, both he that helpeth shall fall, and he that is holpen shall fall down, and they all shall fail together.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thus hath the Lord spoken unto me, Like as the lion and the young lion roaring on his prey, when a multitude of shepherds is called forth against him, he will not be afraid of their voice, nor abase himself for the noise of them: so shall the Lord of hosts come down to fight for mount Zion, and for the hill thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As birds flying, so will the Lord of hosts defend Jerusalem; defending also he will deliver it; and passing over he will preserve it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Turn ye unto him from whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you for a sin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then shall the Assyrian fall with the sword, not of a mighty man; and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall be discomfited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the Lord, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be bountiful.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the Lord, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The instruments also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, the gathering shall not come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Because the palaces shall be forsaken; the multitude of the city shall be left; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When it shall hail, coming down on the forest; and the city shall be low in a low place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the Lord is his treasure.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now will I rise, saith the Lord; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But there the glorious Lord will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; he will save us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let the earth hear, and all that is therein; the world, and all things that come forth of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the indignation of the Lord is upon all nations, and his fury upon all their armies: he hath utterly destroyed them, he hath delivered them to the slaughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Their slain also shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their carcases, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll: and all their host shall fall down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a falling fig from the fig tree.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For my sword shall be bathed in heaven: behold, it shall come down upon Idumea, and upon the people of my curse, to judgment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The sword of the Lord is filled with blood, it is made fat with fatness, and with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams: for the Lord hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Idumea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the unicorns shall come down with them, and the bullocks with the bulls; and their land shall be soaked with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For it is the day of the Lord's vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall become burning pitch.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It shall not be quenched night nor day; the smoke thereof shall go up for ever: from generation to generation it shall lie waste; none shall pass through it for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But the cormorant and the bittern shall possess it; the owl also and the raven shall dwell in it: and he shall stretch out upon it the line of confusion, and the stones of emptiness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall call the nobles thereof to the kingdom, but none shall be there, and all her princes shall be nothing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof: and it shall be an habitation of dragons, and a court for owls.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the wild beasts of the island, and the satyr shall cry to his fellow; the screech owl also shall rest there, and find for herself a place of rest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: There shall the great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and gather under her shadow: there shall the vultures also be gathered, every one with her mate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Seek ye out of the book of the Lord, and read: no one of these shall fail, none shall want her mate: for my mouth it hath commanded, and his spirit it hath gathered them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he hath cast the lot for them, and his hand hath divided it unto them by line: they shall possess it for ever, from generation to generation shall they dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the Lord, and the excellency of our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the ransomed of the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah, and took them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiah's son, which was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, Asaph's son, the recorder.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lo, thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But if thou say to me, We trust in the Lord our God: is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And am I now come up without the Lord against this land to destroy it? the Lord said unto me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and speak not to us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But Rabshakeh said, Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the Lord, saying, The Lord will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, The Lord will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arphad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who are they among all the gods of these lands, that have delivered their land out of my hand, that the Lord should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king's commandment was, saying, Answer him not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then came Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It may be the Lord thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God, and will reprove the words which the Lord thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say unto your master, Thus saith the Lord, Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, He is come forth to make war with thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God, in whom thou trustest, deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Telassar?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arphad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the Lord, and spread it before the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Hezekiah prayed unto the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, that dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth: thou hast made heaven and earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear; open thine eyes, O Lord, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Of a truth, Lord, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations, and their countries,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Now therefore, O Lord our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the Lord, even thou only.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Whereas thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: This is the word which the Lord hath spoken concerning him; The virgin, the daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: By thy servants hast thou reproached the Lord, and hast said, By the multitude of my chariots am I come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon; and I will cut down the tall cedars thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the height of his border, and the forest of his Carmel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of the besieged places.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient times, that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste defenced cities into ruinous heaps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded: they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Because thy rage against me, and thy tumult, is come up into mine ears, therefore will I put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such as groweth of itself; and the second year that which springeth of the same: and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the Lord of hosts shall do this.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake, and for my servant David's sake.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then the angel of the Lord went forth, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Armenia: and Esar-haddon his son reigned in his stead.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the Lord,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And said, Remember now, O Lord, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the Lord, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I said, I shall not see the Lord, even the Lord, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd's tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O Lord, I am oppressed; undertake for me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaster upon the boil, and he shall recover.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: At that time Merodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah: for he had heard that he had been sick, and was recovered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Hezekiah was glad of them, and shewed them the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me, even from Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said he, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All that is in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day, shall be carried to Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is the word of the Lord which thou hast spoken. He said moreover, For there shall be peace and truth in my days.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of the Lord's hand double for all her sins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord God will come with strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who hath directed the Spirit of the Lord, or being his counsellor hath taught him?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: All nations before him are as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, that shall not be moved.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: It is he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the Lord, and my judgment is passed over from my God?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew their strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who raised up the righteous man from the east, called him to his foot, gave the nations before him, and made him rule over kings? he gave them as the dust to his sword, and as driven stubble to his bow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He pursued them, and passed safely; even by the way that he had not gone with his feet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who hath wrought and done it, calling the generations from the beginning? I the Lord, the first, and with the last; I am he.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The isles saw it, and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They helped every one his neighbour; and every one said to his brother, Be of good courage.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and he that smootheth with the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It is ready for the sodering: and he fastened it with nails, that it should not be moved.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But thou, Israel, art my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
