column17: But ye shall be named the Priests of the Lord: men shall call you the Ministers of our God: ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For your shame ye shall have double; and for confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For I the Lord love judgment, I hate robbery for burnt offering; and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, and their offspring among the people: all that see them shall acknowledge them, that they are the seed which the Lord hath blessed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden causeth the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For Zion's sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord shall name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzi-bah, and thy land Beulah: for the Lord delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the Lord, keep not silence,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The Lord hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the Lord; and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Go through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, the Lord hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the Lord: and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the Lord, and the praises of the Lord, according to all that the Lord hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the Lord caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O Lord, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: O Lord, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants' sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Be not wroth very sore, O Lord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swine's flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the Lord, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants' sakes, that I may not destroy them all.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But ye are they that forsake the Lord, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord God shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the Lord, and their offspring with them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent's meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where is the house that ye build unto me? and where is the place of my rest?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For all those things hath mine hand made, and all those things have been, saith the Lord: but to this man will I look, even to him that is poor and of a contrite spirit, and trembleth at my word.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth a lamb, as if he cut off a dog's neck; he that offereth an oblation, as if he offered swine's blood; he that burneth incense, as if he blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears upon them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spake, they did not hear: but they did evil before mine eyes, and chose that in which I delighted not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Hear the word of the Lord, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, that cast you out for my name's sake, said, Let the Lord be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: A voice of noise from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of the Lord that rendereth recompence to his enemies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? Shall the earth be made to bring forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith the Lord: shall I cause to bring forth, and shut the womb? saith thy God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne upon her sides, and be dandled upon her knees.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: As one whom his mother comforteth, so will I comfort you; and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And when ye see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like an herb: and the hand of the Lord shall be known toward his servants, and his indignation toward his enemies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For, behold, the Lord will come with fire, and with his chariots like a whirlwind, to render his anger with fury, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For by fire and by his sword will the Lord plead with all flesh: and the slain of the Lord shall be many.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens behind one tree in the midst, eating swine's flesh, and the abomination, and the mouse, shall be consumed together, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For I know their works and their thoughts: it shall come, that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come, and see my glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will set a sign among them, and I will send those that escape of them unto the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, that draw the bow, to Tubal, and Javan, to the isles afar off, that have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the Lord out of all nations upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, saith the Lord, as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And I will also take of them for priests and for Levites, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith the Lord, so shall your seed and your name remain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that from one new moon to another, and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship before me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
column17: And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To whom the word of the Lord came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! behold, I cannot speak: for I am a child.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the Lord said unto me, Say not, I am a child: for thou shalt go to all that I shall send thee, and whatsoever I command thee thou shalt speak.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Be not afraid of their faces: for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the Lord put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: See, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to root out, and to pull down, and to destroy, and to throw down, to build, and to plant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond tree.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the Lord unto me, Thou hast well seen: for I will hasten my word to perform it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a seething pot; and the face thereof is toward the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the Lord said unto me, Out of the north an evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith the Lord; and they shall come, and they shall set every one his throne at the entering of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against all the cities of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, who have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, and worshipped the works of their own hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, behold, I have made thee this day a defenced city, and an iron pillar, and brasen walls against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee, saith the Lord, to deliver thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the Lord; I remember thee, the kindness of thy youth, the love of thine espousals, when thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Israel was holiness unto the Lord, and the firstfruits of his increase: all that devour him shall offend; evil shall come upon them, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear ye the word of the Lord, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, What iniquity have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked after vanity, and are become vain?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither said they, Where is the Lord that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought, and of the shadow of death, through a land that no man passed through, and where no man dwelt?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I brought you into a plentiful country, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye defiled my land, and made mine heritage an abomination.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The priests said not, Where is the Lord? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore I will yet plead with you, saith the Lord, and with your children's children will I plead.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For pass over the isles of Chittim, and see; and send unto Kedar, and consider diligently, and see if there be such a thing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hath a nation changed their gods, which are yet no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which doth not profit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For my people have committed two evils; they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters, and hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is Israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave? why is he spoiled?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The young lions roared upon him, and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are burned without inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God, when he led thee by the way?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt, to drink the waters of Sihor? or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria, to drink the waters of the river?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord God of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bands; and thou saidst, I will not transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree thou wanderest, playing the harlot.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For though thou wash thee with nitre, and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure; in her occasion who can turn her away? all they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Withhold thy foot from being unshod, and thy throat from thirst: but thou saidst, There is no hope: no; for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Saying to a stock, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto me, and not their face: but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble: for according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In vain have I smitten your children; they received no correction: your own sword hath devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O generation, see ye the word of the Lord. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? a land of darkness? wherefore say my people, We are lords; we will come no more unto thee?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love? therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents: I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet thou sayest, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me. Behold, I will plead with thee, because thou sayest, I have not sinned.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way? thou also shalt be ashamed of Egypt, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hands upon thine head: for the Lord hath rejected thy confidences, and thou shalt not prosper in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man's, shall he return unto her again? shall not that land be greatly polluted? but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Lift up thine eyes unto the high places, and see where thou hast not been lien with. In the ways hast thou sat for them, as the Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; and thou hadst a whore's forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My father, thou art the guide of my youth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Will he reserve his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and done evil things as thou couldest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she returned not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I saw, when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away, and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but went and played the harlot also.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stones and with stocks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not turned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Lord said unto me, The backsliding Israel hath justified herself more than treacherous Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Lord; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the Lord, and I will not keep anger for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the Lord thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Turn, O backsliding children, saith the Lord; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the Lord, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of the Lord: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Lord; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the imagination of their evil heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But I said, How shall I put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping and supplications of the children of Israel: for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the Lord their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Return, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Truly in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitude of mountains: truly in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For shame hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covereth us: for we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou shalt swear, The Lord liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Circumcise yourselves to the Lord, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: lest my fury come forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry, gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The lion is come up from his thicket, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; and thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce anger of the Lord is not turned back from us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the Lord, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Even a full wind from those places shall come unto me: now also will I give sentence against them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as a whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As keepers of a field, are they against her round about; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth unto thine heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is spoiled: suddenly are my tents spoiled, and my curtains in a moment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For my people is foolish, they have not known me; they are sottish children, and they have none understanding: they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the Lord, and by his fierce anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus hath the Lord said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black: because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city shall be forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rentest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, and the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewaileth herself, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that executeth judgment, that seeketh the truth; and I will pardon it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And though they say, The Lord liveth; surely they swear falsely.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, are not thine eyes upon the truth? thou hast stricken them, but they have not grieved; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish: for they know not the way of the Lord, nor the judgment of their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the Lord, and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, and a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their cities: every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many, and their backslidings are increased.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots' houses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the Lord: and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her battlements; for they are not the Lord's.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They have belied the Lord, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith the Lord: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their quiver is as an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall eat up thine harvest, and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat: they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds: they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees: they shall impoverish thy fenced cities, wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nevertheless in those days, saith the Lord, I will not make a full end with you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore doeth the Lord our God all these things unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear not:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Fear ye not me? saith the Lord: will ye not tremble at my presence, which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear the Lord our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in his season: he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good things from you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For among my people are found wicked men: they lay wait, as he that setteth snares; they set a trap, they catch men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are waxen fat, they shine: yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked: they judge not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, yet they prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the Lord: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Beth-haccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate woman.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed every one in his place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day goeth away, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus hath the Lord of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her wickedness: violence and spoil is heard in her; before me continually is grief and wounds.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the Lord is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore I am full of the fury of the Lord; I am weary with holding in: I will pour it out upon the children abroad, and upon the assembly of young men together: for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And their houses shall be turned unto others, with their fields and wives together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall: at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words, nor to my law, but rejected it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, and pain, as of a woman in travail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people, that thou mayest know and try their way.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are all grievous revolters, walking with slanders: they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The bellows are burned, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Reprobate silver shall men call them, because the Lord hath rejected them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Stand in the gate of the Lord's house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the Lord, all ye of Judah, that enter in at these gates to worship the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord, are these.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For if ye throughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye throughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbour;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If ye oppress not the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your hurt:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, for ever and ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods whom ye know not;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered to do all these abominations?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, even I have seen it, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I set my name at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith the Lord, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I do unto this house, which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me: for I will not hear thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead their dough, to make cakes to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Do they provoke me to anger? saith the Lord: do they not provoke themselves to the confusion of their own faces?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Put your burnt offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat flesh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But this thing commanded I them, saying, Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in the counsels and in the imagination of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day I have even sent unto you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but hardened their neck: they did worse than their fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But thou shalt say unto them, This is a nation that obeyeth not the voice of the Lord their God, nor receiveth correction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Cut off thine hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on high places; for the Lord hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the children of Judah have done evil in my sight, saith the Lord: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to pollute it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that it shall no more be called Tophet, nor the valley of the son of Hinnom, but the valley of slaughter: for they shall bury in Tophet, till there be no place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the carcases of this people shall be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall fray them away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride: for the land shall be desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At that time, saith the Lord, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of them that remain of this evil family, which remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord; Shall they fall, and not arise? shall he turn away, and not return?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turned to his course, as the horse rusheth into the battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle and the crane and the swallow observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the judgment of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of the Lord is with us? Lo, certainly in vain made he it; the pen of the scribes is in vain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The wise men are ashamed, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of the Lord; and what wisdom is in them?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall inherit them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness, from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among them that fall: in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will surely consume them, saith the Lord: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the defenced cities, and let us be silent there: for the Lord our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of health, and behold trouble!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The snorting of his horses was heard from Dan: the whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they are come, and have devoured the land, and all that is in it; the city, and those that dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, behold, I will send serpents, cockatrices, among you, which will not be charmed, and they shall bite you, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When I would comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint in me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the Lord in Zion? is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with strange vanities?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt; I am black; astonishment hath taken hold on me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they be all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they bend their tongues like their bow for lies: but they are not valiant for the truth upon the earth; for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take ye heed every one of his neighbour, and trust ye not in any brother: for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbour will walk with slanders.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they will deceive every one his neighbour, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies, and weary themselves to commit iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thine habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how shall I do for the daughter of my people?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their tongue is as an arrow shot out; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth, but in heart he layeth his wait.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith the Lord: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the habitations of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none can pass through them; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled; they are gone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord hath spoken, that he may declare it, for what the land perisheth and is burned up like a wilderness, that none passeth through?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Lord saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But have walked after the imagination of their own heart, and after Baalim, which their fathers taught them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: and I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for cunning women, that they may come:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet hear the word of the Lord, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth, and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbour lamentation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For death is come up into our windows, and is entered into our palaces, to cut off the children from without, and the young men from the streets.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Speak, Thus saith the Lord, Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, and none shall gather them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that are in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear ye the word which the Lord speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O Lord; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the Lord is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Every man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The Lord of hosts is his name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the Lord: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel; Cursed be the man that obeyeth not the words of this covenant,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: That I may perform the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. Then answered I, and said, So be it, O Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the Lord said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the imagination of their evil heart: therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do; but they did them not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Lord said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
