column17: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, which refused to hear my words; and they went after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto me, I will not hearken unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shall the cities of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem go, and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer incense: but they shall not save them at all in the time of their trouble.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to that shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up a cry or prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me for their trouble.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: What hath my beloved to do in mine house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord called thy name, A green olive tree, fair, and of goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the Lord of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke me to anger in offering incense unto Baal.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Lord hath given me knowledge of it, and I know it: then thou shewedst me their doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But I was like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But, O Lord of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Prophesy not in the name of the Lord, that thou die not by our hand:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And there shall be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Righteous art thou, O Lord, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root: they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But thou, O Lord, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our last end.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; yea, they have called a multitude after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Mine heritage is unto me as a speckled bird, the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They have made it desolate, and being desolate it mourneth unto me; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the Lord shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The Lord liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord unto me, Go and get thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So I got a girdle according to the word of the Lord, and put it on my loins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me the second time, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take the girdle that thou hast got, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole of the rock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So I went, and hid it by Euphrates, as the Lord commanded me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass after many days, that the Lord said unto me, Arise, go to Euphrates, and take the girdle from thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then I went to Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it: and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: This evil people, which refuse to hear my words, which walk in the imagination of their heart, and walk after other gods, to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is good for nothing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith the Lord; that they might be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word; Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings that sit upon David's throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith the Lord: I will not pity, nor spare, nor have mercy, but destroy them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud: for the Lord hath spoken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Give glory to the Lord your God, before he cause darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains, and, while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross darkness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret places for your pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because the Lord's flock is carried away captive.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Say unto the king and to the queen, Humble yourselves, sit down: for your principalities shall come down, even the crown of your glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The cities of the south shall be shut up, and none shall open them: Judah shall be carried away captive all of it, it shall be wholly carried away captive.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north: where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: What wilt thou say when he shall punish thee? for thou hast taught them to be captains, and as chief over thee: shall not sorrows take thee, as a woman in travail?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And if thou say in thine heart, Wherefore come these things upon me? For the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts discovered, and thy heels made bare.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I scatter them as the stubble that passeth away by the wind of the wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: This is thy lot, the portion of thy measures from me, saith the Lord; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I discover thy skirts upon thy face, that thy shame may appear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, and thine abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when shall it once be?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the dearth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish; they are black unto the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And their nobles have sent their little ones to the waters: they came to the pits, and found no water; they returned with their vessels empty; they were ashamed and confounded, and covered their heads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because the ground is chapt, for there was no rain in the earth, the plowmen were ashamed, they covered their heads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yea, the hind also calved in the field, and forsook it, because there was no grass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the wild asses did stand in the high places, they snuffed up the wind like dragons; their eyes did fail, because there was no grass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, though our iniquities testify against us, do thou it for thy name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O the hope of Israel, the saviour thereof in time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a stranger in the land, and as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why shouldest thou be as a man astonied, as a mighty man that cannot save? yet thou, O Lord, art in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; leave us not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord unto this people, Thus have they loved to wander, they have not refrained their feet, therefore the Lord doth not accept them; he will now remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the Lord unto me, Pray not for this people for their good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and an oblation, I will not accept them: but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the Lord said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name: I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake unto them: they prophesy unto you a false vision and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land; By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thou shalt say this word unto them; Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease: for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous blow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If I go forth into the field, then behold the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then behold them that are sick with famine! yea, both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they know not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul lothed Zion? why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us? we looked for peace, and there is no good; and for the time of healing, and behold trouble!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We acknowledge, O Lord, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers: for we have sinned against thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Do not abhor us, for thy name's sake, do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: remember, break not thy covenant with us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Are there any among the vanities of the Gentiles that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? art not thou he, O Lord our God? therefore we will wait upon thee: for thou hast made all these things.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the Lord unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the Lord; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the Lord: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the Lord, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O Lord God of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word of the Lord came also unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall die of grievous deaths; they shall not be lamented; neither shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth: and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their carcases shall be meat for the fowls of heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament nor bemoan them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, saith the Lord, even lovingkindness and mercies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Both the great and the small shall die in this land: they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither shall men tear themselves for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou shalt not also go into the house of feasting, to sit with them to eat and to drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place in your eyes, and in your days, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt shew this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath the Lord pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith the Lord, and have walked after other gods, and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And ye have done worse than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the imagination of his evil heart, that they may not hearken unto me:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I cast you out of this land into a land that ye know not, neither ye nor your fathers; and there shall ye serve other gods day and night; where I will not shew you favour.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that it shall no more be said, The Lord liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But, The Lord liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the lands whither he had driven them: and I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith the Lord, and they shall fish them; and after will I send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For mine eyes are upon all their ways: they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity hid from mine eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double; because they have defiled my land, they have filled mine inheritance with the carcases of their detestable and abominable things.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, my strength, and my fortress, and my refuge in the day of affliction, the Gentiles shall come unto thee from the ends of the earth, and shall say, Surely our fathers have inherited lies, vanity, and things wherein there is no profit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall a man make gods unto himself, and they are no gods?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, I will this once cause them to know, I will cause them to know mine hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is The Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Whilst their children remember their altars and their groves by the green trees upon the high hills.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures to the spoil, and thy high places for sin, throughout all thy borders.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou, even thyself, shalt discontinue from thine heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger, which shall burn for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Cursed be the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh; but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, in a salt land and not inhabited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Blessed is the man that trusteth in the Lord, and whose hope the Lord is.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, and that spreadeth out her roots by the river, and shall not see when heat cometh, but her leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I the Lord search the heart, I try the reins, even to give every man according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As the partridge sitteth on eggs, and hatcheth them not; so he that getteth riches, and not by right, shall leave them in the midst of his days, and at his end shall be a fool.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A glorious high throne from the beginning is the place of our sanctuary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken the Lord, the fountain of living waters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Heal me, O Lord, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of the Lord? let it come now.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As for me, I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow thee: neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was right before thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Let them be confounded that persecute me, but let not me be confounded: let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed: bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus said the Lord unto me; Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by the which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And say unto them, Hear ye the word of the Lord, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work, but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they obeyed not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive instruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith the Lord, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shall there enter into the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and this city shall remain for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the plain, and from the mountains, and from the south, bringing burnt offerings, and sacrifices, and meat offerings, and incense, and bringing sacrifices of praise, unto the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden, even entering in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Arise, and go down to the potter's house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then I went down to the potter's house, and, behold, he wrought a work on the wheels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the potter: so he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith the Lord. Behold, as the clay is in the potter's hand, so are ye in mine hand, O house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up, and to pull down, and to destroy it;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If it do evil in my sight, that it obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now therefore go to, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and make your ways and your doings good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they said, There is no hope: but we will walk after our own devices, and we will every one do the imagination of his evil heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Ask ye now among the heathen, who hath heard such things: the virgin of Israel hath done a very horrible thing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Will a man leave the snow of Lebanon which cometh from the rock of the field? or shall the cold flowing waters that come from another place be forsaken?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because my people hath forgotten me, they have burned incense to vanity, and they have caused them to stumble in their ways from the ancient paths, to walk in paths, in a way not cast up;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To make their land desolate, and a perpetual hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished, and wag his head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will shew them the back, and not the face, in the day of their calamity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said they, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Give heed to me, O Lord, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul. Remember that I stood before thee to speak good for them, and to turn away thy wrath from them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and pour out their blood by the force of the sword; and let their wives be bereaved of their children, and be widows; and let their men be put to death; let their young men be slain by the sword in battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them: for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet, Lord, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me: forgive not their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from thy sight, but let them be overthrown before thee; deal thus with them in the time of thine anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Go and get a potter's earthen bottle, and take of the ancients of the people, and of the ancients of the priests;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the east gate, and proclaim there the words that I shall tell thee,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And say, Hear ye the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem; Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, the which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, whom neither they nor their fathers have known, nor the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They have built also the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings unto Baal, which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that this place shall no more be called Tophet, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of slaughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hands of them that seek their lives: and their carcases will I give to be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make this city desolate, and an hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss because of all the plagues thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their lives, shall straiten them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a potter's vessel, that cannot be made whole again: and they shall bury them in Tophet, till there be no place to bury.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus will I do unto this place, saith the Lord, and to the inhabitants thereof, and even make this city as Tophet:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, shall be defiled as the place of Tophet, because of all the houses upon whose roofs they have burned incense unto all the host of heaven, and have poured out drink offerings unto other gods.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came Jeremiah from Tophet, whither the Lord had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the Lord's house; and said to all the people,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring upon this city and upon all her towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have hardened their necks, that they might not hear my words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the Lord, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The Lord hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magor-missabib.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived: thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am in derision daily, every one mocketh me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the Lord was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the Lord is with me as a mighty terrible one: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be greatly ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting confusion shall never be forgotten.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But, O Lord of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Sing unto the Lord, praise ye the Lord: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And let that man be as the cities which the Lord overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because he slew me not from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always great with me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the Lord, when king Zedekiah sent unto him Pashur the son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Inquire, I pray thee, of the Lord for us; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon maketh war against us; if so be that the Lord will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may go up from us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord God of Israel; Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans, which besiege you without the walls, and I will assemble them into the midst of this city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in fury, and in great wrath.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will smite the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And afterward, saith the Lord, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, and such as are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall smite them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And unto this people thou shalt say, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I set before you the way of life, and the way of death.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth out, and falleth to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I have set my face against this city for evil, and not for good, saith the Lord: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And touching the house of the king of Judah, say, Hear ye the word of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O house of David, thus saith the Lord; Execute judgment in the morning, and deliver him that is spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my fury go out like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley, and rock of the plain, saith the Lord; which say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, saith the Lord: and I will kindle a fire in the forest thereof, and it shall devour all things round about it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And say, Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy people that enter in by these gates:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Execute ye judgment and righteousness, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widow, neither shed innocent blood in this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith the Lord, that this house shall become a desolation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord unto the king's house of Judah; Thou art Gilead unto me, and the head of Lebanon: yet surely I will make thee a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons: and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every man to his neighbour, Wherefore hath the Lord done thus unto this great city?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then they shall answer, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God, and worshipped other gods, and served them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him: but weep sore for him that goeth away: for he shall return no more, nor see his native country.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord touching Shallum the son of Josiah king of Judah, which reigned instead of Josiah his father, which went forth out of this place; He shall not return thither any more:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But he shall die in the place whither they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by wrong; that useth his neighbour's service without wages, and giveth him not for his work;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: That saith, I will build me a wide house and large chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is ceiled with cedar, and painted with vermilion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shalt thou reign, because thou closest thyself in cedar? did not thy father eat and drink, and do judgment and justice, and then it was well with him?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well with him: was not this to know me? saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But thine eyes and thine heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for to shed innocent blood, and for oppression, and for violence, to do it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah; They shall not lament for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! they shall not lament for him, saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He shall be buried with the burial of an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go up to Lebanon, and cry; and lift up thy voice in Bashan, and cry from the passages: for all thy lovers are destroyed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I spake unto thee in thy prosperity; but thou saidst, I will not hear. This hath been thy manner from thy youth, that thou obeyedst not my voice.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The wind shall eat up all thy pastors, and thy lovers shall go into captivity: surely then shalt thou be ashamed and confounded for all thy wickedness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O inhabitant of Lebanon, that makest thy nest in the cedars, how gracious shalt thou be when pangs come upon thee, the pain as of a woman in travail!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As I live, saith the Lord, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet would I pluck thee thence;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them whose face thou fearest, even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cast thee out, and thy mother that bare thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But to the land whereunto they desire to return, thither shall they not return.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into a land which they know not?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, Write ye this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days: for no man of his seed shall prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling any more in Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Woe be unto the pastors that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God of Israel against the pastors that feed my people; Ye have scattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not visited them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they be lacking, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely: and this is his name whereby he shall be called, The Lord Our Righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that they shall no more say, The Lord liveth, which brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But, The Lord liveth, which brought up and which led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all countries whither I had driven them; and they shall dwell in their own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets; all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath overcome, because of the Lord, and because of the words of his holiness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the land is full of adulterers; for because of swearing the land mourneth; the pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up, and their course is evil, and their force is not right.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For both prophet and priest are profane; yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery ways in the darkness: they shall be driven on, and fall therein: for I will bring evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied in Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies: they strengthen also the hands of evildoers, that none doth return from his wickedness: they are all of them unto me as Sodom, and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets; Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall: for from the prophets of Jerusalem is profaneness gone forth into all the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They say still unto them that despise me, The Lord hath said, Ye shall have peace; and they say unto every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart, No evil shall come upon you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For who hath stood in the counsel of the Lord, and hath perceived and heard his word? who hath marked his word, and heard it?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, a whirlwind of the Lord is gone forth in fury, even a grievous whirlwind: it shall fall grievously upon the head of the wicked.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The anger of the Lord shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran: I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if they had stood in my counsel, and had caused my people to hear my words, then they should have turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Am I a God at hand, saith the Lord, and not a God afar off?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Can any hide himself in secret places that I shall not see him? saith the Lord. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have heard what the prophets said, that prophesy lies in my name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies? yea, they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Which think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbour, as their fathers have forgotten my name for Baal.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the chaff to the wheat? saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is not my word like as a fire? saith the Lord; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am against them that prophesy false dreams, saith the Lord, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their lightness; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them: therefore they shall not profit this people at all, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of the Lord? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of the Lord, I will even punish that man and his house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbour, and every one to his brother, What hath the Lord answered? and, What hath the Lord spoken?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the burden of the Lord shall ye mention no more: for every man's word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of the Lord of hosts our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath the Lord answered thee? and, What hath the Lord spoken?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But since ye say, The burden of the Lord; therefore thus saith the Lord; Because ye say this word, The burden of the Lord, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you, and I will forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and cast you out of my presence:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord shewed me, and, behold, two baskets of figs were set before the temple of the Lord, after that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the carpenters and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: One basket had very good figs, even like the figs that are first ripe: and the other basket had very naughty figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the Lord unto me, What seest thou, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs, very good; and the evil, very evil, that cannot be eaten, they are so evil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Like these good figs, so will I acknowledge them that are carried away captive of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans for their good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I will set mine eyes upon them for good, and I will bring them again to this land: and I will build them, and not pull them down; and I will plant them, and not pluck them up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will give them an heart to know me, that I am the Lord: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God: for they shall return unto me with their whole heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And as the evil figs, which cannot be eaten, they are so evil; surely thus saith the Lord, So will I give Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the residue of Jerusalem, that remain in this land, and them that dwell in the land of Egypt:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will deliver them to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth for their hurt, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places whither I shall drive them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among them, till they be consumed from off the land that I gave unto them and to their fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The which Jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, even unto this day, that is the three and twentieth year, the word of the Lord hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, rising early and speaking; but ye have not hearkened.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Lord hath sent unto you all his servants the prophets, rising early and sending them; but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They said, Turn ye again now every one from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the Lord hath given unto you and to your fathers for ever and ever:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke me not to anger with the works of your hands; and I will do you no hurt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith the Lord; that ye might provoke me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts; Because ye have not heard my words,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith the Lord, and Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about, and will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and an hissing, and perpetual desolations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the candle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And this whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon, and that nation, saith the Lord, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans, and will make it perpetual desolations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of them also: and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the works of their own hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord God of Israel unto me; Take the wine cup of this fury at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall drink, and be moved, and be mad, because of the sword that I will send among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then took I the cup at the Lord's hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom the Lord had sent me:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To wit, Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the kings thereof, and the princes thereof, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, an hissing, and a curse; as it is this day;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his servants, and his princes, and all his people;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the mingled people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and Azzah, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the kings of Tyrus, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the isles which are beyond the sea,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that are in the utmost corners,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mingled people that dwell in the desert,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another, and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the face of the earth: and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Drink ye, and be drunken, and spue, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thine hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Ye shall certainly drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, The Lord shall roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he shall mightily roar upon his habitation; he shall give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A noise shall come even to the ends of the earth; for the Lord hath a controversy with the nations, he will plead with all flesh; he will give them that are wicked to the sword, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great whirlwind shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the slain of the Lord shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Howl, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow yourselves in the ashes, ye principal of the flock: for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions are accomplished; and ye shall fall like a pleasant vessel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A voice of the cry of the shepherds, and an howling of the principal of the flock, shall be heard: for the Lord hath spoiled their pasture.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the peaceable habitations are cut down because of the fierce anger of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He hath forsaken his covert, as the lion: for their land is desolate because of the fierceness of the oppressor, and because of his fierce anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Stand in the court of the Lord's house, and speak unto all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the Lord's house, all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If so be they will hearken, and turn every man from his evil way, that I may repent me of the evil, which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: To hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak unto all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people took him, saying, Thou shalt surely die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why hast thou prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying, This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate without an inhabitant? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When the princes of Judah heard these things, then they came up from the king's house unto the house of the Lord, and sat down in the entry of the new gate of the Lord's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then spake the priests and the prophets unto the princes and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to die; for he hath prophesied against this city, as ye have heard with your ears.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then spake Jeremiah unto all the princes and to all the people, saying, The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore now amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord your God; and the Lord will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But know ye for certain, that if ye put me to death, ye shall surely bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city, and upon the inhabitants thereof: for of a truth the Lord hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the princes and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets; This man is not worthy to die: for he hath spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then rose up certain of the elders of the land, and spake to all the assembly of the people, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spake to all the people of Judah, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Zion shall be plowed like a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death? did he not fear the Lord, and besought the Lord, and the Lord repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And there was also a man that prophesied in the name of the Lord, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men, and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death: but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, namely, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him into Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they fetched forth Urijah out of Egypt, and brought him unto Jehoiakim the king; who slew him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word unto Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord to me; Make thee bonds and yokes, and put them upon thy neck,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the Ammonites, and to the king of Tyrus, and to the king of Zidon, by the hand of the messengers which come to Jerusalem unto Zedekiah king of Judah;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And command them to say unto their masters, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say unto your masters;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my outstretched arm, and have given it unto whom it seemed meet unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now have I given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant; and the beasts of the field have I given him also to serve him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all nations shall serve him, and his son, and his son's son, until the very time of his land come: and then many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation will I punish, saith the Lord, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
