column17: Therefore hearken not ye to your prophets, nor to your diviners, nor to your dreamers, nor to your enchanters, nor to your sorcerers, which speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For they prophesy a lie unto you, to remove you far from your land; and that I should drive you out, and ye should perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the nations that bring their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him, those will I let remain still in their own land, saith the Lord; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I spake also to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why will ye die, thou and thy people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the Lord hath spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I have not sent them, saith the Lord, yet they prophesy a lie in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also I spake to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Hearken not to the words of your prophets that prophesy unto you, saying, Behold, the vessels of the Lord's house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hearken not unto them; serve the king of Babylon, and live: wherefore should this city be laid waste?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if they be prophets, and if the word of the Lord be with them, let them now make intercession to the Lord of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, go not to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts concerning the pillars, and concerning the sea, and concerning the bases, and concerning the residue of the vessels that remain in this city,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took not, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yea, thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be until the day that I visit them, saith the Lord; then will I bring them up, and restore them to this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, which was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of the Lord, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of the Lord's house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried them to Babylon:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went into Babylon, saith the Lord: for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of the Lord,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: the Lord do so: the Lord perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of the Lord's house, and all that is carried away captive, from Babylon into this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied both against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The prophet which prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that the Lord hath truly sent him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet Jeremiah's neck, and brake it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah the prophet, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Thou hast broken the yokes of wood; but thou shalt make for them yokes of iron.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The Lord hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will cast thee from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast taught rebellion against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem unto the residue of the elders which were carried away captives, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: (After that Jeconiah the king, and the queen, and the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the carpenters, and the smiths, were departed from Jerusalem;)

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: By the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, (whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent unto Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon) saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, unto all that are carried away captives, whom I have caused to be carried away from Jerusalem unto Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take ye wives, and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters; that ye may be increased there, and not diminished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captives, and pray unto the Lord for it: for in the peace thereof shall ye have peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Let not your prophets and your diviners, that be in the midst of you, deceive you, neither hearken to your dreams which ye cause to be dreamed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For they prophesy falsely unto you in my name: I have not sent them, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, That after seventy years be accomplished at Babylon I will visit you, and perform my good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me with all your heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will be found of you, saith the Lord: and I will turn away your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places whither I have driven you, saith the Lord; and I will bring you again into the place whence I caused you to be carried away captive.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because ye have said, The Lord hath raised us up prophets in Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Know that thus saith the Lord of the king that sitteth upon the throne of David, and of all the people that dwelleth in this city, and of your brethren that are not gone forth with you into captivity;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Behold, I will send upon them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so evil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will persecute them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be removed to all the kingdoms of the earth, to be a curse, and an astonishment, and an hissing, and a reproach, among all the nations whither I have driven them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because they have not hearkened to my words, saith the Lord, which I sent unto them by my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but ye would not hear, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear ye therefore the word of the Lord, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, of Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and of Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, which prophesy a lie unto you in my name; Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall slay them before your eyes;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captivity of Judah which are in Babylon, saying, The Lord make thee like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because they have committed villany in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbours' wives, and have spoken lying words in my name, which I have not commanded them; even I know, and am a witness, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus shalt thou also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Because thou hast sent letters in thy name unto all the people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath made thee priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest, that ye should be officers in the house of the Lord, for every man that is mad, and maketh himself a prophet, that thou shouldest put him in prison, and in the stocks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now therefore why hast thou not reproved Jeremiah of Anathoth, which maketh himself a prophet to you?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For therefore he sent unto us in Babylon, saying, This captivity is long: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith the Lord concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite; Because that Shemaiah hath prophesied unto you, and I sent him not, and he caused you to trust in a lie:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and his seed: he shall not have a man to dwell among this people; neither shall he behold the good that I will do for my people, saith the Lord; because he hath taught rebellion against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus speaketh the Lord God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, lo, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the Lord: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And these are the words that the Lord spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they shall serve the Lord their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I am with thee, saith the Lord, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the Lord; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob's tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The fierce anger of the Lord shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At the same time, saith the Lord, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, The people which were left of the sword found grace in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: thou shalt again be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou shalt yet plant vines upon the mountains of Samaria: the planters shall plant, and shall eat them as common things.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the mount Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout among the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O Lord, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the coasts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall return thither.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall come with weeping, and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way, wherein they shall not stumble: for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my firstborn.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Hear the word of the Lord, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off, and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the Lord hath redeemed Jacob, and ransomed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow together to the goodness of the Lord, for wheat, and for wine, and for oil, and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, both young men and old together: for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children, because they were not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears: for thy work shall be rewarded, saith the Lord; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And there is hope in thine end, saith the Lord, that thy children shall come again to their own border.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus; Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the Lord my God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child? for since I spake against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my bowels are troubled for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps: set thine heart toward the highway, even the way which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How long wilt thou go about, O thou backsliding daughter? for the Lord hath created a new thing in the earth, A woman shall compass a man.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; As yet they shall use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity; The Lord bless thee, O habitation of justice, and mountain of holiness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all the cities thereof together, husbandmen, and they that go forth with flocks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that like as I have watched over them, to pluck up, and to break down, and to throw down, and to destroy, and to afflict; so will I watch over them, to build, and to plant, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children's teeth are set on edge.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grape, his teeth shall be set on edge.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was an husband unto them, saith the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But this shall be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel; After those days, saith the Lord, I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts; and will be their God, and they shall be my people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the Lord: for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, which giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, which divideth the sea when the waves thereof roar; The Lord of hosts is his name:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If those ordinances depart from before me, saith the Lord, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, I will also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that the city shall be built to the Lord from the tower of Hananeel unto the gate of the corner.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the measuring line shall yet go forth over against it upon the hill Gareb, and shall compass about to Goath.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the whole valley of the dead bodies, and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook of Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto the Lord; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For then the king of Babylon's army besieged Jerusalem: and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison, which was in the king of Judah's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And he shall lead Zedekiah to Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith the Lord: though ye fight with the Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Jeremiah said, The word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, Hanameel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that is in Anathoth: for the right of redemption is thine to buy it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Hanameel mine uncle's son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the Lord, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the country of Benjamin: for the right of inheritance is thine, and the redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I bought the field of Hanameel my uncle's son, that was in Anathoth, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I subscribed the evidence, and sealed it, and took witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So I took the evidence of the purchase, both that which was sealed according to the law and custom, and that which was open:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I gave the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, in the sight of Hanameel mine uncle's son, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the book of the purchase, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the prison.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I charged Baruch before them, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Take these evidences, this evidence of the purchase, both which is sealed, and this evidence which is open; and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may continue many days.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now when I had delivered the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed unto the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Ah Lord God! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power and stretched out arm, and there is nothing too hard for thee:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou shewest lovingkindness unto thousands, and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them: the Great, the Mighty God, the Lord of hosts, is his name,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Great in counsel, and mighty in work: for thine eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Which hast set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even unto this day, and in Israel, and among other men; and hast made thee a name, as at this day;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And hast brought forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with great terror;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And hast given them this land, which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they came in, and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice, neither walked in thy law; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold the mounts, they are come unto the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans, that fight against it, because of the sword, and of the famine, and of the pestilence: and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and, behold, thou seest it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou hast said unto me, O Lord God, Buy thee the field for money, and take witnesses; for the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set fire on this city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have only done evil before me from their youth: for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For this city hath been to me as a provocation of mine anger and of my fury from the day that they built it even unto this day; that I should remove it from before my face,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they have turned unto me the back, and not the face: though I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not hearkened to receive instruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they set their abominations in the house, which is called by my name, to defile it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire unto Molech; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now therefore thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning this city, whereof ye say, It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will gather them out of all countries, whither I have driven them in mine anger, and in my fury, and in great wrath; and I will bring them again unto this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall be my people, and I will be their God:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will give them one heart, and one way, that they may fear me for ever, for the good of them, and of their children after them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from them, to do them good; but I will put my fear in their hearts, that they shall not depart from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yea, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And fields shall be bought in this land, whereof ye say, It is desolate without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Men shall buy fields for money, and subscribe evidences, and seal them, and take witnesses in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, and in the cities of the mountains, and in the cities of the valley, and in the cities of the south: for I will cause their captivity to return, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah the second time, while he was yet shut up in the court of the prison, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord the maker thereof, the Lord that formed it, to establish it; the Lord is his name;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are thrown down by the mounts, and by the sword;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They come to fight with the Chaldeans, but it is to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have slain in mine anger and in my fury, and for all whose wickedness I have hid my face from this city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them, and will reveal unto them the abundance of peace and truth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cause the captivity of Judah and the captivity of Israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, whereby they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, whereby they have sinned, and whereby they have transgressed against me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do unto them: and they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure unto it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Again there shall be heard in this place, which ye say shall be desolate without man and without beast, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man, and without inhabitant, and without beast,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The voice of joy, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the voice of them that shall say, Praise the Lord of hosts: for the Lord is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: and of them that shall bring the sacrifice of praise into the house of the Lord. For I will cause to return the captivity of the land, as at the first, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Again in this place, which is desolate without man and without beast, and in all the cities thereof, shall be an habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the vale, and in the cities of the south, and in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, shall the flocks pass again under the hands of him that telleth them, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will perform that good thing which I have promised unto the house of Israel and to the house of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days, and at that time, will I cause the Branch of righteousness to grow up unto David; and he shall execute judgment and righteousness in the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days shall Judah be saved, and Jerusalem shall dwell safely: and this is the name wherewith she shall be called, The Lord our righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; David shall never want a man to sit upon the throne of the house of Israel;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither shall the priests the Levites want a man before me to offer burnt offerings, and to kindle meat offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; If ye can break my covenant of the day, and my covenant of the night, and that there should not be day and night in their season;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then may also my covenant be broken with David my servant, that he should not have a son to reign upon his throne; and with the Levites the priests, my ministers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured: so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites that minister unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Considerest thou not what this people have spoken, saying, The two families which the Lord hath chosen, he hath even cast them off? thus they have despised my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; If my covenant be not with day and night, and if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then will I cast away the seed of Jacob, and David my servant, so that I will not take any of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to return, and have mercy on them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the Lord, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth of his dominion, and all the people, fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities thereof, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou shalt not escape out of his hand, but shalt surely be taken, and delivered into his hand; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and thou shalt go to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet hear the word of the Lord, O Zedekiah king of Judah; Thus saith the Lord of thee, Thou shalt not die by the sword:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But thou shalt die in peace: and with the burnings of thy fathers, the former kings which were before thee, so shall they burn odours for thee; and they will lament thee, saying, Ah lord! for I have pronounced the word, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah the prophet spake all these words unto Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When the king of Babylon's army fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish, and against Azekah: for these defenced cities remained of the cities of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: This is the word that came unto Jeremiah from the Lord, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people which were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty unto them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: That every man should let his manservant, and every man his maidservant, being an Hebrew or an Hebrewess, go free; that none should serve himself of them, to wit, of a Jew his brother.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now when all the princes, and all the people, which had entered into the covenant, heard that every one should let his manservant, and every one his maidservant, go free, that none should serve themselves of them any more, then they obeyed, and let them go.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But afterward they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondmen, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At the end of seven years let ye go every man his brother an Hebrew, which hath been sold unto thee; and when he hath served thee six years, thou shalt let him go free from thee: but your fathers hearkened not unto me, neither inclined their ear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And ye were now turned, and had done right in my sight, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbour; and ye had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But ye turned and polluted my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom ye had set at liberty at their pleasure, to return, and brought them into subjection, to be unto you for servants and for handmaids.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Ye have not hearkened unto me, in proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother, and every man to his neighbour: behold, I proclaim a liberty for you, saith the Lord, to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will give the men that have transgressed my covenant, which have not performed the words of the covenant which they had made before me, when they cut the calf in twain, and passed between the parts thereof,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, which passed between the parts of the calf;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies shall be for meat unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon's army, which are gone up from you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will command, saith the Lord, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the Lord in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go unto the house of the Rechabites, and speak unto them, and bring them into the house of the Lord, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habaziniah, and his brethren, and all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I brought them into the house of the Lord, into the chamber of the sons of Hanan, the son of Igdaliah, a man of God, which was by the chamber of the princes, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the door:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites pots full of wine, and cups, and I said unto them, Drink ye wine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they said, We will drink no wine: for Jonadab the son of Rechab our father commanded us, saying, Ye shall drink no wine, neither ye, nor your sons for ever:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Neither shall ye build house, nor sow seed, nor plant vineyard, nor have any: but all your days ye shall dwell in tents; that ye may live many days in the land where ye be strangers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus have we obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab our father in all that he hath charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, nor our daughters;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nor to build houses for us to dwell in: neither have we vineyard, nor field, nor seed:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed, and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But it came to pass, when Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, that we said, Come, and let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans, and for fear of the army of the Syrians: so we dwell at Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, Will ye not receive instruction to hearken to my words? saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, that he commanded his sons not to drink wine, are performed; for unto this day they drink none, but obey their father's commandment: notwithstanding I have spoken unto you, rising early and speaking; but ye hearkened not unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have sent also unto you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Return ye now every man from his evil way, and amend your doings, and go not after other gods to serve them, and ye shall dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers: but ye have not inclined your ear, nor hearkened unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father, which he commanded them; but this people hath not hearkened unto me:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring upon Judah and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them: because I have spoken unto them, but they have not heard; and I have called unto them, but they have not answered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Jeremiah said unto the house of the Rechabites, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Because ye have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts, and done according unto all that he hath commanded you:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not want a man to stand before me for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that this word came unto Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the words that I have spoken unto thee against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the days of Josiah, even unto this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I purpose to do unto them; that they may return every man from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah: and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the Lord, which he had spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore go thou, and read in the roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the words of the Lord in the ears of the people in the Lord's house upon the fasting day: and also thou shalt read them in the ears of all Judah that come out of their cities.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: It may be they will present their supplication before the Lord, and will return every one from his evil way: for great is the anger and the fury that the Lord hath pronounced against this people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the words of the Lord in the Lord's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the Lord to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then read Baruch in the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the Lord, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the higher court, at the entry of the new gate of the Lord's house, in the ears of all the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the words of the Lord,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then he went down into the king's house, into the scribe's chamber: and, lo, all the princes sat there, even Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Michaiah declared unto them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, unto Baruch, saying, Take in thine hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they said unto him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they were afraid both one and other, and said unto Baruch, We will surely tell the king of all these words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Baruch answered them, He pronounced all these words unto me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said the princes unto Baruch, Go, hide thee, thou and Jeremiah; and let no man know where ye be.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they went in to the king into the court, but they laid up the roll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the ears of the king.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the roll: and he took it out of Elishama the scribe's chamber. And Jehudi read it in the ears of the king, and in the ears of all the princes which stood beside the king.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now the king sat in the winterhouse in the ninth month: and there was a fire on the hearth burning before him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass, that when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, he cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the king, nor any of his servants that heard all these words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nevertheless Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the roll: but he would not hear them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the king commanded Jerahmeel the son of Hammelech, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet: but the Lord hid them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take thee again another roll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah hath burned.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou shalt say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, Thus saith the Lord; Thou hast burned this roll, saying, Why hast thou written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from thence man and beast?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of Jehoiakim king of Judah; He shall have none to sit upon the throne of David: and his dead body shall be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them; but they hearkened not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then took Jeremiah another roll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah; who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire: and there were added besides unto them many like words.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the Lord, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto the Lord our God for us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had not put him into prison.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Pharaoh's army was come forth out of Egypt: and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah, that sent you unto me to inquire of me; Behold, Pharaoh's army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city, and take it, and burn it with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Deceive not yourselves, saying, The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us: for they shall not depart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded men among them, yet should they rise up every man in his tent, and burn this city with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh's army,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to separate himself thence in the midst of the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when he was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he took Jeremiah the prophet, saying, Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe: for they had made that the prison.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When Jeremiah was entered into the dungeon, and into the cabins, and Jeremiah had remained there many days;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took him out: and the king asked him secretly in his house, and said, Is there any word from the Lord? And Jeremiah said, There is: for, said he, thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah, What have I offended against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Where are now your prophets which prophesied unto you, saying, The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hear now, I pray thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be accepted before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah into the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread out of the bakers' street, until all the bread in the city were spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Shephatiah the son of Mattan, and Gedaliah the son of Pashur, and Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashur the son of Malchiah, heard the words that Jeremiah had spoken unto all the people, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, He that remaineth in this city shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth forth to the Chaldeans shall live; for he shall have his life for a prey, and shall live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, This city shall surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon's army, which shall take it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore the princes said unto the king, We beseech thee, let this man be put to death: for thus he weakeneth the hands of the men of war that remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, in speaking such words unto them: for this man seeketh not the welfare of this people, but the hurt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Zedekiah the king said, Behold, he is in your hand: for the king is not he that can do any thing against you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then took they Jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the son of Hammelech, that was in the court of the prison: and they let down Jeremiah with cords. And in the dungeon there was no water, but mire: so Jeremiah sunk in the mire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now when Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, one of the eunuchs which was in the king's house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon; the king then sitting in the gate of Benjamin;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Ebed-melech went forth out of the king's house, and spake to the king, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon; and he is like to die for hunger in the place where he is: for there is no more bread in the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Take from hence thirty men with thee, and take up Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon, before he die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Ebed-melech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took thence old cast clouts and old rotten rags, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Ebed-melech the Ethiopian said unto Jeremiah, Put now these old cast clouts and rotten rags under thine armholes under the cords. And Jeremiah did so.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So they drew up Jeremiah with cords, and took him up out of the dungeon: and Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took Jeremiah the prophet unto him into the third entry that is in the house of the Lord: and the king said unto Jeremiah, I will ask thee a thing; hide nothing from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah said unto Zedekiah, If I declare it unto thee, wilt thou not surely put me to death? and if I give thee counsel, wilt thou not hearken unto me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Zedekiah the king sware secretly unto Jeremiah, saying, As the Lord liveth, that made us this soul, I will not put thee to death, neither will I give thee into the hand of these men that seek thy life.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said Jeremiah unto Zedekiah, Thus saith the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel; If thou wilt assuredly go forth unto the king of Babylon's princes, then thy soul shall live, and this city shall not be burned with fire; and thou shalt live, and thine house:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if thou wilt not go forth to the king of Babylon's princes, then shall this city be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they shall burn it with fire, and thou shalt not escape out of their hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Zedekiah the king said unto Jeremiah, I am afraid of the Jews that are fallen to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Jeremiah said, They shall not deliver thee. Obey, I beseech thee, the voice of the Lord, which I speak unto thee: so it shall be well unto thee, and thy soul shall live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if thou refuse to go forth, this is the word that the Lord hath shewed me:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And, behold, all the women that are left in the king of Judah's house shall be brought forth to the king of Babylon's princes, and those women shall say, Thy friends have set thee on, and have prevailed against thee: thy feet are sunk in the mire, and they are turned away back.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So they shall bring out all thy wives and thy children to the Chaldeans: and thou shalt not escape out of their hand, but shalt be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon: and thou shalt cause this city to be burned with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then said Zedekiah unto Jeremiah, Let no man know of these words, and thou shalt not die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if the princes hear that I have talked with thee, and they come unto thee, and say unto thee, Declare unto us now what thou hast said unto the king, hide it not from us, and we will not put thee to death; also what the king said unto thee:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then thou shalt say unto them, I presented my supplication before the king, that he would not cause me to return to Jonathan's house, to die there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came all the princes unto Jeremiah, and asked him: and he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they left off speaking with him; for the matter was not perceived.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Jeremiah abode in the court of the prison until the day that Jerusalem was taken: and he was there when Jerusalem was taken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and they besieged it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, the city was broken up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, even Nergal-sharezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim, Rab-saris, Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, with all the residue of the princes of the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass, that when Zedekiah the king of Judah saw them, and all the men of war, then they fled, and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the king's garden, by the gate betwixt the two walls: and he went out the way of the plain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the Chaldeans' army pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he gave judgment upon him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes: also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the Chaldeans burned the king's house, and the houses of the people, with fire, and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to him, with the rest of the people that remained.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, which had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushasban, Rab-saris, and Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, and all the king of Babylon's princes;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Even they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the prison, and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, that he should carry him home: so he dwelt among the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the prison, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished in that day before thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith the Lord: and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee: because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, after that Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all that were carried away captive of Jerusalem and Judah, which were carried away captive unto Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said unto him, The Lord thy God hath pronounced this evil upon this place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now the Lord hath brought it, and done according as he hath said: because ye have sinned against the Lord, and have not obeyed his voice, therefore this thing is come upon you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now, behold, I loose thee this day from the chains which were upon thine hand. If it seem good unto thee to come with me into Babylon, come; and I will look well unto thee: but if it seem ill unto thee to come with me into Babylon, forbear: behold, all the land is before thee: whither it seemeth good and convenient for thee to go, thither go.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now while he was not yet gone back, he said, Go back also to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon hath made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people: or go wheresoever it seemeth convenient unto thee to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victuals and a reward, and let him go.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then went Jeremiah unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and dwelt with him among the people that were left in the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now when all the captains of the forces which were in the fields, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed unto him men, and women, and children, and of the poor of the land, of them that were not carried away captive to Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan sware unto them and to their men, saying, Fear not to serve the Chaldeans: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah to serve the Chaldeans, which will come unto us: but ye, gather ye wine, and summer fruits, and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that ye have taken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Likewise when all the Jews that were in Moab, and among the Ammonites, and in Edom, and that were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Even all the Jews returned out of all places whither they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, unto Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And said unto him, Dost thou certainly know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites hath sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to slay thee? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam believed them not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
