column17: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spake to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, Let me go, I pray thee, and I will slay Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man shall know it: wherefore should he slay thee, that all the Jews which are gathered unto thee should be scattered, and the remnant in Judah perish?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said unto Johanan the son of Kareah, Thou shalt not do this thing: for thou speakest falsely of Ishmael.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, and the princes of the king, even ten men with him, came unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they did eat bread together in Mizpah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then arose Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and the ten men that were with him, and smote Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword, and slew him, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with him, even with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans that were found there, and the men of war.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass the second day after he had slain Gedaliah, and no man knew it,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: That there came certain from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even fourscore men, having their beards shaven, and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met them, he said unto them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah slew them, and cast them into the midst of the pit, he, and the men that were with him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But ten men were found among them that said unto Ishmael, Slay us not: for we have treasures in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey. So he forbare, and slew them not among their brethren.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now the pit wherein Ishmael had cast all the dead bodies of the men, whom he had slain because of Gedaliah, was it which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with them that were slain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the residue of the people that were in Mizpah, even the king's daughters, and all the people that remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the Ammonites.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then they took all the men, and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now it came to pass, that when all the people which were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, then they were glad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah cast about and returned, and went unto Johanan the son of Kareah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, even mighty men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought again from Gibeon:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they departed, and dwelt in the habitation of Chimham, which is by Beth-lehem, to go to enter into Egypt,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because of the Chaldeans: for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor in the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we beseech thee, our supplication be accepted before thee, and pray for us unto the Lord thy God, even for all this remnant; (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us:)

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: That the Lord thy God may shew us the way wherein we may walk, and the thing that we may do.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto the Lord your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass, that whatsoever thing the Lord shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then they said to Jeremiah, The Lord be a true and faithful witness between us, if we do not even according to all things for the which the Lord thy God shall send thee to us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of the Lord our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces which were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And said unto them, Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up: for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith the Lord: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will shew mercies unto you, that he may have mercy upon you, and cause you to return to your own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land, neither obey the voice of the Lord your God,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Saying, No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now therefore hear the word of the Lord, ye remnant of Judah; Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; If ye wholly set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye feared, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine, whereof ye were afraid, shall follow close after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence: and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; As mine anger and my fury hath been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem; so shall my fury be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt: and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath said concerning you, O ye remnant of Judah; Go ye not into Egypt: know certainly that I have admonished you this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For ye dissembled in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the Lord your God, saying, Pray for us unto the Lord our God; and according unto all that the Lord our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And now I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of the Lord your God, nor any thing for the which he hath sent me unto you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go and to sojourn.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass, that when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of the Lord their God, for which the Lord their God had sent him to them, even all these words,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou speakest falsely: the Lord our God hath not sent thee to say, Go not into Egypt to sojourn there:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, for to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they might put us to death, and carry us away captives into Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of the Lord, to dwell in the land of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from all nations, whither they had been driven, to dwell in the land of Judah;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Even men, and women, and children, and the king's daughters, and every person that Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So they came into the land of Egypt: for they obeyed not the voice of the Lord: thus came they even to Tahpanhes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Take great stones in thine hand, and hide them in the clay in the brickkiln, which is at the entry of Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when he cometh, he shall smite the land of Egypt, and deliver such as are for death to death; and such as are for captivity to captivity; and such as are for the sword to the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captives: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He shall break also the images of Beth-shemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians shall he burn with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews which dwell in the land of Egypt, which dwell at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Noph, and in the country of Pathros, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no man dwelleth therein,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense, and to serve other gods, whom they knew not, neither they, ye, nor your fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Howbeit I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, rising early and sending them, saying, Oh, do not this abominable thing that I hate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore my fury and mine anger was poured forth, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as at this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore now thus saith the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel; Wherefore commit ye this great evil against your souls, to cut off from you man and woman, child and suckling, out of Judah, to leave you none to remain;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In that ye provoke me unto wrath with the works of your hands, burning incense unto other gods in the land of Egypt, whither ye be gone to dwell, that ye might cut yourselves off, and that ye might be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Have ye forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they have committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are not humbled even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, and to cut off all Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed, and fall in the land of Egypt; they shall even be consumed by the sword and by the famine: they shall die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine: and they shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So that none of the remnant of Judah, which are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall escape or remain, that they should return into the land of Judah, to the which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return but such as shall escape.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then all the men which knew that their wives had burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great multitude, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the Lord, we will not hearken unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But we will certainly do whatsoever thing goeth forth out of our own mouth, to burn incense unto the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto her, as we have done, we, and our fathers, our kings, and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem: for then had we plenty of victuals, and were well, and saw no evil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But since we left off to burn incense to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto her, we have wanted all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven, and poured out drink offerings unto her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink offerings unto her, without our men?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, and to all the people which had given him that answer, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The incense that ye burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye, and your fathers, your kings, and your princes, and the people of the land, did not the Lord remember them, and came it not into his mind?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So that the Lord could no longer bear, because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have committed; therefore is your land a desolation, and an astonishment, and a curse, without an inhabitant, as at this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because ye have burned incense, and because ye have sinned against the Lord, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil is happened unto you, as at this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the women, Hear the word of the Lord, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying; Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and fulfilled with your hand, saying, We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto her: ye will surely accomplish your vows, and surely perform your vows.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hear ye the word of the Lord, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt; Behold, I have sworn by my great name, saith the Lord, that my name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, The Lord God liveth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will watch over them for evil, and not for good: and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet a small number that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, and all the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose words shall stand, mine, or theirs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And this shall be a sign unto you, saith the Lord, that I will punish you in this place, that ye may know that my words shall surely stand against you for evil:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will give Pharaoh-hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of them that seek his life; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, his enemy, and that sought his life.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for the Lord hath added grief to my sorrow; I fainted in my sighing, and I find no rest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus shalt thou say unto him, The Lord saith thus; Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up, even this whole land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not: for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith the Lord: but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Against Egypt, against the army of Pharaoh-necho king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Harness the horses; and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, and put on the brigandines.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore have I seen them dismayed and turned away back? and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not back: for fear was round about, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; they shall stumble, and fall toward the north by the river Euphrates.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Who is this that cometh up as a flood, whose waters are moved as the rivers?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Egypt riseth up like a flood, and his waters are moved like the rivers; and he saith, I will go up, and will cover the earth; I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men come forth; the Ethiopians and the Libyans, that handle the shield; and the Lydians, that handle and bend the bow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For this is the day of the Lord God of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries: and the sword shall devour, and it shall be satiate and made drunk with their blood: for the Lord God of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of Egypt: in vain shalt thou use many medicines; for thou shalt not be cured.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The nations have heard of thy shame, and thy cry hath filled the land: for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, and they are fallen both together.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that the Lord spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Noph and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand fast, and prepare thee; for the sword shall devour round about thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Why are thy valiant men swept away? they stood not, because the Lord did drive them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He made many to fall, yea, one fell upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They did cry there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath passed the time appointed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As I live, saith the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts, Surely as Tabor is among the mountains, and as Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity: for Noph shall be waste and desolate without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Egypt is like a very fair heifer, but destruction cometh; it cometh out of the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also her hired men are in the midst of her like fatted bullocks; for they also are turned back, and are fled away together: they did not stand, because the day of their calamity was come upon them, and the time of their visitation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The voice thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall cut down her forest, saith the Lord, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the grasshoppers, and are innumerable.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saith; Behold, I will punish the multitude of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with their gods, and their kings; even Pharaoh, and all them that trust in him:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants: and afterward it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But fear not thou, O my servant Jacob, and be not dismayed, O Israel: for, behold, I will save thee from afar off, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and be in rest and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith the Lord: for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but correct thee in measure; yet will I not leave thee wholly unpunished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall be an overflowing flood, and shall overflow the land, and all that is therein; the city, and them that dwell therein: then the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall howl.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong horses, at the rushing of his chariots, and at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers shall not look back to their children for feebleness of hands;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because of the day that cometh to spoil all the Philistines, and to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remaineth: for the Lord will spoil the Philistines, the remnant of the country of Caphtor.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is cut off with the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O thou sword of the Lord, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard, rest, and be still.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How can it be quiet, seeing the Lord hath given it a charge against Ashkelon, and against the sea shore? there hath he appointed it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Against Moab thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Woe unto Nebo! for it is spoiled: Kiriathaim is confounded and taken: Misgab is confounded and dismayed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: There shall be no more praise of Moab: in Heshbon they have devised evil against it; come, and let us cut it off from being a nation. Also thou shalt be cut down, O Madmen; the sword shall pursue thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A voice of crying shall be from Horonaim, spoiling and great destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For in the going up of Luhith continual weeping shall go up; for in the going down of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou shalt also be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity with his priests and his princes together.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the spoiler shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape: the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed, as the Lord hath spoken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Give wings unto Moab, that it may flee and get away: for the cities thereof shall be desolate, without any to dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Cursed be he that doeth the work of the Lord deceitfully, and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moab hath been at ease from his youth, and he hath settled on his lees, and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither hath he gone into captivity: therefore his taste remained in him, and his scent is not changed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will send unto him wanderers, that shall cause him to wander, and shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How say ye, We are mighty and strong men for the war?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moab is spoiled, and gone up out of her cities, and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, saith the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hasteth fast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: All ye that are about him, bemoan him; and all ye that know his name, say, How is the strong staff broken, and the beautiful rod!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou daughter that dost inhabit Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of Moab shall come upon thee, and he shall destroy thy strong holds.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way, and espy; ask him that fleeth, and her that escapeth, and say, What is done?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moab is confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in Arnon, that Moab is spoiled,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And judgment is come upon the plain country; upon Holon, and upon Jahazah, and upon Mephaath,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Make ye him drunken: for he magnified himself against the Lord: Moab also shall wallow in his vomit, and he also shall be in derision.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves? for since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O ye that dwell in Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock, and be like the dove that maketh her nest in the sides of the hole's mouth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We have heard the pride of Moab, (he is exceeding proud) his loftiness, and his arrogancy, and his pride, and the haughtiness of his heart.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I know his wrath, saith the Lord; but it shall not be so; his lies shall not so effect it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore will I howl for Moab, and I will cry out for all Moab; mine heart shall mourn for the men of Kir-heres.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O vine of Sibmah, I will weep for thee with the weeping of Jazer: thy plants are gone over the sea, they reach even to the sea of Jazer: the spoiler is fallen upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And joy and gladness is taken from the plentiful field, and from the land of Moab; and I have caused wine to fail from the winepresses: none shall tread with shouting; their shouting shall be no shouting.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: From the cry of Heshbon even unto Elealeh, and even unto Jahaz, have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even unto Horonaim, as an heifer of three years old: for the waters also of Nimrim shall be desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith the Lord, him that offereth in the high places, and him that burneth incense to his gods.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore mine heart shall sound for Moab like pipes, and mine heart shall sound like pipes for the men of Kir-heres: because the riches that he hath gotten are perished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For every head shall be bald, and every beard clipped: upon all the hands shall be cuttings, and upon the loins sackcloth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: There shall be lamentation generally upon all the housetops of Moab, and in the streets thereof: for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein is no pleasure, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall howl, saying, How is it broken down! how hath Moab turned the back with shame! so shall Moab be a derision and a dismaying to all them about him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; Behold, he shall fly as an eagle, and shall spread his wings over Moab.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Kerioth is taken, and the strong holds are surprised, and the mighty men's hearts in Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, shall be upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for I will bring upon it, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They that fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon because of the force: but a fire shall come forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and shall devour the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Woe be unto thee, O Moab! the people of Chemosh perisheth: for thy sons are taken captives, and thy daughters captives.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Yet will I bring again the captivity of Moab in the latter days, saith the Lord. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the Lord; Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord God of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Concerning Edom, thus saith the Lord of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I will visit him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord; Behold, they whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I have sworn by myself, saith the Lord, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have heard a rumour from the Lord, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised among men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the Lord, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hear the counsel of the Lord, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Damascus is waxed feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Ben-hadad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the Lord; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear is on every side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the Lord; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the Lord, which have neither gates nor bars, which dwell alone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them that are in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, and a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith the Lord; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word that the Lord spake against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Declare ye among the nations, and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and conceal not: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is confounded, Merodach is broken in pieces; her idols are confounded, her images are broken in pieces.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they shall remove, they shall depart, both man and beast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days, and in that time, saith the Lord, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together, going and weeping: they shall go, and seek the Lord their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall ask the way to Zion with their faces thitherward, saying, Come, and let us join ourselves to the Lord in a perpetual covenant that shall not be forgotten.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: My people hath been lost sheep: their shepherds have caused them to go astray, they have turned them away on the mountains: they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their restingplace.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the Lord, the habitation of justice, even the Lord, the hope of their fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Remove out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he goats before the flocks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For, lo, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country: and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken: their arrows shall be as of a mighty expert man; none shall return in vain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Chaldea shall be a spoil: all that spoil her shall be satisfied, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced, O ye destroyers of mine heritage, because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, and bellow as bulls;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Your mother shall be sore confounded; she that bare you shall be ashamed: behold, the hindermost of the nations shall be a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because of the wrath of the Lord it shall not be inhabited, but it shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Put yourselves in array against Babylon round about: all ye that bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Shout against her round about: she hath given her hand: her foundations are fallen, her walls are thrown down: for it is the vengeance of the Lord: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done, do unto her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Israel is a scattered sheep; the lions have driven him away: first the king of Assyria hath devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will bring Israel again to his habitation, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In those days, and in that time, saith the Lord, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I reserve.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the Lord, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware: thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath opened his armoury, and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation: for this is the work of the Lord God of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Come against her from the utmost border, open her storehouses: cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly: let nothing of her be left.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the Lord our God, the vengeance of his temple.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Call together the archers against Babylon: all ye that bend the bow, camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she hath done, do unto her: for she hath been proud against the Lord, against the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore shall her young men fall in the streets, and all her men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord God of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the most proud shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all round about him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; The children of Israel and the children of Judah were oppressed together: and all that took them captives held them fast; they refused to let them go.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Their Redeemer is strong; the Lord of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith the Lord, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A sword is upon the liars; and they shall dote: a sword is upon her mighty men; and they shall be dismayed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women: a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be robbed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dried up: for it is the land of graven images, and they are mad upon their idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell there, and the owls shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the Lord; so shall no man abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, a people shall come from the north, and a great nation, and many kings shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall hold the bow and the lance: they are cruel, and will not shew mercy: their voice shall roar like the sea, and they shall ride upon horses, every one put in array, like a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, and his hands waxed feeble: anguish took hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the habitation of the strong: but I will make them suddenly run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the Lord, that he hath taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitation desolate with them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved, and the cry is heard among the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me, a destroying wind;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And will send unto Babylon fanners, that shall fan her, and shall empty her land: for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Against him that bendeth let the archer bend his bow, and against him that lifteth himself up in his brigandine: and spare ye not her young men; destroy ye utterly all her host.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and they that are thrust through in her streets.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For Israel hath not been forsaken, nor Judah of his God, of the Lord of hosts; though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the Lord's vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Babylon hath been a golden cup in the Lord's hand, that made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunken of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the Lord hath raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes: for his device is against Babylon, to destroy it; because it is the vengeance of the Lord, the vengeance of his temple.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Set up the standard upon the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set up the watchmen, prepare the ambushes: for the Lord hath both devised and done that which he spake against the inhabitants of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, and the measure of thy covetousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The Lord of hosts hath sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men, as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a shout against thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heaven by his understanding.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens; and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth: he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Every man is brutish by his knowledge; every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They are vanity, the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for he is the former of all things: and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: the Lord of hosts is his name.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thou art my battle axe and weapons of war: for with thee will I break in pieces the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And with thee will I break in pieces the horse and his rider; and with thee will I break in pieces the chariot and his rider;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: With thee also will I break in pieces man and woman; and with thee will I break in pieces old and young; and with thee will I break in pieces the young man and the maid;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will also break in pieces with thee the shepherd and his flock; and with thee will I break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break in pieces captains and rulers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith the Lord, which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out mine hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough caterpillers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Prepare against her the nations with the kings of the Medes, the captains thereof, and all the rulers thereof, and all the land of his dominion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the land shall tremble and sorrow: for every purpose of the Lord shall be performed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The mighty men of Babylon have forborn to fight, they have remained in their holds: their might hath failed; they became as women: they have burned her dwellingplaces; her bars are broken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to shew the king of Babylon that his city is taken at one end,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And that the passages are stopped, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath swallowed me up like a dragon, he hath filled his belly with my delicates, he hath cast me out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwellingplace for dragons, an astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions' whelps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: How is Sheshach taken! and how is the praise of the whole earth surprised! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up: and the nations shall not flow together any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after that in another year shall come a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded, and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for Babylon: for the spoilers shall come unto her from the north, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the Lord afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the Lord's house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will do judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded shall groan.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: A sound of a cry cometh from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because the Lord hath spoiled Babylon, and destroyed out of her the great voice; when her waves do roar like great waters, a noise of their voice is uttered:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Because the spoiler is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, every one of their bows is broken: for the Lord God of recompences shall surely requite.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men: and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the people shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they shall be weary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, and shalt see, and shalt read all these words;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then shalt thou say, O Lord, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And he did that which was evil in the eyes of the Lord, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: For through the anger of the Lord it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, till he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it, and built forts against it round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden; (now the Chaldeans were by the city round about:) and they went by the way of the plain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then they took the king, and carried him up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; where he gave judgment upon him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in chains, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzar-adan, captain of the guard, which served the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And burned the house of the Lord, and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, and all the houses of the great men, burned he with fire:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Then Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carried away captive certain of the poor of the people, and the residue of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: But Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard left certain of the poor of the land for vinedressers and for husbandmen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: Also the pillars of brass that were in the house of the Lord, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the Lord, the Chaldeans brake, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The caldrons also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the basins, and the firepans, and the bowls, and the caldrons, and the candlesticks, and the spoons, and the cups; that which was of gold in gold, and that which was of silver in silver, took the captain of the guard away.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: The two pillars, one sea, and twelve brasen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made in the house of the Lord: the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And concerning the pillars, the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers: it was hollow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And a chapiter of brass was upon it; and the height of one chapiter was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the chapiters round about, all of brass. The second pillar also and the pomegranates were like unto these.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And there were ninety and six pomegranates on a side; and all the pomegranates upon the network were an hundred round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: He took also out of the city an eunuch, which had the charge of the men of war; and seven men of them that were near the king's person, which were found in the city; and the principal scribe of the host, who mustered the people of the land; and threescore men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: So Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death in Riblah in the land of Hamath. Thus Judah was carried away captive out of his own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand Jews and three and twenty:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty and two persons:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: In the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons: all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the five and twentieth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon in the first year of his reign lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And spake kindly unto him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And changed his prison garments: and he did continually eat bread before him all the days of his life.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Jeremiah
column17: And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations, and princess among the provinces, how is she become tributary!

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: She weepeth sore in the night, and her tears are on her cheeks: among all her lovers she hath none to comfort her: all her friends have dealt treacherously with her, they are become her enemies.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Judah is gone into captivity because of affliction, and because of great servitude: she dwelleth among the heathen, she findeth no rest: all her persecutors overtook her between the straits.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn feasts: all her gates are desolate: her priests sigh, her virgins are afflicted, and she is in bitterness.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Her adversaries are the chief, her enemies prosper; for the Lord hath afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions: her children are gone into captivity before the enemy.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: And from the daughter of Zion all her beauty is departed: her princes are become like harts that find no pasture, and they are gone without strength before the pursuer.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Jerusalem remembered in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that she had in the days of old, when her people fell into the hand of the enemy, and none did help her: the adversaries saw her, and did mock at her sabbaths.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Jerusalem hath grievously sinned; therefore she is removed: all that honoured her despise her, because they have seen her nakedness: yea, she sigheth, and turneth backward.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Her filthiness is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end; therefore she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O Lord, behold my affliction: for the enemy hath magnified himself.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The adversary hath spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things: for she hath seen that the heathen entered into her sanctuary, whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thy congregation.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: All her people sigh, they seek bread; they have given their pleasant things for meat to relieve the soul: see, O Lord, and consider; for I am become vile.
