column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by? behold, and see if there be any sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is done unto me, wherewith the Lord hath afflicted me in the day of his fierce anger.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate and faint all the day.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand: they are wreathed, and come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall, the Lord hath delivered me into their hands, from whom I am not able to rise up.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath trodden under foot all my mighty men in the midst of me: he hath called an assembly against me to crush my young men: the Lord hath trodden the virgin, the daughter of Judah, as in a winepress.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For these things I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water, because the comforter that should relieve my soul is far from me: my children are desolate, because the enemy prevailed.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Zion spreadeth forth her hands, and there is none to comfort her: the Lord hath commanded concerning Jacob, that his adversaries should be round about him: Jerusalem is as a menstruous woman among them.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment: hear, I pray you, all people, and behold my sorrow: my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: I called for my lovers, but they deceived me: my priests and mine elders gave up the ghost in the city, while they sought their meat to relieve their souls.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Behold, O Lord; for I am in distress: my bowels are troubled; mine heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaveth, at home there is as death.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They have heard that I sigh: there is none to comfort me: all mine enemies have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast done it: thou wilt bring the day that thou hast called, and they shall be like unto me.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Let all their wickedness come before thee; and do unto them, as thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sighs are many, and my heart is faint.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: How hath the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger, and cast down from heaven unto the earth the beauty of Israel, and remembered not his footstool in the day of his anger!

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath swallowed up all the habitations of Jacob, and hath not pitied: he hath thrown down in his wrath the strong holds of the daughter of Judah; he hath brought them down to the ground: he hath polluted the kingdom and the princes thereof.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath cut off in his fierce anger all the horn of Israel: he hath drawn back his right hand from before the enemy, and he burned against Jacob like a flaming fire, which devoureth round about.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath bent his bow like an enemy: he stood with his right hand as an adversary, and slew all that were pleasant to the eye in the tabernacle of the daughter of Zion: he poured out his fury like fire.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord was as an enemy: he hath swallowed up Israel, he hath swallowed up all her palaces: he hath destroyed his strong holds, and hath increased in the daughter of Judah mourning and lamentation.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: And he hath violently taken away his tabernacle, as if it were of a garden: he hath destroyed his places of the assembly: the Lord hath caused the solemn feasts and sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion, and hath despised in the indignation of his anger the king and the priest.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath cast off his altar, he hath abhorred his sanctuary, he hath given up into the hand of the enemy the walls of her palaces; they have made a noise in the house of the Lord, as in the day of a solemn feast.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion: he hath stretched out a line, he hath not withdrawn his hand from destroying: therefore he made the rampart and the wall to lament; they languished together.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Her gates are sunk into the ground; he hath destroyed and broken her bars: her king and her princes are among the Gentiles: the law is no more; her prophets also find no vision from the Lord.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The elders of the daughter of Zion sit upon the ground, and keep silence: they have cast up dust upon their heads; they have girded themselves with sackcloth: the virgins of Jerusalem hang down their heads to the ground.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Mine eyes do fail with tears, my bowels are troubled, my liver is poured upon the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because the children and the sucklings swoon in the streets of the city.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They say to their mothers, Where is corn and wine? when they swooned as the wounded in the streets of the city, when their soul was poured out into their mothers' bosom.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: What thing shall I take to witness for thee? what thing shall I liken to thee, O daughter of Jerusalem? what shall I equal to thee, that I may comfort thee, O virgin daughter of Zion? for thy breach is great like the sea: who can heal thee?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thy prophets have seen vain and foolish things for thee: and they have not discovered thine iniquity, to turn away thy captivity; but have seen for thee false burdens and causes of banishment.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: All that pass by clap their hands at thee; they hiss and wag their head at the daughter of Jerusalem, saying, Is this the city that men call The perfection of beauty, The joy of the whole earth?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: All thine enemies have opened their mouth against thee: they hiss and gnash the teeth: they say, We have swallowed her up: certainly this is the day that we looked for; we have found, we have seen it.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath done that which he had devised; he hath fulfilled his word that he had commanded in the days of old: he hath thrown down, and hath not pitied: and he hath caused thine enemy to rejoice over thee, he hath set up the horn of thine adversaries.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Their heart cried unto the Lord, O wall of the daughter of Zion, let tears run down like a river day and night: give thyself no rest; let not the apple of thine eye cease.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Arise, cry out in the night: in the beginning of the watches pour out thine heart like water before the face of the Lord: lift up thy hands toward him for the life of thy young children, that faint for hunger in the top of every street.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Behold, O Lord, and consider to whom thou hast done this. Shall the women eat their fruit, and children of a span long? shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuary of the Lord?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The young and the old lie on the ground in the streets: my virgins and my young men are fallen by the sword; thou hast slain them in the day of thine anger; thou hast killed, and not pitied.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast called as in a solemn day my terrors round about, so that in the day of the Lord's anger none escaped nor remained: those that I have swaddled and brought up hath mine enemy consumed.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Till the Lord look down, and behold from heaven.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Render unto them a recompence, O Lord, according to the work of their hands.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Even the sea monsters draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones: the daughter of my people is become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of his mouth for thirst: the young children ask bread, and no man breaketh it unto them.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets: they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment, and no hands stayed on her.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Her Nazarites were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk, they were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was of sapphire:

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Their visage is blacker than a coal; they are not known in the streets: their skin cleaveth to their bones; it is withered, it is become like a stick.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They that be slain with the sword are better than they that be slain with hunger: for these pine away, stricken through for want of the fruits of the field.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The hands of the pitiful women have sodden their own children: they were their meat in the destruction of the daughter of my people.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The Lord hath accomplished his fury; he hath poured out his fierce anger, and hath kindled a fire in Zion, and it hath devoured the foundations thereof.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The kings of the earth, and all the inhabitants of the world, would not have believed that the adversary and the enemy should have entered into the gates of Jerusalem.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For the sins of her prophets, and the iniquities of her priests, that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her,

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They have wandered as blind men in the streets, they have polluted themselves with blood, so that men could not touch their garments.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They cried unto them, Depart ye; it is unclean; depart, depart, touch not: when they fled away and wandered, they said among the heathen, They shall no more sojourn there.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The anger of the Lord hath divided them; he will no more regard them: they respected not the persons of the priests, they favoured not the elders.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain help: in our watching we have watched for a nation that could not save us.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They hunt our steps, that we cannot go in our streets: our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Our persecutors are swifter than the eagles of the heaven: they pursued us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the wilderness.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the Lord, was taken in their pits, of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the heathen.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, that dwellest in the land of Uz; the cup also shall pass through unto thee: thou shalt be drunken, and shalt make thyself naked.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will no more carry thee away into captivity: he will visit thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom; he will discover thy sins.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Remember, O Lord, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Our necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: We gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Thou, O Lord, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: Turn thou us unto thee, O Lord, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

column8: The Lamentations of Jeremiah
column17: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river of Chebar, that the heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin's captivity,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came expressly unto Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of the Lord was there upon him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I looked, and, behold, a whirlwind came out of the north, a great cloud, and a fire infolding itself, and a brightness was about it, and out of the midst thereof as the colour of amber, out of the midst of the fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also out of the midst thereof came the likeness of four living creatures. And this was their appearance; they had the likeness of a man.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And every one had four faces, and every one had four wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And their feet were straight feet; and the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf's foot: and they sparkled like the colour of burnished brass.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides; and they four had their faces and their wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Their wings were joined one to another; they turned not when they went; they went every one straight forward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for the likeness of their faces, they four had the face of a man, and the face of a lion, on the right side: and they four had the face of an ox on the left side; they four also had the face of an eagle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus were their faces: and their wings were stretched upward; two wings of every one were joined one to another, and two covered their bodies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they went every one straight forward: whither the spirit was to go, they went; and they turned not when they went.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, and like the appearance of lamps: it went up and down among the living creatures; and the fire was bright, and out of the fire went forth lightning.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now as I beheld the living creatures, behold one wheel upon the earth by the living creatures, with his four faces.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like unto the colour of a beryl: and they four had one likeness: and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel in the middle of a wheel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When they went, they went upon their four sides: and they turned not when they went.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for their rings, they were so high that they were dreadful; and their rings were full of eyes round about them four.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when the living creatures went, the wheels went by them: and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Whithersoever the spirit was to go, they went, thither was their spirit to go; and the wheels were lifted up over against them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When those went, these went; and when those stood, these stood; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up over against them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the likeness of the firmament upon the heads of the living creature was as the colour of the terrible crystal, stretched forth over their heads above.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And under the firmament were their wings straight, the one toward the other: every one had two, which covered on this side, and every one had two, which covered on that side, their bodies.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when they went, I heard the noise of their wings, like the noise of great waters, as the voice of the Almighty, the voice of speech, as the noise of an host: when they stood, they let down their wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there was a voice from the firmament that was over their heads, when they stood, and had let down their wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone: and upon the likeness of the throne was the likeness as the appearance of a man above upon it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I saw as the colour of amber, as the appearance of fire round about within it, from the appearance of his loins even upward, and from the appearance of his loins even downward, I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and it had brightness round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord. And when I saw it, I fell upon my face, and I heard a voice of one that spake.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, stand upon thy feet, and I will speak unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the spirit entered into me when he spake unto me, and set me upon my feet, that I heard him that spake unto me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, I send thee to the children of Israel, to a rebellious nation that hath rebelled against me: they and their fathers have transgressed against me, even unto this very day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For they are impudent children and stiffhearted. I do send thee unto them; and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear, (for they are a rebellious house,) yet shall know that there hath been a prophet among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou, son of man, be not afraid of them, neither be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns be with thee, and thou dost dwell among scorpions: be not afraid of their words, nor be dismayed at their looks, though they be a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt speak my words unto them, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear: for they are most rebellious.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But thou, son of man, hear what I say unto thee; Be not thou rebellious like that rebellious house: open thy mouth, and eat that I give thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when I looked, behold, an hand was sent unto me; and, lo, a roll of a book was therein;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he spread it before me; and it was written within and without: and there was written therein lamentations, and mourning, and woe.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roll.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thou art not sent to a people of a strange speech and of an hard language, but to the house of Israel;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Not to many people of a strange speech and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened unto thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, I have made thy face strong against their faces, and thy forehead strong against their foreheads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they be a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord God; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of the Lord from his place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I heard also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels over against them, and a noise of a great rushing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the Lord was strong upon me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel-abib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again, When a righteous man doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumblingblock before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the hand of the Lord was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the Lord stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I fell on my face.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet, and spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thine house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou also, son of man, take thee a tile, and lay it before thee, and portray upon it the city, even Jerusalem:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And lay siege against it, and build a fort against it, and cast a mount against it; set the camp also against it, and set battering rams against it round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover take thou unto thee an iron pan, and set it for a wall of iron between thee and the city: and set thy face against it, and it shall be besieged, and thou shalt lay siege against it. This shall be a sign to the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Lie thou also upon thy left side, and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it: according to the number of the days that thou shalt lie upon it thou shalt bear their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I have laid upon thee the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days: so shalt thou bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when thou hast accomplished them, lie again on thy right side, and thou shalt bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days: I have appointed thee each day for a year.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thou shalt set thy face toward the siege of Jerusalem, and thine arm shall be uncovered, and thou shalt prophesy against it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, behold, I will lay bands upon thee, and thou shalt not turn thee from one side to another, till thou hast ended the days of thy siege.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Take thou also unto thee wheat, and barley, and beans, and lentiles, and millet, and fitches, and put them in one vessel, and make thee bread thereof, according to the number of the days that thou shalt lie upon thy side, three hundred and ninety days shalt thou eat thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thy meat which thou shalt eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day: from time to time shalt thou eat it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt drink also water by measure, the sixth part of an hin: from time to time shalt thou drink.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt eat it as barley cakes, and thou shalt bake it with dung that cometh out of man, in their sight.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Lord said, Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their defiled bread among the Gentiles, whither I will drive them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said I, Ah Lord God! behold, my soul hath not been polluted: for from my youth up even till now have I not eaten of that which dieth of itself, or is torn in pieces; neither came there abominable flesh into my mouth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he said unto me, Lo, I have given thee cow's dung for man's dung, and thou shalt prepare thy bread therewith.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, behold, I will break the staff of bread in Jerusalem: and they shall eat bread by weight, and with care; and they shall drink water by measure, and with astonishment:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That they may want bread and water, and be astonied one with another, and consume away for their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou, son of man, take thee a sharp knife, take thee a barber's razor, and cause it to pass upon thine head and upon thy beard: then take thee balances to weigh, and divide the hair.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt burn with fire a third part in the midst of the city, when the days of the siege are fulfilled: and thou shalt take a third part, and smite about it with a knife: and a third part thou shalt scatter in the wind; and I will draw out a sword after them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt also take thereof a few in number, and bind them in thy skirts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then take of them again, and cast them into the midst of the fire, and burn them in the fire; for thereof shall a fire come forth into all the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; This is Jerusalem: I have set it in the midst of the nations and countries that are round about her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And she hath changed my judgments into wickedness more than the nations, and my statutes more than the countries that are round about her: for they have refused my judgments and my statutes, they have not walked in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because ye multiplied more than the nations that are round about you, and have not walked in my statutes, neither have kept my judgments, neither have done according to the judgments of the nations that are round about you;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I, even I, am against thee, and will execute judgments in the midst of thee in the sight of the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will do in thee that which I have not done, and whereunto I will not do any more the like, because of all thine abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore the fathers shall eat the sons in the midst of thee, and the sons shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments in thee, and the whole remnant of thee will I scatter into all the winds.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore, as I live, saith the Lord God; Surely, because thou hast defiled my sanctuary with all thy detestable things, and with all thine abominations, therefore will I also diminish thee; neither shall mine eye spare, neither will I have any pity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: A third part of thee shall die with the pestilence, and with famine shall they be consumed in the midst of thee: and a third part shall fall by the sword round about thee; and I will scatter a third part into all the winds, and I will draw out a sword after them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus shall mine anger be accomplished, and I will cause my fury to rest upon them, and I will be comforted: and they shall know that I the Lord have spoken it in my zeal, when I have accomplished my fury in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover I will make thee waste, and a reproach among the nations that are round about thee, in the sight of all that pass by.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, an instruction and an astonishment unto the nations that are round about thee, when I shall execute judgments in thee in anger and in fury and in furious rebukes. I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I shall send upon them the evil arrows of famine, which shall be for their destruction, and which I will send to destroy you: and I will increase the famine upon you, and will break your staff of bread:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So will I send upon you famine and evil beasts, and they shall bereave thee; and pestilence and blood shall pass through thee; and I will bring the sword upon thee. I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord God; Thus saith the Lord God to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys; Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And your altars shall be desolate, and your images shall be broken: and I will cast down your slain men before your idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will lay the dead carcases of the children of Israel before their idols; and I will scatter your bones round about your altars.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In all your dwellingplaces the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be desolate; that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate, and your idols may be broken and cease, and your images may be cut down, and your works may be abolished.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the slain shall fall in the midst of you, and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet will I leave a remnant, that ye may have some that shall escape the sword among the nations, when ye shall be scattered through the countries.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they that escape of you shall remember me among the nations whither they shall be carried captives, because I am broken with their whorish heart, which hath departed from me, and with their eyes, which go a whoring after their idols: and they shall lothe themselves for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall know that I am the Lord, and that I have not said in vain that I would do this evil unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Smite with thine hand, and stamp with thy foot, and say, Alas for all the evil abominations of the house of Israel! for they shall fall by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He that is far off shall die of the pestilence; and he that is near shall fall by the sword; and he that remaineth and is besieged shall die by the famine: thus will I accomplish my fury upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then shall ye know that I am the Lord, when their slain men shall be among their idols round about their altars, upon every high hill, in all the tops of the mountains, and under every green tree, and under every thick oak, the place where they did offer sweet savour to all their idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So will I stretch out my hand upon them, and make the land desolate, yea, more desolate than the wilderness toward Diblath, in all their habitations: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord God unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble is near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations that are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the Lord that smiteth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither shall there be wailing for them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision is touching the whole multitude thereof, which shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the Lord: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations and of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret place: for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the sixth year, in the sixth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I sat in mine house, and the elders of Judah sat before me, that the hand of the Lord God fell there upon me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I beheld, and lo a likeness as the appearance of fire: from the appearance of his loins even downward, fire; and from his loins even upward, as the appearance of brightness, as the colour of amber.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he put forth the form of an hand, and took me by a lock of mine head; and the spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heaven, and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the inner gate that looketh toward the north; where was the seat of the image of jealousy, which provoketh to jealousy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, according to the vision that I saw in the plain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Son of man, lift up thine eyes now the way toward the north. So I lifted up mine eyes the way toward the north, and behold northward at the gate of the altar this image of jealousy in the entry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He said furthermore unto me, Son of man, seest thou what they do? even the great abominations that the house of Israel committeth here, that I should go far off from my sanctuary? but turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me to the door of the court; and when I looked, behold a hole in the wall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Son of man, dig now in the wall: and when I had digged in the wall, behold a door.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Go in, and behold the wicked abominations that they do here.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So I went in and saw; and behold every form of creeping things, and abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, portrayed upon the wall round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there stood before them seventy men of the ancients of the house of Israel, and in the midst of them stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, with every man his censer in his hand; and a thick cloud of incense went up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen what the ancients of the house of Israel do in the dark, every man in the chambers of his imagery? for they say, The Lord seeth us not; the Lord hath forsaken the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He said also unto me, Turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations that they do.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he brought me to the door of the gate of the Lord's house which was toward the north; and, behold, there sat women weeping for Tammuz.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Hast thou seen this, O son of man? turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations than these.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me into the inner court of the Lord's house, and, behold, at the door of the temple of the Lord, between the porch and the altar, were about five and twenty men, with their backs toward the temple of the Lord, and their faces toward the east; and they worshipped the sun toward the east.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he said unto me, Hast thou seen this, O son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? for they have filled the land with violence, and have returned to provoke me to anger: and, lo, they put the branch to their nose.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore will I also deal in fury: mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: and though they cry in mine ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He cried also in mine ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause them that have charge over the city to draw near, even every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, behold, six men came from the way of the higher gate, which lieth toward the north, and every man a slaughter weapon in his hand; and one man among them was clothed with linen, with a writer's inkhorn by his side: and they went in, and stood beside the brasen altar.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the glory of the God of Israel was gone up from the cherub, whereupon he was, to the threshold of the house. And he called to the man clothed with linen, which had the writer's inkhorn by his side;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Lord said unto him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And to the others he said in mine hearing, Go ye after him through the city, and smite: let not your eye spare, neither have ye pity:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Slay utterly old and young, both maids, and little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom is the mark; and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the ancient men which were before the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto them, Defile the house, and fill the courts with the slain: go ye forth. And they went forth, and slew in the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass, while they were slaying them, and I was left, that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord God! wilt thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy fury upon Jerusalem?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceeding great, and the land is full of blood, and the city full of perverseness: for they say, The Lord hath forsaken the earth, and the Lord seeth not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as for me also, mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity, but I will recompense their way upon their head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, behold, the man clothed with linen, which had the inkhorn by his side, reported the matter, saying, I have done as thou hast commanded me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I looked, and, behold, in the firmament that was above the head of the cherubims there appeared over them as it were a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he spake unto the man clothed with linen, and said, Go in between the wheels, even under the cherub, and fill thine hand with coals of fire from between the cherubims, and scatter them over the city. And he went in in my sight.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now the cherubims stood on the right side of the house, when the man went in; and the cloud filled the inner court.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the cherub, and stood over the threshold of the house; and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of the Lord's glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the sound of the cherubims' wings was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of the Almighty God when he speaketh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass, that when he had commanded the man clothed with linen, saying, Take fire from between the wheels, from between the cherubims; then he went in, and stood beside the wheels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And one cherub stretched forth his hand from between the cherubims unto the fire that was between the cherubims, and took thereof, and put it into the hands of him that was clothed with linen: who took it, and went out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there appeared in the cherubims the form of a man's hand under their wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when I looked, behold the four wheels by the cherubims, one wheel by one cherub, and another wheel by another cherub: and the appearance of the wheels was as the colour of a beryl stone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as for their appearances, they four had one likeness, as if a wheel had been in the midst of a wheel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When they went, they went upon their four sides; they turned not as they went, but to the place whither the head looked they followed it; they turned not as they went.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and their wings, and the wheels, were full of eyes round about, even the wheels that they four had.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for the wheels, it was cried unto them in my hearing, O wheel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And every one had four faces: the first face was the face of a cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the cherubims were lifted up. This is the living creature that I saw by the river of Chebar.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when the cherubims went, the wheels went by them: and when the cherubims lifted up their wings to mount up from the earth, the same wheels also turned not from beside them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When they stood, these stood; and when they were lifted up, these lifted up themselves also: for the spirit of the living creature was in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the glory of the Lord departed from off the threshold of the house, and stood over the cherubims.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the cherubims lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight: when they went out, the wheels also were beside them, and every one stood at the door of the east gate of the Lord's house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river of Chebar; and I knew that they were the cherubims.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Every one had four faces apiece, and every one four wings; and the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the likeness of their faces was the same faces which I saw by the river of Chebar, their appearances and themselves: they went every one straight forward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the spirit lifted me up, and brought me unto the east gate of the Lord's house, which looketh eastward: and behold at the door of the gate five and twenty men; among whom I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Son of man, these are the men that devise mischief, and give wicked counsel in this city:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Which say, It is not near; let us build houses: this city is the caldron, and we be the flesh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Spirit of the Lord fell upon me, and said unto me, Speak; Thus saith the Lord; Thus have ye said, O house of Israel: for I know the things that come into your mind, every one of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye have multiplied your slain in this city, and ye have filled the streets thereof with the slain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Your slain whom ye have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and this city is the caldron: but I will bring you forth out of the midst of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye have feared the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will bring you out of the midst thereof, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye shall fall by the sword; I will judge you in the border of Israel; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This city shall not be your caldron, neither shall ye be the flesh in the midst thereof; but I will judge you in the border of Israel:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall know that I am the Lord: for ye have not walked in my statutes, neither executed my judgments, but have done after the manners of the heathen that are round about you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face, and cried with a loud voice, and said, Ah Lord God! wilt thou make a full end of the remnant of Israel?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, thy brethren, even thy brethren, the men of thy kindred, and all the house of Israel wholly, are they unto whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, Get you far from the Lord: unto us is this land given in possession.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord God; Although I have cast them far off among the heathen, and although I have scattered them among the countries, yet will I be to them as a little sanctuary in the countries where they shall come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord God; I will even gather you from the people, and assemble you out of the countries where ye have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them an heart of flesh:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That they may walk in my statutes, and keep mine ordinances, and do them: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But as for them whose heart walketh after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will recompense their way upon their own heads, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then did the cherubims lift up their wings, and the wheels beside them; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city, and stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Afterwards the spirit took me up, and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I spake unto them of the captivity all the things that the Lord had shewed me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord also came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, thou dwellest in the midst of a rebellious house, which have eyes to see, and see not; they have ears to hear, and hear not: for they are a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, thou son of man, prepare thee stuff for removing, and remove by day in their sight; and thou shalt remove from thy place to another place in their sight: it may be they will consider, though they be a rebellious house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then shalt thou bring forth thy stuff by day in their sight, as stuff for removing: and thou shalt go forth at even in their sight, as they that go forth into captivity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In their sight shalt thou bear it upon thy shoulders, and carry it forth in the twilight: thou shalt cover thy face, that thou see not the ground: for I have set thee for a sign unto the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I did so as I was commanded: I brought forth my stuff by day, as stuff for captivity, and in the even I digged through the wall with mine hand; I brought it forth in the twilight, and I bare it upon my shoulder in their sight.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in the morning came the word of the Lord unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, hath not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said unto thee, What doest thou?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; This burden concerneth the prince in Jerusalem, and all the house of Israel that are among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say, I am your sign: like as I have done, so shall it be done unto them: they shall remove and go into captivity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the prince that is among them shall bear upon his shoulder in the twilight, and shall go forth: they shall dig through the wall to carry out thereby: he shall cover his face, that he see not the ground with his eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: My net also will I spread upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare: and I will bring him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldeans; yet shall he not see it, though he shall die there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will scatter toward every wind all that are about him to help him, and all his bands; and I will draw out the sword after them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall scatter them among the nations, and disperse them in the countries.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I will leave a few men of them from the sword, from the famine, and from the pestilence; that they may declare all their abominations among the heathen whither they come; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, eat thy bread with quaking, and drink thy water with trembling and with carefulness;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto the people of the land, Thus saith the Lord God of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and of the land of Israel; They shall eat their bread with carefulness, and drink their water with astonishment, that her land may be desolate from all that is therein, because of the violence of all them that dwell therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste, and the land shall be desolate; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, what is that proverb that ye have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged, and every vision faileth?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Tell them therefore, Thus saith the Lord God; I will make this proverb to cease, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but say unto them, The days are at hand, and the effect of every vision.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For there shall be no more any vain vision nor flattering divination within the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I am the Lord: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, behold, they of the house of Israel say, The vision that he seeth is for many days to come, and he prophesieth of the times that are far off.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; There shall none of my words be prolonged any more, but the word which I have spoken shall be done, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel that prophesy, and say thou unto them that prophesy out of their own hearts, Hear ye the word of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Woe unto the foolish prophets, that follow their own spirit, and have seen nothing!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: O Israel, thy prophets are like the foxes in the deserts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye have not gone up into the gaps, neither made up the hedge for the house of Israel to stand in the battle in the day of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They have seen vanity and lying divination, saying, The Lord saith: and the Lord hath not sent them: and they have made others to hope that they would confirm the word.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Have ye not seen a vain vision, and have ye not spoken a lying divination, whereas ye say, The Lord saith it; albeit I have not spoken?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because ye have spoken vanity, and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And mine hand shall be upon the prophets that see vanity, and that divine lies: they shall not be in the assembly of my people, neither shall they be written in the writing of the house of Israel, neither shall they enter into the land of Israel; and ye shall know that I am the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there was no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo, others daubed it with untempered mortar:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say unto them which daub it with untempered mortar, that it shall fall: there shall be an overflowing shower; and ye, O great hailstones, shall fall; and a stormy wind shall rend it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Lo, when the wall is fallen, shall it not be said unto you, Where is the daubing wherewith ye have daubed it?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; I will even rend it with a stormy wind in my fury; and there shall be an overflowing shower in mine anger, and great hailstones in my fury to consume it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So will I break down the wall that ye have daubed with untempered mortar, and bring it down to the ground, so that the foundation thereof shall be discovered, and it shall fall, and ye shall be consumed in the midst thereof: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I accomplish my wrath upon the wall, and upon them that have daubed it with untempered mortar, and will say unto you, The wall is no more, neither they that daubed it;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: To wit, the prophets of Israel which prophesy concerning Jerusalem, and which see visions of peace for her, and there is no peace, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Likewise, thou son of man, set thy face against the daughters of thy people, which prophesy out of their own heart; and prophesy thou against them,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Thus saith the Lord God; Woe to the women that sew pillows to all armholes, and make kerchiefs upon the head of every stature to hunt souls! Will ye hunt the souls of my people, and will ye save the souls alive that come unto you?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And will ye pollute me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to slay the souls that should not die, and to save the souls alive that should not live, by your lying to my people that hear your lies?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against your pillows, wherewith ye there hunt the souls to make them fly, and I will tear them from your arms, and will let the souls go, even the souls that ye hunt to make them fly.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Your kerchiefs also will I tear, and deliver my people out of your hand, and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunted; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because with lies ye have made the heart of the righteous sad, whom I have not made sad; and strengthened the hands of the wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way, by promising him life:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore ye shall see no more vanity, nor divine divinations: for I will deliver my people out of your hand: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then came certain of the elders of Israel unto me, and sat before me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
