column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, these men have set up their idols in their heart, and put the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their face: should I be inquired of at all by them?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore speak unto them, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Every man of the house of Israel that setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to the prophet; I the Lord will answer him that cometh according to the multitude of his idols;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That I may take the house of Israel in their own heart, because they are all estranged from me through their idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore say unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; Repent, and turn yourselves from your idols; and turn away your faces from all your abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For every one of the house of Israel, or of the stranger that sojourneth in Israel, which separateth himself from me, and setteth up his idols in his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to a prophet to inquire of him concerning me; I the Lord will answer him by myself:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set my face against that man, and will make him a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from the midst of my people; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And if the prophet be deceived when he hath spoken a thing, I the Lord have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand upon him, and will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity: the punishment of the prophet shall be even as the punishment of him that seeketh unto him;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That the house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither be polluted any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again to me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, when the land sinneth against me by trespassing grievously, then will I stretch out mine hand upon it, and will break the staff of the bread thereof, and will send famine upon it, and will cut off man and beast from it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they should deliver but their own souls by their righteousness, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: If I cause noisome beasts to pass through the land, and they spoil it, so that it be desolate, that no man may pass through because of the beasts:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Though these three men were in it, as I live, saith the Lord God, they shall deliver neither sons nor daughters; they only shall be delivered, but the land shall be desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Or if I bring a sword upon that land, and say, Sword, go through the land; so that I cut off man and beast from it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Though these three men were in it, as I live, saith the Lord God, they shall deliver neither sons nor daughters, but they only shall be delivered themselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Or if I send a pestilence into that land, and pour out my fury upon it in blood, to cut off from it man and beast:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Though Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, as I live, saith the Lord God, they shall deliver neither son nor daughter; they shall but deliver their own souls by their righteousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; How much more when I send my four sore judgments upon Jerusalem, the sword, and the famine, and the noisome beast, and the pestilence, to cut off from it man and beast?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be brought forth, both sons and daughters: behold, they shall come forth unto you, and ye shall see their way and their doings: and ye shall be comforted concerning the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought upon it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall comfort you, when ye see their ways and their doings: and ye shall know that I have not done without cause all that I have done in it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, What is the vine tree more than any tree, or than a branch which is among the trees of the forest?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Shall wood be taken thereof to do any work? or will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel thereon?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire devoureth both the ends of it, and the midst of it is burned. Is it meet for any work?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less shall it be meet yet for any work, when the fire hath devoured it, and it is burned?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; As the vine tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so will I give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set my face against them; they shall go out from one fire, and another fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I set my face against them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Thus saith the Lord God unto Jerusalem; Thy birth and thy nativity is of the land of Canaan; thy father was an Amorite, and thy mother an Hittite.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as for thy nativity, in the day thou wast born thy navel was not cut, neither wast thou washed in water to supple thee; thou wast not salted at all, nor swaddled at all.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: None eye pitied thee, to do any of these unto thee, to have compassion upon thee; but thou wast cast out in the open field, to the lothing of thy person, in the day that thou wast born.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when I passed by thee, and saw thee polluted in thine own blood, I said unto thee when thou wast in thy blood, Live; yea, I said unto thee when thou wast in thy blood, Live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I have caused thee to multiply as the bud of the field, and thou hast increased and waxen great, and thou art come to excellent ornaments: thy breasts are fashioned, and thine hair is grown, whereas thou wast naked and bare.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now when I passed by thee, and looked upon thee, behold, thy time was the time of love; and I spread my skirt over thee, and covered thy nakedness: yea, I sware unto thee, and entered into a covenant with thee, saith the Lord God, and thou becamest mine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then washed I thee with water; yea, I throughly washed away thy blood from thee, and I anointed thee with oil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I clothed thee also with broidered work, and shod thee with badgers' skin, and I girded thee about with fine linen, and I covered thee with silk.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I decked thee also with ornaments, and I put bracelets upon thy hands, and a chain on thy neck.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I put a jewel on thy forehead, and earrings in thine ears, and a beautiful crown upon thine head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus wast thou decked with gold and silver; and thy raiment was of fine linen, and silk, and broidered work; thou didst eat fine flour, and honey, and oil: and thou wast exceeding beautiful, and thou didst prosper into a kingdom.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thy renown went forth among the heathen for thy beauty: for it was perfect through my comeliness, which I had put upon thee, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But thou didst trust in thine own beauty, and playedst the harlot because of thy renown, and pouredst out thy fornications on every one that passed by; his it was.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And of thy garments thou didst take, and deckedst thy high places with divers colours, and playedst the harlot thereupon: the like things shall not come, neither shall it be so.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast also taken thy fair jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given thee, and madest to thyself images of men, and didst commit whoredom with them,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And tookest thy broidered garments, and coveredst them: and thou hast set mine oil and mine incense before them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: My meat also which I gave thee, fine flour, and oil, and honey, wherewith I fed thee, thou hast even set it before them for a sweet savour: and thus it was, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover thou hast taken thy sons and thy daughters, whom thou hast borne unto me, and these hast thou sacrificed unto them to be devoured. Is this of thy whoredoms a small matter,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That thou hast slain my children, and delivered them to cause them to pass through the fire for them?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in all thine abominations and thy whoredoms thou hast not remembered the days of thy youth, when thou wast naked and bare, and wast polluted in thy blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass after all thy wickedness, (woe, woe unto thee! saith the Lord God;)

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That thou hast also built unto thee an eminent place, and hast made thee an high place in every street.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast built thy high place at every head of the way, and hast made thy beauty to be abhorred, and hast opened thy feet to every one that passed by, and multiplied thy whoredoms.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast also committed fornication with the Egyptians thy neighbours, great of flesh; and hast increased thy whoredoms, to provoke me to anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I have stretched out my hand over thee, and have diminished thine ordinary food, and delivered thee unto the will of them that hate thee, the daughters of the Philistines, which are ashamed of thy lewd way.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast played the whore also with the Assyrians, because thou wast unsatiable; yea, thou hast played the harlot with them, and yet couldest not be satisfied.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast moreover multiplied thy fornication in the land of Canaan unto Chaldea; and yet thou wast not satisfied herewith.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: How weak is thine heart, saith the Lord God, seeing thou doest all these things, the work of an imperious whorish woman;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In that thou buildest thine eminent place in the head of every way, and makest thine high place in every street; and hast not been as an harlot, in that thou scornest hire;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But as a wife that committeth adultery, which taketh strangers instead of her husband!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They give gifts to all whores: but thou givest thy gifts to all thy lovers, and hirest them, that they may come unto thee on every side for thy whoredom.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the contrary is in thee from other women in thy whoredoms, whereas none followeth thee to commit whoredoms: and in that thou givest a reward, and no reward is given unto thee, therefore thou art contrary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore, O harlot, hear the word of the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because thy filthiness was poured out, and thy nakedness discovered through thy whoredoms with thy lovers, and with all the idols of thy abominations, and by the blood of thy children, which thou didst give unto them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I will gather all thy lovers, with whom thou hast taken pleasure, and all them that thou hast loved, with all them that thou hast hated; I will even gather them round about against thee, and will discover thy nakedness unto them, that they may see all thy nakedness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will judge thee, as women that break wedlock and shed blood are judged; and I will give thee blood in fury and jealousy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will also give thee into their hand, and they shall throw down thine eminent place, and shall break down thy high places: they shall strip thee also of thy clothes, and shall take thy fair jewels, and leave thee naked and bare.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall also bring up a company against thee, and they shall stone thee with stones, and thrust thee through with their swords.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall burn thine houses with fire, and execute judgments upon thee in the sight of many women: and I will cause thee to cease from playing the harlot, and thou also shalt give no hire any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So will I make my fury toward thee to rest, and my jealousy shall depart from thee, and I will be quiet, and will be no more angry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because thou hast not remembered the days of thy youth, but hast fretted me in all these things; behold, therefore I also will recompense thy way upon thine head, saith the Lord God: and thou shalt not commit this lewdness above all thine abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, every one that useth proverbs shall use this proverb against thee, saying, As is the mother, so is her daughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou art thy mother's daughter, that lotheth her husband and her children; and thou art the sister of thy sisters, which lothed their husbands and their children: your mother was an Hittite, and your father an Amorite.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thine elder sister is Samaria, she and her daughters that dwell at thy left hand: and thy younger sister, that dwelleth at thy right hand, is Sodom and her daughters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet hast thou not walked after their ways, nor done after their abominations: but, as if that were a very little thing, thou wast corrupted more than they in all thy ways.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As I live, saith the Lord God, Sodom thy sister hath not done, she nor her daughters, as thou hast done, thou and thy daughters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, this was the iniquity of thy sister Sodom, pride, fulness of bread, and abundance of idleness was in her and in her daughters, neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they were haughty, and committed abomination before me: therefore I took them away as I saw good.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither hath Samaria committed half of thy sins; but thou hast multiplied thine abominations more than they, and hast justified thy sisters in all thine abominations which thou hast done.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou also, which hast judged thy sisters, bear thine own shame for thy sins that thou hast committed more abominable than they: they are more righteous than thou: yea, be thou confounded also, and bear thy shame, in that thou hast justified thy sisters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I shall bring again their captivity, the captivity of Sodom and her daughters, and the captivity of Samaria and her daughters, then will I bring again the captivity of thy captives in the midst of them:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That thou mayest bear thine own shame, and mayest be confounded in all that thou hast done, in that thou art a comfort unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When thy sisters, Sodom and her daughters, shall return to their former estate, and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former estate, then thou and thy daughters shall return to your former estate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thy sister Sodom was not mentioned by thy mouth in the day of thy pride,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Before thy wickedness was discovered, as at the time of thy reproach of the daughters of Syria, and all that are round about her, the daughters of the Philistines, which despise thee round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast borne thy lewdness and thine abominations, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; I will even deal with thee as thou hast done, which hast despised the oath in breaking the covenant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Nevertheless I will remember my covenant with thee in the days of thy youth, and I will establish unto thee an everlasting covenant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then thou shalt remember thy ways, and be ashamed, when thou shalt receive thy sisters, thine elder and thy younger: and I will give them unto thee for daughters, but not by thy covenant.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That thou mayest remember, and be confounded, and never open thy mouth any more because of thy shame, when I am pacified toward thee for all that thou hast done, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable unto the house of Israel;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Thus saith the Lord God; A great eagle with great wings, longwinged, full of feathers, which had divers colours, came unto Lebanon, and took the highest branch of the cedar:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He cropped off the top of his young twigs, and carried it into a land of traffick; he set it in a city of merchants.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful field; he placed it by great waters, and set it as a willow tree.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and the roots thereof were under him: so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and, behold, this vine did bend her roots toward him, and shot forth her branches toward him, that he might water it by the furrows of her plantation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It was planted in a good soil by great waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a goodly vine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say thou, Thus saith the Lord God; Shall it prosper? shall he not pull up the roots thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it wither? it shall wither in all the leaves of her spring, even without great power or many people to pluck it up by the roots thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, behold, being planted, shall it prosper? shall it not utterly wither, when the east wind toucheth it? it shall wither in the furrows where it grew.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say now to the rebellious house, Know ye not what these things mean? tell them, Behold, the king of Babylon is come to Jerusalem, and hath taken the king thereof, and the princes thereof, and led them with him to Babylon;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And hath taken of the king's seed, and made a covenant with him, and hath taken an oath of him: he hath also taken the mighty of the land:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That the kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping of his covenant it might stand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shall he prosper? shall he escape that doeth such things? or shall he break the covenant, and be delivered?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As I live, saith the Lord God, surely in the place where the king dwelleth that made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he brake, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company make for him in the war, by casting up mounts, and building forts, to cut off many persons:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Seeing he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when, lo, he had given his hand, and hath done all these things, he shall not escape.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; As I live, surely mine oath that he hath despised, and my covenant that he hath broken, even it will I recompense upon his own head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will spread my net upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare, and I will bring him to Babylon, and will plead with him there for his trespass that he hath trespassed against me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And all his fugitives with all his bands shall fall by the sword, and they that remain shall be scattered toward all winds: and ye shall know that I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; I will also take of the highest branch of the high cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from the top of his young twigs a tender one, and will plant it upon an high mountain and eminent:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the mountain of the height of Israel will I plant it: and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a goodly cedar: and under it shall dwell all fowl of every wing; in the shadow of the branches thereof shall they dwell.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And all the trees of the field shall know that I the Lord have brought down the high tree, have exalted the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree to flourish: I the Lord have spoken and have done it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came unto me again, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: What mean ye, that ye use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As I live, saith the Lord God, ye shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, all souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine: the soul that sinneth, it shall die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But if a man be just, and do that which is lawful and right,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, neither hath defiled his neighbour's wife, neither hath come near to a menstruous woman,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And hath not oppressed any, but hath restored to the debtor his pledge, hath spoiled none by violence, hath given his bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He that hath not given forth upon usury, neither hath taken any increase, that hath withdrawn his hand from iniquity, hath executed true judgment between man and man,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Hath walked in my statutes, and hath kept my judgments, to deal truly; he is just, he shall surely live, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: If he beget a son that is a robber, a shedder of blood, and that doeth the like to any one of these things,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And that doeth not any of those duties, but even hath eaten upon the mountains, and defiled his neighbour's wife,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Hath oppressed the poor and needy, hath spoiled by violence, hath not restored the pledge, and hath lifted up his eyes to the idols, hath committed abomination,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Hath given forth upon usury, and hath taken increase: shall he then live? he shall not live: he hath done all these abominations; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now, lo, if he beget a son, that seeth all his father's sins which he hath done, and considereth, and doeth not such like,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, hath not defiled his neighbour's wife,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither hath oppressed any, hath not withholden the pledge, neither hath spoiled by violence, but hath given his bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That hath taken off his hand from the poor, that hath not received usury nor increase, hath executed my judgments, hath walked in my statutes; he shall not die for the iniquity of his father, he shall surely live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for his father, because he cruelly oppressed, spoiled his brother by violence, and did that which is not good among his people, lo, even he shall die in his iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet say ye, Why? doth not the son bear the iniquity of the father? When the son hath done that which is lawful and right, and hath kept all my statutes, and hath done them, he shall surely live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The soul that sinneth, it shall die. The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son: the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But if the wicked will turn from all his sins that he hath committed, and keep all my statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live, he shall not die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All his transgressions that he hath committed, they shall not be mentioned unto him: in his righteousness that he hath done he shall live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Have I any pleasure at all that the wicked should die? saith the Lord God: and not that he should return from his ways, and live?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But when the righteous turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, and doeth according to all the abominations that the wicked man doeth, shall he live? All his righteousness that he hath done shall not be mentioned: in his trespass that he hath trespassed, and in his sin that he hath sinned, in them shall he die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel; Is not my way equal? are not your ways unequal?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When a righteous man turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, and dieth in them; for his iniquity that he hath done shall he die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again, when the wicked man turneth away from his wickedness that he hath committed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because he considereth, and turneth away from all his transgressions that he hath committed, he shall surely live, he shall not die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet saith the house of Israel, The way of the Lord is not equal. O house of Israel, are not my ways equal? are not your ways unequal?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to his ways, saith the Lord God. Repent, and turn yourselves from all your transgressions; so iniquity shall not be your ruin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Cast away from you all your transgressions, whereby ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I have no pleasure in the death of him that dieth, saith the Lord God: wherefore turn yourselves, and live ye.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover take thou up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, What is thy mother? A lioness: she lay down among lions, she nourished her whelps among young lions.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fulness thereof, by the noise of his roaring.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thy mother is like a vine in thy blood, planted by the waters: she was fruitful and full of branches by reason of many waters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And she had strong rods for the sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among the thick branches, and she appeared in her height with the multitude of her branches.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And now she is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and sat before me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then came the word of the Lord unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, speak unto the elders of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Are ye come to inquire of me? As I live, saith the Lord God, I will not be inquired of by you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wilt thou judge them, son of man, wilt thou judge them? cause them to know the abominations of their fathers:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; In the day when I chose Israel, and lifted up mine hand unto the seed of the house of Jacob, and made myself known unto them in the land of Egypt, when I lifted up mine hand unto them, saying, I am the Lord your God;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the day that I lifted up mine hand unto them, to bring them forth of the land of Egypt into a land that I had espied for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said I unto them, Cast ye away every man the abominations of his eyes, and defile not yourselves with the idols of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But they rebelled against me, and would not hearken unto me: they did not every man cast away the abominations of their eyes, neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said, I will pour out my fury upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I wrought for my name's sake, that it should not be polluted before the heathen, among whom they were, in whose sight I made myself known unto them, in bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore I caused them to go forth out of the land of Egypt, and brought them into the wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I gave them my statutes, and shewed them my judgments, which if a man do, he shall even live in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover also I gave them my sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am the Lord that sanctify them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness: they walked not in my statutes, and they despised my judgments, which if a man do, he shall even live in them; and my sabbaths they greatly polluted: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them in the wilderness, to consume them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I wrought for my name's sake, that it should not be polluted before the heathen, in whose sight I brought them out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet also I lifted up my hand unto them in the wilderness, that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because they despised my judgments, and walked not in my statutes, but polluted my sabbaths: for their heart went after their idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Nevertheless mine eye spared them from destroying them, neither did I make an end of them in the wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I said unto their children in the wilderness, Walk ye not in the statutes of your fathers, neither observe their judgments, nor defile yourselves with their idols:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I am the Lord your God; walk in my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And hallow my sabbaths; and they shall be a sign between me and you, that ye may know that I am the Lord your God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Notwithstanding the children rebelled against me: they walked not in my statutes, neither kept my judgments to do them, which if a man do, he shall even live in them; they polluted my sabbaths: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the wilderness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Nevertheless I withdrew mine hand, and wrought for my name's sake, that it should not be polluted in the sight of the heathen, in whose sight I brought them forth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I lifted up mine hand unto them also in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the heathen, and disperse them through the countries;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because they had not executed my judgments, but had despised my statutes, and had polluted my sabbaths, and their eyes were after their fathers' idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore I gave them also statutes that were not good, and judgments whereby they should not live;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I polluted them in their own gifts, in that they caused to pass through the fire all that openeth the womb, that I might make them desolate, to the end that they might know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, son of man, speak unto the house of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Yet in this your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have committed a trespass against me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For when I had brought them into the land, for the which I lifted up mine hand to give it to them, then they saw every high hill, and all the thick trees, and they offered there their sacrifices, and there they presented the provocation of their offering: there also they made their sweet savour, and poured out there their drink offerings.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I said unto them, What is the high place whereunto ye go? And the name thereof is called Bamah unto this day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore say unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; Are ye polluted after the manner of your fathers? and commit ye whoredom after their abominations?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For when ye offer your gifts, when ye make your sons to pass through the fire, ye pollute yourselves with all your idols, even unto this day: and shall I be inquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live, saith the Lord God, I will not be inquired of by you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And that which cometh into your mind shall not be at all, that ye say, We will be as the heathen, as the families of the countries, to serve wood and stone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As I live, saith the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out, will I rule over you:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will bring you out from the people, and will gather you out of the countries wherein ye are scattered, with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will bring you into the wilderness of the people, and there will I plead with you face to face.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Like as I pleaded with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I plead with you, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will cause you to pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will purge out from among you the rebels, and them that transgress against me: I will bring them forth out of the country where they sojourn, and they shall not enter into the land of Israel: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for you, O house of Israel, thus saith the Lord God; Go ye, serve ye every one his idols, and hereafter also, if ye will not hearken unto me: but pollute ye my holy name no more with your gifts, and with your idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For in mine holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel, saith the Lord God, there shall all the house of Israel, all of them in the land, serve me: there will I accept them, and there will I require your offerings, and the firstfruits of your oblations, with all your holy things.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will accept you with your sweet savour, when I bring you out from the people, and gather you out of the countries wherein ye have been scattered; and I will be sanctified in you before the heathen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall bring you into the land of Israel, into the country for the which I lifted up mine hand to give it to your fathers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there shall ye remember your ways, and all your doings, wherein ye have been defiled; and ye shall lothe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that ye have committed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I have wrought with you for my name's sake, not according to your wicked ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, O ye house of Israel, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face toward the south, and drop thy word toward the south, and prophesy against the forest of the south field;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say to the forest of the south, Hear the word of the Lord; Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will kindle a fire in thee, and it shall devour every green tree in thee, and every dry tree: the flaming flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be burned therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And all flesh shall see that I the Lord have kindled it: it shall not be quenched.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said I, Ah Lord God! they say of me, Doth he not speak parables?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face toward Jerusalem, and drop thy word toward the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say to the land of Israel, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I am against thee, and will draw forth my sword out of his sheath, and will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Seeing then that I will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked, therefore shall my sword go forth out of his sheath against all flesh from the south to the north:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That all flesh may know that I the Lord have drawn forth my sword out of his sheath: it shall not return any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Sigh therefore, thou son of man, with the breaking of thy loins; and with bitterness sigh before their eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall be, when they say unto thee, Wherefore sighest thou? that thou shalt answer, For the tidings; because it cometh: and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be feeble, and every spirit shall faint, and all knees shall be weak as water: behold, it cometh, and shall be brought to pass, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus saith the Lord; Say, A sword, a sword is sharpened, and also furbished:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It is sharpened to make a sore slaughter; it is furbished that it may glitter: should we then make mirth? it contemneth the rod of my son, as every tree.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he hath given it to be furbished, that it may be handled: this sword is sharpened, and it is furbished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Cry and howl, son of man: for it shall be upon my people, it shall be upon all the princes of Israel: terrors by reason of the sword shall be upon my people: smite therefore upon thy thigh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because it is a trial, and what if the sword contemn even the rod? it shall be no more, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou therefore, son of man, prophesy, and smite thine hands together, and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the slain: it is the sword of the great men that are slain, which entereth into their privy chambers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, that their heart may faint, and their ruins be multiplied: ah! it is made bright, it is wrapped up for the slaughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Go thee one way or other, either on the right hand, or on the left, whithersoever thy face is set.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will also smite mine hands together, and I will cause my fury to rest: I the Lord have said it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came unto me again, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also, thou son of man, appoint thee two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come: both twain shall come forth out of one land: and choose thou a place, choose it at the head of the way to the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Appoint a way, that the sword may come to Rabbath of the Ammonites, and to Judah in Jerusalem the defenced.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination: he made his arrows bright, he consulted with images, he looked in the liver.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: At his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to appoint captains, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to appoint battering rams against the gates, to cast a mount, and to build a fort.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because ye have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are discovered, so that in all your doings your sins do appear; because, I say, that ye are come to remembrance, ye shall be taken with the hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou, profane wicked prince of Israel, whose day is come, when iniquity shall have an end,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Remove the diadem, and take off the crown: this shall not be the same: exalt him that is low, and abase him that is high.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will overturn, overturn, overturn, it: and it shall be no more, until he come whose right it is; and I will give it him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou, son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord God concerning the Ammonites, and concerning their reproach; even say thou, The sword, the sword is drawn: for the slaughter it is furbished, to consume because of the glittering:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Whiles they see vanity unto thee, whiles they divine a lie unto thee, to bring thee upon the necks of them that are slain, of the wicked, whose day is come, when their iniquity shall have an end.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Shall I cause it to return into his sheath? I will judge thee in the place where thou wast created, in the land of thy nativity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will pour out mine indignation upon thee, I will blow against thee in the fire of my wrath, and deliver thee into the hand of brutish men, and skilful to destroy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt be for fuel to the fire; thy blood shall be in the midst of the land; thou shalt be no more remembered: for I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now, thou son of man, wilt thou judge, wilt thou judge the bloody city? yea, thou shalt shew her all her abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then say thou, Thus saith the Lord God, The city sheddeth blood in the midst of it, that her time may come, and maketh idols against herself to defile herself.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou art become guilty in thy blood that thou hast shed; and hast defiled thyself in thine idols which thou hast made; and thou hast caused thy days to draw near, and art come even unto thy years: therefore have I made thee a reproach unto the heathen, and a mocking to all countries.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Those that be near, and those that be far from thee, shall mock thee, which art infamous and much vexed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, the princes of Israel, every one were in thee to their power to shed blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In thee have they set light by father and mother: in the midst of thee have they dealt by oppression with the stranger: in thee have they vexed the fatherless and the widow.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast despised mine holy things, and hast profaned my sabbaths.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In thee are men that carry tales to shed blood: and in thee they eat upon the mountains: in the midst of thee they commit lewdness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In thee have they discovered their fathers' nakedness: in thee have they humbled her that was set apart for pollution.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And one hath committed abomination with his neighbour's wife; and another hath lewdly defiled his daughter in law; and another in thee hath humbled his sister, his father's daughter.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In thee have they taken gifts to shed blood; thou hast taken usury and increase, and thou hast greedily gained of thy neighbours by extortion, and hast forgotten me, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I have smitten mine hand at thy dishonest gain which thou hast made, and at thy blood which hath been in the midst of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Can thine heart endure, or can thine hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with thee? I the Lord have spoken it, and will do it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will scatter thee among the heathen, and disperse thee in the countries, and will consume thy filthiness out of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt take thine inheritance in thyself in the sight of the heathen, and thou shalt know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, the house of Israel is to me become dross: all they are brass, and tin, and iron, and lead, in the midst of the furnace; they are even the dross of silver.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because ye are all become dross, behold, therefore I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As they gather silver, and brass, and iron, and lead, and tin, into the midst of the furnace, to blow the fire upon it, to melt it; so will I gather you in mine anger and in my fury, and I will leave you there, and melt you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, I will gather you, and blow upon you in the fire of my wrath, and ye shall be melted in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so shall ye be melted in the midst thereof; and ye shall know that I the Lord have poured out my fury upon you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, say unto her, Thou art the land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There is a conspiracy of her prophets in the midst thereof, like a roaring lion ravening the prey; they have devoured souls; they have taken the treasure and precious things; they have made her many widows in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Her priests have violated my law, and have profaned mine holy things: they have put no difference between the holy and profane, neither have they shewed difference between the unclean and the clean, and have hid their eyes from my sabbaths, and I am profaned among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Her princes in the midst thereof are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blood, and to destroy souls, to get dishonest gain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And her prophets have daubed them with untempered mortar, seeing vanity, and divining lies unto them, saying, Thus saith the Lord God, when the Lord hath not spoken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The people of the land have used oppression, and exercised robbery, and have vexed the poor and needy: yea, they have oppressed the stranger wrongfully.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I sought for a man among them, that should make up the hedge, and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore have I poured out mine indignation upon them; I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath: their own way have I recompensed upon their heads, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they committed whoredoms in Egypt; they committed whoredoms in their youth: there were their breasts pressed, and there they bruised the teats of their virginity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the names of them were Aholah the elder, and Aholibah her sister: and they were mine, and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah, and Jerusalem Aholibah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And Aholah played the harlot when she was mine; and she doted on her lovers, on the Assyrians her neighbours,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Which were clothed with blue, captains and rulers, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding upon horses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus she committed her whoredoms with them, with all them that were the chosen men of Assyria, and with all on whom she doted: with all their idols she defiled herself.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither left she her whoredoms brought from Egypt: for in her youth they lay with her, and they bruised the breasts of her virginity, and poured their whoredom upon her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore I have delivered her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the Assyrians, upon whom she doted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: These discovered her nakedness: they took her sons and her daughters, and slew her with the sword: and she became famous among women; for they had executed judgment upon her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when her sister Aholibah saw this, she was more corrupt in her inordinate love than she, and in her whoredoms more than her sister in her whoredoms.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: She doted upon the Assyrians her neighbours, captains and rulers clothed most gorgeously, horsemen riding upon horses, all of them desirable young men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I saw that she was defiled, that they took both one way,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And that she increased her whoredoms: for when she saw men portrayed upon the wall, the images of the Chaldeans portrayed with vermilion,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Girded with girdles upon their loins, exceeding in dyed attire upon their heads, all of them princes to look to, after the manner of the Babylonians of Chaldea, the land of their nativity:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as soon as she saw them with her eyes, she doted upon them, and sent messengers unto them into Chaldea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Babylonians came to her into the bed of love, and they defiled her with their whoredom, and she was polluted with them, and her mind was alienated from them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So she discovered her whoredoms, and discovered her nakedness: then my mind was alienated from her, like as my mind was alienated from her sister.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet she multiplied her whoredoms, in calling to remembrance the days of her youth, wherein she had played the harlot in the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For she doted upon their paramours, whose flesh is as the flesh of asses, and whose issue is like the issue of horses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus thou calledst to remembrance the lewdness of thy youth, in bruising thy teats by the Egyptians for the paps of thy youth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, O Aholibah, thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will raise up thy lovers against thee, from whom thy mind is alienated, and I will bring them against thee on every side;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The Babylonians, and all the Chaldeans, Pekod, and Shoa, and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them: all of them desirable young men, captains and rulers, great lords and renowned, all of them riding upon horses.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall come against thee with chariots, wagons, and wheels, and with an assembly of people, which shall set against thee buckler and shield and helmet round about: and I will set judgment before them, and they shall judge thee according to their judgments.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set my jealousy against thee, and they shall deal furiously with thee: they shall take away thy nose and thine ears; and thy remnant shall fall by the sword: they shall take thy sons and thy daughters; and thy residue shall be devoured by the fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall also strip thee out of thy clothes, and take away thy fair jewels.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I make thy lewdness to cease from thee, and thy whoredom brought from the land of Egypt: so that thou shalt not lift up thine eyes unto them, nor remember Egypt any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will deliver thee into the hand of them whom thou hatest, into the hand of them from whom thy mind is alienated:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall deal with thee hatefully, and shall take away all thy labour, and shall leave thee naked and bare: and the nakedness of thy whoredoms shall be discovered, both thy lewdness and thy whoredoms.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will do these things unto thee, because thou hast gone a whoring after the heathen, and because thou art polluted with their idols.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast walked in the way of thy sister; therefore will I give her cup into thine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Thou shalt drink of thy sister's cup deep and large: thou shalt be laughed to scorn and had in derision; it containeth much.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, with the cup of astonishment and desolation, with the cup of thy sister Samaria.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt even drink it and suck it out, and thou shalt break the sherds thereof, and pluck off thine own breasts: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because thou hast forgotten me, and cast me behind thy back, therefore bear thou also thy lewdness and thy whoredoms.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The Lord said moreover unto me; Son of man, wilt thou judge Aholah and Aholibah? yea, declare unto them their abominations;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That they have committed adultery, and blood is in their hands, and with their idols have they committed adultery, and have also caused their sons, whom they bare unto me, to pass for them through the fire, to devour them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover this they have done unto me: they have defiled my sanctuary in the same day, and have profaned my sabbaths.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For when they had slain their children to their idols, then they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it; and, lo, thus have they done in the midst of mine house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And furthermore, that ye have sent for men to come from far, unto whom a messenger was sent; and, lo, they came: for whom thou didst wash thyself, paintedst thy eyes, and deckedst thyself with ornaments,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And satest upon a stately bed, and a table prepared before it, whereupon thou hast set mine incense and mine oil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And a voice of a multitude being at ease was with her: and with the men of the common sort were brought Sabeans from the wilderness, which put bracelets upon their hands, and beautiful crowns upon their heads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said I unto her that was old in adulteries, Will they now commit whoredoms with her, and she with them?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet they went in unto her, as they go in unto a woman that playeth the harlot: so went they in unto Aholah and unto Aholibah, the lewd women.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the righteous men, they shall judge them after the manner of adulteresses, and after the manner of women that shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; I will bring up a company upon them, and will give them to be removed and spoiled.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the company shall stone them with stones, and dispatch them with their swords; they shall slay their sons and their daughters, and burn up their houses with fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I cause lewdness to cease out of the land, that all women may be taught not to do after your lewdness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall recompense your lewdness upon you, and ye shall bear the sins of your idols: and ye shall know that I am the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, write thee the name of the day, even of this same day: the king of Babylon set himself against Jerusalem this same day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And utter a parable unto the rebellious house, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Set on a pot, set it on, and also pour water into it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Gather the pieces thereof into it, even every good piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fill it with the choice bones.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Take the choice of the flock, and burn also the bones under it, and make it boil well, and let them seethe the bones of it therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore thus saith the Lord God; Woe to the bloody city, to the pot whose scum is therein, and whose scum is not gone out of it! bring it out piece by piece; let no lot fall upon it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For her blood is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of a rock; she poured it not upon the ground, to cover it with dust;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That it might cause fury to come up to take vengeance; I have set her blood upon the top of a rock, that it should not be covered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Woe to the bloody city! I will even make the pile for fire great.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Heap on wood, kindle the fire, consume the flesh, and spice it well, and let the bones be burned.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then set it empty upon the coals thereof, that the brass of it may be hot, and may burn, and that the filthiness of it may be molten in it, that the scum of it may be consumed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: She hath wearied herself with lies, and her great scum went not forth out of her: her scum shall be in the fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In thy filthiness is lewdness: because I have purged thee, and thou wast not purged, thou shalt not be purged from thy filthiness any more, till I have caused my fury to rest upon thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I the Lord have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, behold, I take away from thee the desire of thine eyes with a stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep, neither shall thy tears run down.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Forbear to cry, make no mourning for the dead, bind the tire of thine head upon thee, and put on thy shoes upon thy feet, and cover not thy lips, and eat not the bread of men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So I spake unto the people in the morning: and at even my wife died; and I did in the morning as I was commanded.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the people said unto me, Wilt thou not tell us what these things are to us, that thou doest so?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then I answered them, The word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Speak unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the excellency of your strength, the desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pitieth; and your sons and your daughters whom ye have left shall fall by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall do as I have done: ye shall not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And your tires shall be upon your heads, and your shoes upon your feet: ye shall not mourn nor weep; but ye shall pine away for your iniquities, and mourn one toward another.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus Ezekiel is unto you a sign: according to all that he hath done shall ye do: and when this cometh, ye shall know that I am the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also, thou son of man, shall it not be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their minds, their sons and their daughters,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: That he that escapeth in that day shall come unto thee, to cause thee to hear it with thine ears?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In that day shall thy mouth be opened to him which is escaped, and thou shalt speak, and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face against the Ammonites, and prophesy against them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto the Ammonites, Hear the word of the Lord God; Thus saith the Lord God; Because thou saidst, Aha, against my sanctuary, when it was profaned; and against the land of Israel, when it was desolate; and against the house of Judah, when they went into captivity;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I will deliver thee to the men of the east for a possession, and they shall set their palaces in thee, and make their dwellings in thee: they shall eat thy fruit, and they shall drink thy milk.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make Rabbah a stable for camels, and the Ammonites a couchingplace for flocks: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; Because thou hast clapped thine hands, and stamped with the feet, and rejoiced in heart with all thy despite against the land of Israel;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I will stretch out mine hand upon thee, and will deliver thee for a spoil to the heathen; and I will cut thee off from the people, and I will cause thee to perish out of the countries: I will destroy thee; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because that Moab and Seir do say, Behold, the house of Judah is like unto all the heathen;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, behold, I will open the side of Moab from the cities, from his cities which are on his frontiers, the glory of the country, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Unto the men of the east with the Ammonites, and will give them in possession, that the Ammonites may not be remembered among the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will execute judgments upon Moab; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because that Edom hath dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and hath greatly offended, and revenged himself upon them;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; I will also stretch out mine hand upon Edom, and will cut off man and beast from it; and I will make it desolate from Teman; and they of Dedan shall fall by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel: and they shall do in Edom according to mine anger and according to my fury; and they shall know my vengeance, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge, and have taken vengeance with a despiteful heart, to destroy it for the old hatred;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will stretch out mine hand upon the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethims, and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will execute great vengeance upon them with furious rebukes; and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall lay my vengeance upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, because that Tyrus hath said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken that was the gates of the people: she is turned unto me: I shall be replenished, now she is laid waste:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, O Tyrus, and will cause many nations to come up against thee, as the sea causeth his waves to come up.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall destroy the walls of Tyrus, and break down her towers: I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her like the top of a rock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It shall be a place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord God: and it shall become a spoil to the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And her daughters which are in the field shall be slain by the sword; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will bring upon Tyrus Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, a king of kings, from the north, with horses, and with chariots, and with horsemen, and companies, and much people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He shall slay with the sword thy daughters in the field: and he shall make a fort against thee, and cast a mount against thee, and lift up the buckler against thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he shall set engines of war against thy walls, and with his axes he shall break down thy towers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover thee: thy walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wheels, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into thy gates, as men enter into a city wherein is made a breach.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: With the hoofs of his horses shall he tread down all thy streets: he shall slay thy people by the sword, and thy strong garrisons shall go down to the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall make a spoil of thy riches, and make a prey of thy merchandise: and they shall break down thy walls, and destroy thy pleasant houses: and they shall lay thy stones and thy timber and thy dust in the midst of the water.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will cause the noise of thy songs to cease; and the sound of thy harps shall be no more heard.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make thee like the top of a rock: thou shalt be a place to spread nets upon; thou shalt be built no more: for I the Lord have spoken it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God to Tyrus; Shall not the isles shake at the sound of thy fall, when the wounded cry, when the slaughter is made in the midst of thee?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then all the princes of the sea shall come down from their thrones, and lay away their robes, and put off their broidered garments: they shall clothe themselves with trembling; they shall sit upon the ground, and shall tremble at every moment, and be astonished at thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall take up a lamentation for thee, and say to thee, How art thou destroyed, that wast inhabited of seafaring men, the renowned city, which wast strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, which cause their terror to be on all that haunt it!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now shall the isles tremble in the day of thy fall; yea, the isles that are in the sea shall be troubled at thy departure.
