column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; When I shall make thee a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited; when I shall bring up the deep upon thee, and great waters shall cover thee;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I shall bring thee down with them that descend into the pit, with the people of old time, and shall set thee in the low parts of the earth, in places desolate of old, with them that go down to the pit, that thou be not inhabited; and I shall set glory in the land of the living;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will make thee a terror, and thou shalt be no more: though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never be found again, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now, thou son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyrus;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto Tyrus, O thou that art situate at the entry of the sea, which art a merchant of the people for many isles, Thus saith the Lord God; O Tyrus, thou hast said, I am of perfect beauty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thy borders are in the midst of the seas, thy builders have perfected thy beauty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They have made all thy ship boards of fir trees of Senir: they have taken cedars from Lebanon to make masts for thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Of the oaks of Bashan have they made thine oars; the company of the Ashurites have made thy benches of ivory, brought out of the isles of Chittim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Fine linen with broidered work from Egypt was that which thou spreadest forth to be thy sail; blue and purple from the isles of Elishah was that which covered thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The inhabitants of Zidon and Arvad were thy mariners: thy wise men, O Tyrus, that were in thee, were thy pilots.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The ancients of Gebal and the wise men thereof were in thee thy calkers: all the ships of the sea with their mariners were in thee to occupy thy merchandise.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They of Persia and of Lud and of Phut were in thine army, thy men of war: they hanged the shield and helmet in thee; they set forth thy comeliness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The men of Arvad with thine army were upon thy walls round about, and the Gammadims were in thy towers: they hanged their shields upon thy walls round about; they have made thy beauty perfect.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Tarshish was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of all kind of riches; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded in thy fairs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were thy merchants: they traded the persons of men and vessels of brass in thy market.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They of the house of Togarmah traded in thy fairs with horses and horsemen and mules.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The men of Dedan were thy merchants; many isles were the merchandise of thine hand: they brought thee for a present horns of ivory and ebony.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Syria was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of the wares of thy making: they occupied in thy fairs with emeralds, purple, and broidered work, and fine linen, and coral, and agate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Judah, and the land of Israel, they were thy merchants: they traded in thy market wheat of Minnith, and Pannag, and honey, and oil, and balm.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Damascus was thy merchant in the multitude of the wares of thy making, for the multitude of all riches; in the wine of Helbon, and white wool.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Dan also and Javan going to and fro occupied in thy fairs: bright iron, cassia, and calamus, were in thy market.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Dedan was thy merchant in precious clothes for chariots.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Arabia, and all the princes of Kedar, they occupied with thee in lambs, and rams, and goats: in these were they thy merchants.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The merchants of Sheba and Raamah, they were thy merchants: they occupied in thy fairs with chief of all spices, and with all precious stones, and gold.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Haran, and Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad, were thy merchants.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: These were thy merchants in all sorts of things, in blue clothes, and broidered work, and in chests of rich apparel, bound with cords, and made of cedar, among thy merchandise.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The ships of Tarshish did sing of thee in thy market: and thou wast replenished, and made very glorious in the midst of the seas.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thy rowers have brought thee into great waters: the east wind hath broken thee in the midst of the seas.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thy riches, and thy fairs, thy merchandise, thy mariners, and thy pilots, thy calkers, and the occupiers of thy merchandise, and all thy men of war, that are in thee, and in all thy company which is in the midst of thee, shall fall into the midst of the seas in the day of thy ruin.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The suburbs shall shake at the sound of the cry of thy pilots.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And all that handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand upon the land;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And shall cause their voice to be heard against thee, and shall cry bitterly, and shall cast up dust upon their heads, they shall wallow themselves in the ashes:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall make themselves utterly bald for thee, and gird them with sackcloth, and they shall weep for thee with bitterness of heart and bitter wailing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in their wailing they shall take up a lamentation for thee, and lament over thee, saying, What city is like Tyrus, like the destroyed in the midst of the sea?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When thy wares went forth out of the seas, thou filledst many people; thou didst enrich the kings of the earth with the multitude of thy riches and of thy merchandise.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the time when thou shalt be broken by the seas in the depths of the waters thy merchandise and all thy company in the midst of thee shall fall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All the inhabitants of the isles shall be astonished at thee, and their kings shall be sore afraid, they shall be troubled in their countenance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The merchants among the people shall hiss at thee; thou shalt be a terror, and never shalt be any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, say unto the prince of Tyrus, Thus saith the Lord God; Because thine heart is lifted up, and thou hast said, I am a God, I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man, and not God, though thou set thine heart as the heart of God:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, thou art wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thee:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: With thy wisdom and with thine understanding thou hast gotten thee riches, and hast gotten gold and silver into thy treasures:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: By thy great wisdom and by thy traffick hast thou increased thy riches, and thine heart is lifted up because of thy riches:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because thou hast set thine heart as the heart of God;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I will bring strangers upon thee, the terrible of the nations: and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom, and they shall defile thy brightness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall bring thee down to the pit, and thou shalt die the deaths of them that are slain in the midst of the seas.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thee, I am God? but thou shalt be a man, and no God, in the hand of him that slayeth thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt die the deaths of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, take up a lamentation upon the king of Tyrus, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord God; Thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast been in Eden the garden of God; every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald, and the carbuncle, and gold: the workmanship of thy tabrets and of thy pipes was prepared in thee in the day that thou wast created.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou art the anointed cherub that covereth; and I have set thee so: thou wast upon the holy mountain of God; thou hast walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou wast perfect in thy ways from the day that thou wast created, till iniquity was found in thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: By the multitude of thy merchandise they have filled the midst of thee with violence, and thou hast sinned: therefore I will cast thee as profane out of the mountain of God: and I will destroy thee, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thine heart was lifted up because of thy beauty, thou hast corrupted thy wisdom by reason of thy brightness: I will cast thee to the ground, I will lay thee before kings, that they may behold thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traffick; therefore will I bring forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will bring thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All they that know thee among the people shall be astonished at thee: thou shalt be a terror, and never shalt thou be any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face against Zidon, and prophesy against it,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, O Zidon; and I will be glorified in the midst of thee: and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall have executed judgments in her, and shall be sanctified in her.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I will send into her pestilence, and blood into her streets; and the wounded shall be judged in the midst of her by the sword upon her on every side; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there shall be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor any grieving thorn of all that are round about them, that despised them; and they shall know that I am the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the people among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the heathen, then shall they dwell in their land that I have given to my servant Jacob.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall dwell safely therein, and shall build houses, and plant vineyards; yea, they shall dwell with confidence, when I have executed judgments upon all those that despise them round about them; and they shall know that I am the Lord their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all Egypt:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Speak, and say, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great dragon that lieth in the midst of his rivers, which hath said, My river is mine own, and I have made it for myself.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I will put hooks in thy jaws, and I will cause the fish of thy rivers to stick unto thy scales, and I will bring thee up out of the midst of thy rivers, and all the fish of thy rivers shall stick unto thy scales.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will leave thee thrown into the wilderness, thee and all the fish of thy rivers: thou shalt fall upon the open fields; thou shalt not be brought together, nor gathered: I have given thee for meat to the beasts of the field and to the fowls of the heaven.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou didst break, and rend all their shoulder: and when they leaned upon thee, thou brakest, and madest all their loins to be at a stand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will bring a sword upon thee, and cut off man and beast out of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the land of Egypt shall be desolate and waste; and they shall know that I am the Lord: because he hath said, The river is mine, and I have made it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, therefore I am against thee, and against thy rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, from the tower of Syene even unto the border of Ethiopia.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of beast shall pass through it, neither shall it be inhabited forty years.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be desolate forty years: and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet thus saith the Lord God; At the end of forty years will I gather the Egyptians from the people whither they were scattered:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will bring again the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It shall be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shall it exalt itself any more above the nations: for I will diminish them, that they shall no more rule over the nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, which bringeth their iniquity to remembrance, when they shall look after them: but they shall know that I am the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyrus: every head was made bald, and every shoulder was peeled: yet had he no wages, nor his army, for Tyrus, for the service that he had served against it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will give the land of Egypt unto Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall take her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the wages for his army.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I have given him the land of Egypt for his labour wherewith he served against it, because they wrought for me, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In that day will I cause the horn of the house of Israel to bud forth, and I will give thee the opening of the mouth in the midst of them; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord God; Howl ye, Woe worth the day!

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For the day is near, even the day of the Lord is near, a cloudy day; it shall be the time of the heathen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the sword shall come upon Egypt, and great pain shall be in Ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in Egypt, and they shall take away her multitude, and her foundations shall be broken down.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ethiopia, and Libya, and Lydia, and all the mingled people, and Chub, and the men of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord; They also that uphold Egypt shall fall; and the pride of her power shall come down: from the tower of Syene shall they fall in it by the sword, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall know that I am the Lord, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and when all her helpers shall be destroyed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In that day shall messengers go forth from me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid, and great pain shall come upon them, as in the day of Egypt: for, lo, it cometh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease by the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought to destroy the land: and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make the rivers dry, and sell the land into the hand of the wicked: and I will make the land waste, and all that is therein, by the hand of strangers: I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; I will also destroy the idols, and I will cause their images to cease out of Noph; and there shall be no more a prince of the land of Egypt: and I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make Pathros desolate, and will set fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments in No.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will pour my fury upon Sin, the strength of Egypt; and I will cut off the multitude of No.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set fire in Egypt: Sin shall have great pain, and No shall be rent asunder, and Noph shall have distresses daily.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The young men of Aven and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword: and these cities shall go into captivity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: At Tehaphnehes also the day shall be darkened, when I shall break there the yokes of Egypt: and the pomp of her strength shall cease in her: as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters shall go into captivity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I execute judgments in Egypt: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, lo, it shall not be bound up to be healed, to put a roller to bind it, to make it strong to hold the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong, and that which was broken; and I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I will break Pharaoh's arms, and he shall groan before him with the groanings of a deadly wounded man.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall stretch it out upon the land of Egypt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them among the countries; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude; Whom art thou like in thy greatness?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches, and with a shadowing shroud, and of an high stature; and his top was among the thick boughs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The waters made him great, the deep set him up on high with her rivers running round about his plants, and sent out her little rivers unto all the trees of the field.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore his height was exalted above all the trees of the field, and his boughs were multiplied, and his branches became long because of the multitude of waters, when he shot forth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All the fowls of heaven made their nests in his boughs, and under his branches did all the beasts of the field bring forth their young, and under his shadow dwelt all great nations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus was he fair in his greatness, in the length of his branches: for his root was by great waters.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The cedars in the garden of God could not hide him: the fir trees were not like his boughs, and the chestnut trees were not like his branches; nor any tree in the garden of God was like unto him in his beauty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I have made him fair by the multitude of his branches: so that all the trees of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because thou hast lifted up thyself in height, and he hath shot up his top among the thick boughs, and his heart is lifted up in his height;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I have therefore delivered him into the hand of the mighty one of the heathen; he shall surely deal with him: I have driven him out for his wickedness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And strangers, the terrible of the nations, have cut him off, and have left him: upon the mountains and in all the valleys his branches are fallen, and his boughs are broken by all the rivers of the land; and all the people of the earth are gone down from his shadow, and have left him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Upon his ruin shall all the fowls of the heaven remain, and all the beasts of the field shall be upon his branches:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: To the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves for their height, neither shoot up their top among the thick boughs, neither their trees stand up in their height, all that drink water: for they are all delivered unto death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; In the day when he went down to the grave I caused a mourning: I covered the deep for him, and I restrained the floods thereof, and the great waters were stayed: and I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to hell with them that descend into the pit: and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, shall be comforted in the nether parts of the earth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They also went down into hell with him unto them that be slain with the sword; and they that were his arm, that dwelt under his shadow in the midst of the heathen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: To whom art thou thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the trees of Eden unto the nether parts of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the uncircumcised with them that be slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, in the first day of the month, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, take up a lamentation for Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say unto him, Thou art like a young lion of the nations, and thou art as a whale in the seas: and thou camest forth with thy rivers, and troubledst the waters with thy feet, and fouledst their rivers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; I will therefore spread out my net over thee with a company of many people; and they shall bring thee up in my net.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then will I leave thee upon the land, I will cast thee forth upon the open field, and will cause all the fowls of the heaven to remain upon thee, and I will fill the beasts of the whole earth with thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will lay thy flesh upon the mountains, and fill the valleys with thy height.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will also water with thy blood the land wherein thou swimmest, even to the mountains; and the rivers shall be full of thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when I shall put thee out, I will cover the heaven, and make the stars thereof dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon shall not give her light.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All the bright lights of heaven will I make dark over thee, and set darkness upon thy land, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will also vex the hearts of many people, when I shall bring thy destruction among the nations, into the countries which thou hast not known.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, I will make many people amazed at thee, and their kings shall be horribly afraid for thee, when I shall brandish my sword before them; and they shall tremble at every moment, every man for his own life, in the day of thy fall.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: By the swords of the mighty will I cause thy multitude to fall, the terrible of the nations, all of them: and they shall spoil the pomp of Egypt, and all the multitude thereof shall be destroyed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will destroy also all the beasts thereof from beside the great waters; neither shall the foot of man trouble them any more, nor the hoofs of beasts trouble them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then will I make their waters deep, and cause their rivers to run like oil, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I shall make the land of Egypt desolate, and the country shall be destitute of that whereof it was full, when I shall smite all them that dwell therein, then shall they know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This is the lamentation wherewith they shall lament her: the daughters of the nations shall lament her: they shall lament for her, even for Egypt, and for all her multitude, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It came to pass also in the twelfth year, in the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, wail for the multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, even her, and the daughters of the famous nations, unto the nether parts of the earth, with them that go down into the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Whom dost thou pass in beauty? go down, and be thou laid with the uncircumcised.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall fall in the midst of them that are slain by the sword: she is delivered to the sword: draw her and all her multitudes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The strong among the mighty shall speak to him out of the midst of hell with them that help him: they are gone down, they lie uncircumcised, slain by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Asshur is there and all her company: his graves are about him: all of them slain, fallen by the sword:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Whose graves are set in the sides of the pit, and her company is round about her grave: all of them slain, fallen by the sword, which caused terror in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There is Elam and all her multitude round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, which are gone down uncircumcised into the nether parts of the earth, which caused their terror in the land of the living; yet have they borne their shame with them that go down to the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They have set her a bed in the midst of the slain with all her multitude: her graves are round about him: all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword: though their terror was caused in the land of the living, yet have they borne their shame with them that go down to the pit: he is put in the midst of them that be slain.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all her multitude: her graves are round about him: all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, though they caused their terror in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall not lie with the mighty that are fallen of the uncircumcised, which are gone down to hell with their weapons of war: and they have laid their swords under their heads, but their iniquities shall be upon their bones, though they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, thou shalt be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised, and shalt lie with them that are slain with the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There is Edom, her kings, and all her princes, which with their might are laid by them that were slain by the sword: they shall lie with the uncircumcised, and with them that go down to the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: There be the princes of the north, all of them, and all the Zidonians, which are gone down with the slain; with their terror they are ashamed of their might; and they lie uncircumcised with them that be slain by the sword, and bear their shame with them that go down to the pit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Pharaoh shall see them, and shall be comforted over all his multitude, even Pharaoh and all his army slain by the sword, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I have caused my terror in the land of the living: and he shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcised with them that are slain with the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: If when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning shall deliver his soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at the watchman's hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgressions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression: as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall the righteous be able to live for his righteousness in the day that he sinneth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I shall say to the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the statutes of life, without committing iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When the righteous turneth from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But if the wicked turn from his wickedness, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I will judge you every one after his ways.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smitten.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now the hand of the Lord was upon me in the evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Ye eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blood: and shall ye possess the land?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one his neighbour's wife: and shall ye possess the land?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say thou thus unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; As I live, surely they that are in the wastes shall fall by the sword, and him that is in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured, and they that be in the forts and in the caves shall die of the pestilence.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I will lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her strength shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, that none shall pass through.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then shall they know that I am the Lord, when I have laid the land most desolate because of all their abominations which they have committed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also, thou son of man, the children of thy people still are talking against thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they come unto thee as the people cometh, and they sit before thee as my people, and they hear thy words, but they will not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when this cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall they know that a prophet hath been among them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel, prophesy, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God unto the shepherds; Woe be to the shepherds of Israel that do feed themselves! should not the shepherds feed the flocks?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye eat the fat, and ye clothe you with the wool, ye kill them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The diseased have ye not strengthened, neither have ye healed that which was sick, neither have ye bound up that which was broken, neither have ye brought again that which was driven away, neither have ye sought that which was lost; but with force and with cruelty have ye ruled them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they were scattered, because there is no shepherd: and they became meat to all the beasts of the field, when they were scattered.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: My sheep wandered through all the mountains, and upon every high hill: yea, my flock was scattered upon all the face of the earth, and none did search or seek after them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As I live, saith the Lord God, surely because my flock became a prey, and my flock became meat to every beast of the field, because there was no shepherd, neither did my shepherds search for my flock, but the shepherds fed themselves, and fed not my flock;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, O ye shepherds, hear the word of the Lord;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against the shepherds; and I will require my flock at their hand, and cause them to cease from feeding the flock; neither shall the shepherds feed themselves any more; for I will deliver my flock from their mouth, that they may not be meat for them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I, even I, will both search my sheep, and seek them out.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As a shepherd seeketh out his flock in the day that he is among his sheep that are scattered; so will I seek out my sheep, and will deliver them out of all places where they have been scattered in the cloudy and dark day.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will bring them out from the people, and gather them from the countries, and will bring them to their own land, and feed them upon the mountains of Israel by the rivers, and in all the inhabited places of the country.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will feed them in a good pasture, and upon the high mountains of Israel shall their fold be: there shall they lie in a good fold, and in a fat pasture shall they feed upon the mountains of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will feed my flock, and I will cause them to lie down, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will seek that which was lost, and bring again that which was driven away, and will bind up that which was broken, and will strengthen that which was sick: but I will destroy the fat and the strong; I will feed them with judgment.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as for you, O my flock, thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I judge between cattle and cattle, between the rams and the he goats.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Seemeth it a small thing unto you to have eaten up the good pasture, but ye must tread down with your feet the residue of your pastures? and to have drunk of the deep waters, but ye must foul the residue with your feet?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And as for my flock, they eat that which ye have trodden with your feet; and they drink that which ye have fouled with your feet.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God unto them; Behold, I, even I, will judge between the fat cattle and between the lean cattle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because ye have thrust with side and with shoulder, and pushed all the diseased with your horns, till ye have scattered them abroad;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore will I save my flock, and they shall no more be a prey; and I will judge between cattle and cattle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set up one shepherd over them, and he shall feed them, even my servant David; he shall feed them, and he shall be their shepherd.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I the Lord will be their God, and my servant David a prince among them; I the Lord have spoken it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make with them a covenant of peace, and will cause the evil beasts to cease out of the land: and they shall dwell safely in the wilderness, and sleep in the woods.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make them and the places round about my hill a blessing; and I will cause the shower to come down in his season; there shall be showers of blessing.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the tree of the field shall yield her fruit, and the earth shall yield her increase, and they shall be safe in their land, and shall know that I am the Lord, when I have broken the bands of their yoke, and delivered them out of the hand of those that served themselves of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall no more be a prey to the heathen, neither shall the beast of the land devour them; but they shall dwell safely, and none shall make them afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will raise up for them a plant of renown, and they shall be no more consumed with hunger in the land, neither bear the shame of the heathen any more.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus shall they know that I the Lord their God am with them, and that they, even the house of Israel, are my people, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye my flock, the flock of my pasture, are men, and I am your God, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face against mount Seir, and prophesy against it,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto it, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and I will make thee most desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will lay thy cities waste, and thou shalt be desolate, and thou shalt know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because thou hast had a perpetual hatred, and hast shed the blood of the children of Israel by the force of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time that their iniquity had an end:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord God, I will prepare thee unto blood, and blood shall pursue thee: sith thou hast not hated blood, even blood shall pursue thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I make mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it him that passeth out and him that returneth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will fill his mountains with his slain men: in thy hills, and in thy valleys, and in all thy rivers, shall they fall that are slain with the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will make thee perpetual desolations, and thy cities shall not return: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because thou hast said, These two nations and these two countries shall be mine, and we will possess it; whereas the Lord was there:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord God, I will even do according to thine anger, and according to thine envy which thou hast used out of thy hatred against them; and I will make myself known among them, when I have judged thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt know that I am the Lord, and that I have heard all thy blasphemies which thou hast spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate, they are given us to consume.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; When the whole earth rejoiceth, I will make thee desolate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As thou didst rejoice at the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was desolate, so will I do unto thee: thou shalt be desolate, O mount Seir, and all Idumea, even all of it: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also, thou son of man, prophesy unto the mountains of Israel, and say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because the enemy hath said against you, Aha, even the ancient high places are ours in possession:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord God; Because they have made you desolate, and swallowed you up on every side, that ye might be a possession unto the residue of the heathen, and ye are taken up in the lips of talkers, and are an infamy of the people:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord God; Thus saith the Lord God to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys, to the desolate wastes, and to the cities that are forsaken, which became a prey and derision to the residue of the heathen that are round about;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Surely in the fire of my jealousy have I spoken against the residue of the heathen, and against all Idumea, which have appointed my land into their possession with the joy of all their heart, with despiteful minds, to cast it out for a prey.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Prophesy therefore concerning the land of Israel, and say unto the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I have spoken in my jealousy and in my fury, because ye have borne the shame of the heathen:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; I have lifted up mine hand, Surely the heathen that are about you, they shall bear their shame.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But ye, O mountains of Israel, ye shall shoot forth your branches, and yield your fruit to my people of Israel; for they are at hand to come.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For, behold, I am for you, and I will turn unto you, and ye shall be tilled and sown:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel, even all of it: and the cities shall be inhabited, and the wastes shall be builded:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will multiply upon you man and beast; and they shall increase and bring fruit: and I will settle you after your old estates, and will do better unto you than at your beginnings: and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, I will cause men to walk upon you, even my people Israel; and they shall possess thee, and thou shalt be their inheritance, and thou shalt no more henceforth bereave them of men.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Because they say unto you, Thou land devourest up men, and hast bereaved thy nations;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thou shalt devour men no more, neither bereave thy nations any more, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither will I cause men to hear in thee the shame of the heathen any more, neither shalt thou bear the reproach of the people any more, neither shalt thou cause thy nations to fall any more, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, when the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, they defiled it by their own way and by their doings: their way was before me as the uncleanness of a removed woman.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Wherefore I poured my fury upon them for the blood that they had shed upon the land, and for their idols wherewith they had polluted it:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I scattered them among the heathen, and they were dispersed through the countries: according to their way and according to their doings I judged them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when they entered unto the heathen, whither they went, they profaned my holy name, when they said to them, These are the people of the Lord, and are gone forth out of his land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I had pity for mine holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the heathen, whither they went.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore say unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; I do not this for your sakes, O house of Israel, but for mine holy name's sake, which ye have profaned among the heathen, whither ye went.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will sanctify my great name, which was profaned among the heathen, which ye have profaned in the midst of them; and the heathen shall know that I am the Lord, saith the Lord God, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For I will take you from among the heathen, and gather you out of all countries, and will bring you into your own land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shall be clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will I cleanse you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you: and I will take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I will give you an heart of flesh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will put my spirit within you, and cause you to walk in my statutes, and ye shall keep my judgments, and do them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers; and ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and I will call for the corn, and will increase it, and lay no famine upon you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will multiply the fruit of the tree, and the increase of the field, that ye shall receive no more reproach of famine among the heathen.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then shall ye remember your own evil ways, and your doings that were not good, and shall lothe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Not for your sakes do I this, saith the Lord God, be it known unto you: be ashamed and confounded for your own ways, O house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; In the day that I shall have cleansed you from all your iniquities I will also cause you to dwell in the cities, and the wastes shall be builded.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the desolate land shall be tilled, whereas it lay desolate in the sight of all that passed by.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall say, This land that was desolate is become like the garden of Eden; and the waste and desolate and ruined cities are become fenced, and are inhabited.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then the heathen that are left round about you shall know that I the Lord build the ruined places, and plant that that was desolate: I the Lord have spoken it, and I will do it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; I will yet for this be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do it for them; I will increase them with men like a flock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As the holy flock, as the flock of Jerusalem in her solemn feasts; so shall the waste cities be filled with flocks of men: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The hand of the Lord was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the Lord, and set me down in the midst of the valley which was full of bones,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And caused me to pass by them round about: and, behold, there were very many in the open valley; and, lo, they were very dry.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord God, thou knowest.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to his bone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but there was no breath in them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord God; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he said unto me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you in your own land: then shall ye know that I the Lord have spoken it, and performed it, saith the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The word of the Lord came again unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover, thou son of man, take thee one stick, and write upon it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write upon it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And join them one to another into one stick; and they shall become one in thine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when the children of thy people shall speak unto thee, saying, Wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his fellows, and will put them with him, even with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they shall be one in mine hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the sticks whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand before their eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the heathen, whither they be gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will make them one nation in the land upon the mountains of Israel; and one king shall be king to them all: and they shall be no more two nations, neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces, wherein they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And David my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgments, and observe my statutes, and do them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant, wherein your fathers have dwelt; and they shall dwell therein, even they, and their children, and their children's children for ever: and my servant David shall be their prince for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them: and I will place them, and multiply them, and will set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: My tabernacle also shall be with them: yea, I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the heathen shall know that I the Lord do sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Son of man, set thy face against Gog, the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And say, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will turn thee back, and put hooks into thy jaws, and I will bring thee forth, and all thine army, horses and horsemen, all of them clothed with all sorts of armour, even a great company with bucklers and shields, all of them handling swords:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Persia, Ethiopia, and Libya with them; all of them with shield and helmet:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Gomer, and all his bands; the house of Togarmah of the north quarters, and all his bands: and many people with thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Be thou prepared, and prepare for thyself, thou, and all thy company that are assembled unto thee, and be thou a guard unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: After many days thou shalt be visited: in the latter years thou shalt come into the land that is brought back from the sword, and is gathered out of many people, against the mountains of Israel, which have been always waste: but it is brought forth out of the nations, and they shall dwell safely all of them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt ascend and come like a storm, thou shalt be like a cloud to cover the land, thou, and all thy bands, and many people with thee.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; It shall also come to pass, that at the same time shall things come into thy mind, and thou shalt think an evil thought:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt say, I will go up to the land of unwalled villages; I will go to them that are at rest, that dwell safely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: To take a spoil, and to take a prey; to turn thine hand upon the desolate places that are now inhabited, and upon the people that are gathered out of the nations, which have gotten cattle and goods, that dwell in the midst of the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Sheba, and Dedan, and the merchants of Tarshish, with all the young lions thereof, shall say unto thee, Art thou come to take a spoil? hast thou gathered thy company to take a prey? to carry away silver and gold, to take away cattle and goods, to take a great spoil?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say unto Gog, Thus saith the Lord God; In that day when my people of Israel dwelleth safely, shalt thou not know it?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt come from thy place out of the north parts, thou, and many people with thee, all of them riding upon horses, a great company, and a mighty army:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt come up against my people of Israel, as a cloud to cover the land; it shall be in the latter days, and I will bring thee against my land, that the heathen may know me, when I shall be sanctified in thee, O Gog, before their eyes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Art thou he of whom I have spoken in old time by my servants the prophets of Israel, which prophesied in those days many years that I would bring thee against them?

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass at the same time when Gog shall come against the land of Israel, saith the Lord God, that my fury shall come up in my face.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath have I spoken, Surely in that day there shall be a great shaking in the land of Israel;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So that the fishes of the sea, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the field, and all creeping things that creep upon the earth, and all the men that are upon the face of the earth, shall shake at my presence, and the mountains shall be thrown down, and the steep places shall fall, and every wall shall fall to the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will call for a sword against him throughout all my mountains, saith the Lord God: every man's sword shall be against his brother.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will plead against him with pestilence and with blood; and I will rain upon him, and upon his bands, and upon the many people that are with him, an overflowing rain, and great hailstones, fire, and brimstone.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus will I magnify myself, and sanctify myself; and I will be known in the eyes of many nations, and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore, thou son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I am against thee, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will turn thee back, and leave but the sixth part of thee, and will cause thee to come up from the north parts, and will bring thee upon the mountains of Israel:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will smite thy bow out of thy left hand, and will cause thine arrows to fall out of thy right hand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt fall upon the mountains of Israel, thou, and all thy bands, and the people that is with thee: I will give thee unto the ravenous birds of every sort, and to the beasts of the field to be devoured.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt fall upon the open field: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will send a fire on Magog, and among them that dwell carelessly in the isles: and they shall know that I am the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So will I make my holy name known in the midst of my people Israel; and I will not let them pollute my holy name any more: and the heathen shall know that I am the Lord, the Holy One in Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the Lord God; this is the day whereof I have spoken.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they that dwell in the cities of Israel shall go forth, and shall set on fire and burn the weapons, both the shields and the bucklers, the bows and the arrows, and the handstaves, and the spears, and they shall burn them with fire seven years:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So that they shall take no wood out of the field, neither cut down any out of the forests; for they shall burn the weapons with fire: and they shall spoil those that spoiled them, and rob those that robbed them, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will give unto Gog a place there of graves in Israel, the valley of the passengers on the east of the sea: and it shall stop the noses of the passengers: and there shall they bury Gog and all his multitude: and they shall call it The valley of Hamon-gog.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And seven months shall the house of Israel be burying of them, that they may cleanse the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yea, all the people of the land shall bury them; and it shall be to them a renown the day that I shall be glorified, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall sever out men of continual employment, passing through the land to bury with the passengers those that remain upon the face of the earth, to cleanse it: after the end of seven months shall they search.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the passengers that pass through the land, when any seeth a man's bone, then shall he set up a sign by it, till the buriers have buried it in the valley of Hamon-gog.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And also the name of the city shall be Hamonah. Thus shall they cleanse the land.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord God; Speak unto every feathered fowl, and to every beast of the field, Assemble yourselves, and come; gather yourselves on every side to my sacrifice that I do sacrifice for you, even a great sacrifice upon the mountains of Israel, that ye may eat flesh, and drink blood.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye shall eat the flesh of the mighty, and drink the blood of the princes of the earth, of rams, of lambs, and of goats, of bullocks, all of them fatlings of Bashan.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall eat fat till ye be full, and drink blood till ye be drunken, of my sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus ye shall be filled at my table with horses and chariots, with mighty men, and with all men of war, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I will set my glory among the heathen, and all the heathen shall see my judgment that I have executed, and my hand that I have laid upon them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So the house of Israel shall know that I am the Lord their God from that day and forward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the heathen shall know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity: because they trespassed against me, therefore hid I my face from them, and gave them into the hand of their enemies: so fell they all by the sword.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: According to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions have I done unto them, and hid my face from them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Now will I bring again the captivity of Jacob, and have mercy upon the whole house of Israel, and will be jealous for my holy name;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: After that they have borne their shame, and all their trespasses whereby they have trespassed against me, when they dwelt safely in their land, and none made them afraid.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When I have brought them again from the people, and gathered them out of their enemies' lands, and am sanctified in them in the sight of many nations;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then shall they know that I am the Lord their God, which caused them to be led into captivity among the heathen: but I have gathered them unto their own land, and have left none of them any more there.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither will I hide my face any more from them: for I have poured out my spirit upon the house of Israel, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after that the city was smitten, in the selfsame day the hand of the Lord was upon me, and brought me thither.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the visions of God brought he me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, by which was as the frame of a city on the south.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me thither, and, behold, there was a man, whose appearance was like the appearance of brass, with a line of flax in his hand, and a measuring reed; and he stood in the gate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the man said unto me, Son of man, behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears, and set thine heart upon all that I shall shew thee; for to the intent that I might shew them unto thee art thou brought hither: declare all that thou seest to the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And behold a wall on the outside of the house round about, and in the man's hand a measuring reed of six cubits long by the cubit and an hand breadth: so he measured the breadth of the building, one reed; and the height, one reed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then came he unto the gate which looketh toward the east, and went up the stairs thereof, and measured the threshold of the gate, which was one reed broad; and the other threshold of the gate, which was one reed broad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And every little chamber was one reed long, and one reed broad; and between the little chambers were five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate within was one reed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured also the porch of the gate within, one reed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then measured he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the posts thereof, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was inward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the little chambers of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The space also before the little chambers was one cubit on this side, and the space was one cubit on that side: and the little chambers were six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured then the gate from the roof of one little chamber to the roof of another: the breadth was five and twenty cubits, door against door.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He made also posts of threescore cubits, even unto the post of the court round about the gate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And from the face of the gate of the entrance unto the face of the porch of the inner gate were fifty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
