column17: And there were narrow windows to the little chambers, and to their posts within the gate round about, and likewise to the arches: and windows were round about inward: and upon each post were palm trees.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then brought he me into the outward court, and, lo, there were chambers, and a pavement made for the court round about: thirty chambers were upon the pavement.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the pavement by the side of the gates over against the length of the gates was the lower pavement.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he measured the breadth from the forefront of the lower gate unto the forefront of the inner court without, an hundred cubits eastward and northward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the gate of the outward court that looked toward the north, he measured the length thereof, and the breadth thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the little chambers thereof were three on this side and three on that side; and the posts thereof and the arches thereof were after the measure of the first gate: the length thereof was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And their windows, and their arches, and their palm trees, were after the measure of the gate that looketh toward the east; and they went up unto it by seven steps; and the arches thereof were before them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the gate of the inner court was over against the gate toward the north, and toward the east; and he measured from gate to gate an hundred cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: After that he brought me toward the south, and behold a gate toward the south: and he measured the posts thereof and the arches thereof according to these measures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there were windows in it and in the arches thereof round about, like those windows: the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there were seven steps to go up to it, and the arches thereof were before them: and it had palm trees, one on this side, and another on that side, upon the posts thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there was a gate in the inner court toward the south: and he measured from gate to gate toward the south an hundred cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me to the inner court by the south gate: and he measured the south gate according to these measures;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, according to these measures: and there were windows in it and in the arches thereof round about: it was fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the arches round about were five and twenty cubits long, and five cubits broad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the arches thereof were toward the utter court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof: and the going up to it had eight steps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, were according to these measures: and there were windows therein and in the arches thereof round about: it was fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the arches thereof were toward the outward court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it had eight steps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me to the north gate, and measured it according to these measures;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The little chambers thereof, the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, and the windows to it round about: the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the posts thereof were toward the utter court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it had eight steps.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the chambers and the entries thereof were by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in the porch of the gate were two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay thereon the burnt offering and the sin offering and the trespass offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And at the side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the north gate, were two tables; and on the other side, which was at the porch of the gate, were two tables.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew their sacrifices.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the four tables were of hewn stone for the burnt offering, of a cubit and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and one cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instruments wherewith they slew the burnt offering and the sacrifice.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And within were hooks, an hand broad, fastened round about: and upon the tables was the flesh of the offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And without the inner gate were the chambers of the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their prospect was toward the south: one at the side of the east gate having the prospect toward the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar: these are the sons of Zadok among the sons of Levi, which come near to the Lord to minister unto him.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So he measured the court, an hundred cubits long, and an hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar that was before the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate was three cubits on this side, and three cubits on that side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; and he brought me by the steps whereby they went up to it: and there were pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Afterward he brought me to the temple, and measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side, and six cubits broad on the other side, which was the breadth of the tabernacle.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the breadth of the door was ten cubits; and the sides of the door were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length thereof, forty cubits: and the breadth, twenty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then went he inward, and measured the post of the door, two cubits; and the door, six cubits; and the breadth of the door, seven cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So he measured the length thereof, twenty cubits; and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said unto me, This is the most holy place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: After he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of every side chamber, four cubits, round about the house on every side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the side chambers were three, one over another, and thirty in order; and they entered into the wall which was of the house for the side chambers round about, that they might have hold, but they had not hold in the wall of the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there was an enlarging, and a winding about still upward to the side chambers: for the winding about of the house went still upward round about the house: therefore the breadth of the house was still upward, and so increased from the lowest chamber to the highest by the midst.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: I saw also the height of the house round about: the foundations of the side chambers were a full reed of six great cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The thickness of the wall, which was for the side chamber without, was five cubits: and that which was left was the place of the side chambers that were within.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And between the chambers was the wideness of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the doors of the side chambers were toward the place that was left, one door toward the north, and another door toward the south: and the breadth of the place that was left was five cubits round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now the building that was before the separate place at the end toward the west was seventy cubits broad; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick round about, and the length thereof ninety cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So he measured the house, an hundred cubits long; and the separate place, and the building, with the walls thereof, an hundred cubits long;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Also the breadth of the face of the house, and of the separate place toward the east, an hundred cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he measured the length of the building over against the separate place which was behind it, and the galleries thereof on the one side and on the other side, an hundred cubits, with the inner temple, and the porches of the court;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The door posts, and the narrow windows, and the galleries round about on their three stories, over against the door, ceiled with wood round about, and from the ground up to the windows, and the windows were covered;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: To that above the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the wall round about within and without, by measure.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it was made with cherubims and palm trees, so that a palm tree was between a cherub and a cherub; and every cherub had two faces;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So that the face of a man was toward the palm tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side: it was made through all the house round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: From the ground unto above the door were cherubims and palm trees made, and on the wall of the temple.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The posts of the temple were squared, and the face of the sanctuary; the appearance of the one as the appearance of the other.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The altar of wood was three cubits high, and the length thereof two cubits; and the corners thereof, and the length thereof, and the walls thereof, were of wood: and he said unto me, This is the table that is before the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the temple and the sanctuary had two doors.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the doors had two leaves apiece, two turning leaves; two leaves for the one door, and two leaves for the other door.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there were made on them, on the doors of the temple, cherubims and palm trees, like as were made upon the walls; and there were thick planks upon the face of the porch without.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there were narrow windows and palm trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch, and upon the side chambers of the house, and thick planks.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was before the building toward the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Before the length of an hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Over against the twenty cubits which were for the inner court, and over against the pavement which was for the utter court, was gallery against gallery in three stories.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors toward the north.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now the upper chambers were shorter: for the galleries were higher than these, than the lower, and than the middlemost of the building.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For they were in three stories, but had not pillars as the pillars of the courts: therefore the building was straitened more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the wall that was without over against the chambers, toward the utter court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof was fifty cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: For the length of the chambers that were in the utter court was fifty cubits: and, lo, before the temple were an hundred cubits.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the utter court.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The chambers were in the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, over against the separate place, and over against the building.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the way before them was like the appearance of the chambers which were toward the north, as long as they, and as broad as they: and all their goings out were both according to their fashions, and according to their doors.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And according to the doors of the chambers that were toward the south was a door in the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as one entereth into them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they be holy chambers, where the priests that approach unto the Lord shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When the priests enter therein, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the utter court, but there they shall lay their garments wherein they minister; for they are holy; and shall put on other garments, and shall approach to those things which are for the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east, and measured it round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured the north side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured the south side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: He measured it by the four sides: it had a wall round about, five hundred reeds long, and five hundred broad, to make a separation between the sanctuary and the profane place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that looketh toward the east:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east: and his voice was like a noise of many waters: and the earth shined with his glory.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it was according to the appearance of the vision which I saw, even according to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city: and the visions were like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell upon my face.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the glory of the Lord came into the house by the way of the gate whose prospect is toward the east.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So the spirit took me up, and brought me into the inner court; and, behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And I heard him speaking unto me out of the house; and the man stood by me.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, the place of my throne, and the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel for ever, and my holy name, shall the house of Israel no more defile, neither they, nor their kings, by their whoredom, nor by the carcases of their kings in their high places.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In their setting of their threshold by my thresholds, and their post by my posts, and the wall between me and them, they have even defiled my holy name by their abominations that they have committed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now let them put away their whoredom, and the carcases of their kings, far from me, and I will dwell in the midst of them for ever.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou son of man, shew the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities: and let them measure the pattern.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And if they be ashamed of all that they have done, shew them the form of the house, and the fashion thereof, and the goings out thereof, and the comings in thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the laws thereof: and write it in their sight, that they may keep the whole form thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and do them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This is the law of the house; Upon the top of the mountain the whole limit thereof round about shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And these are the measures of the altar after the cubits: The cubit is a cubit and an hand breadth; even the bottom shall be a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and the border thereof by the edge thereof round about shall be a span: and this shall be the higher place of the altar.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And from the bottom upon the ground even to the lower settle shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser settle even to the greater settle shall be four cubits, and the breadth one cubit.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So the altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar and upward shall be four horns.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the altar shall be twelve cubits long, twelve broad, square in the four squares thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the settle shall be fourteen cubits long and fourteen broad in the four squares thereof; and the border about it shall be half a cubit; and the bottom thereof shall be a cubit about; and his stairs shall look toward the east.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, thus saith the Lord God; These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they shall make it, to offer burnt offerings thereon, and to sprinkle blood thereon.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt give to the priests the Levites that be of the seed of Zadok, which approach unto me, to minister unto me, saith the Lord God, a young bullock for a sin offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt take of the blood thereof, and put it on the four horns of it, and on the four corners of the settle, and upon the border round about: thus shalt thou cleanse and purge it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt take the bullock also of the sin offering, and he shall burn it in the appointed place of the house, without the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And on the second day thou shalt offer a kid of the goats without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they did cleanse it with the bullock.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: When thou hast made an end of cleansing it, thou shalt offer a young bullock without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without blemish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt offer them before the Lord, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering unto the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat for a sin offering: they shall also prepare a young bullock, and a ram out of the flock, without blemish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Seven days shall they purge the altar and purify it; and they shall consecrate themselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when these days are expired, it shall be, that upon the eighth day, and so forward, the priests shall make your burnt offerings upon the altar, and your peace offerings; and I will accept you, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he brought me back the way of the gate of the outward sanctuary which looketh toward the east; and it was shut.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said the Lord unto me; This gate shall be shut, it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter in by it; because the Lord, the God of Israel, hath entered in by it, therefore it shall be shut.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It is for the prince; the prince, he shall sit in it to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate, and shall go out by the way of the same.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then brought he me the way of the north gate before the house: and I looked, and, behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord: and I fell upon my face.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Lord said unto me, Son of man, mark well, and behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears all that I say unto thee concerning all the ordinances of the house of the Lord, and all the laws thereof; and mark well the entering in of the house, with every going forth of the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt say to the rebellious, even to the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; O ye house of Israel, let it suffice you of all your abominations,

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In that ye have brought into my sanctuary strangers, uncircumcised in heart, and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to pollute it, even my house, when ye offer my bread, the fat and the blood, and they have broken my covenant because of all your abominations.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye have not kept the charge of mine holy things: but ye have set keepers of my charge in my sanctuary for yourselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; No stranger, uncircumcised in heart, nor uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any stranger that is among the children of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the Levites that are gone away far from me, when Israel went astray, which went astray away from me after their idols; they shall even bear their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Yet they shall be ministers in my sanctuary, having charge at the gates of the house, and ministering to the house: they shall slay the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister unto them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Because they ministered unto them before their idols, and caused the house of Israel to fall into iniquity; therefore have I lifted up mine hand against them, saith the Lord God, and they shall bear their iniquity.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall not come near unto me, to do the office of a priest unto me, nor to come near to any of my holy things, in the most holy place: but they shall bear their shame, and their abominations which they have committed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But I will make them keepers of the charge of the house, for all the service thereof, and for all that shall be done therein.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, that kept the charge of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shall come near to me to minister unto me, and they shall stand before me to offer unto me the fat and the blood, saith the Lord God:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall enter into my sanctuary, and they shall come near to my table, to minister unto me, and they shall keep my charge.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come upon them, whiles they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall have linen bonnets upon their heads, and shall have linen breeches upon their loins; they shall not gird themselves with any thing that causeth sweat.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when they go forth into the utter court, even into the utter court to the people, they shall put off their garments wherein they ministered, and lay them in the holy chambers, and they shall put on other garments; and they shall not sanctify the people with their garments.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their locks to grow long; they shall only poll their heads.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither shall any priest drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her that is put away: but they shall take maidens of the seed of the house of Israel, or a widow that had a priest before.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall teach my people the difference between the holy and profane, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in controversy they shall stand in judgment; and they shall judge it according to my judgments: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all mine assemblies; and they shall hallow my sabbaths.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall come at no dead person to defile themselves: but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister that hath had no husband, they may defile themselves.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And after he is cleansed, they shall reckon unto him seven days.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in the day that he goeth into the sanctuary, unto the inner court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall be unto them for an inheritance: I am their inheritance: and ye shall give them no possession in Israel: I am their possession.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: They shall eat the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; and every dedicated thing in Israel shall be theirs.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the first of all the firstfruits of all things, and every oblation of all, of every sort of your oblations, shall be the priest's: ye shall also give unto the priest the first of your dough, that he may cause the blessing to rest in thine house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The priests shall not eat of any thing that is dead of itself, or torn, whether it be fowl or beast.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover, when ye shall divide by lot the land for inheritance, ye shall offer an oblation unto the Lord, an holy portion of the land: the length shall be the length of five and twenty thousand reeds, and the breadth shall be ten thousand. This shall be holy in all the borders thereof round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Of this there shall be for the sanctuary five hundred in length, with five hundred in breadth, square round about; and fifty cubits round about for the suburbs thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And of this measure shalt thou measure the length of five and twenty thousand, and the breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be the sanctuary and the most holy place.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The holy portion of the land shall be for the priests the ministers of the sanctuary, which shall come near to minister unto the Lord: and it shall be a place for their houses, and an holy place for the sanctuary.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the five and twenty thousand of length, and the ten thousand of breadth, shall also the Levites, the ministers of the house, have for themselves, for a possession for twenty chambers.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand broad, and five and twenty thousand long, over against the oblation of the holy portion: it shall be for the whole house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And a portion shall be for the prince on the one side and on the other side of the oblation of the holy portion, and of the possession of the city, before the oblation of the holy portion, and before the possession of the city, from the west side westward, and from the east side eastward: and the length shall be over against one of the portions, from the west border unto the east border.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the land shall be his possession in Israel: and my princes shall no more oppress my people; and the rest of the land shall they give to the house of Israel according to their tribes.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of an homer, and the ephah the tenth part of an homer: the measure thereof shall be after the homer.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs: twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This is the oblation that ye shall offer; the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat, and ye shall give the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of barley:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Concerning the ordinance of oil, the bath of oil, ye shall offer the tenth part of a bath out of the cor, which is an homer of ten baths; for ten baths are an homer:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred, out of the fat pastures of Israel; for a meat offering, and for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make reconciliation for them, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All the people of the land shall give this oblation for the prince in Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall be the prince's part to give burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and drink offerings, in the feasts, and in the new moons, and in the sabbaths, in all solemnities of the house of Israel: he shall prepare the sin offering, and the meat offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make reconciliation for the house of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; In the first month, in the first day of the month, thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish, and cleanse the sanctuary:

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering, and put it upon the posts of the house, and upon the four corners of the settle of the altar, and upon the posts of the gate of the inner court.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And so thou shalt do the seventh day of the month for every one that erreth, and for him that is simple: so shall ye reconcile the house.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, ye shall have the passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And upon that day shall the prince prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bullock for a sin offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to the Lord, seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days; and a kid of the goats daily for a sin offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he shall prepare a meat offering of an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and an hin of oil for an ephah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, shall he do the like in the feast of the seven days, according to the sin offering, according to the burnt offering, and according to the meat offering, and according to the oil.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; The gate of the inner court that looketh toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the sabbath it shall be opened, and in the day of the new moon it shall be opened.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate without, and shall stand by the post of the gate, and the priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shall go forth; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the door of this gate before the Lord in the sabbaths and in the new moons.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the burnt offering that the prince shall offer unto the Lord in the sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the meat offering shall be an ephah for a ram, and the meat offering for the lambs as he shall be able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in the day of the new moon it shall be a young bullock without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram: they shall be without blemish.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he shall prepare a meat offering, an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs according as his hand shall attain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when the prince shall enter, he shall go in by the way of the porch of that gate, and he shall go forth by the way thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But when the people of the land shall come before the Lord in the solemn feasts, he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to worship shall go out by the way of the south gate; and he that entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate whereby he came in, but shall go forth over against it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the prince in the midst of them, when they go in, shall go in; and when they go forth, shall go forth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And in the feasts and in the solemnities the meat offering shall be an ephah to a bullock, and an ephah to a ram, and to the lambs as he is able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now when the prince shall prepare a voluntary burnt offering or peace offerings voluntarily unto the Lord, one shall then open him the gate that looketh toward the east, and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, as he did on the sabbath day: then he shall go forth; and after his going forth one shall shut the gate.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thou shalt daily prepare a burnt offering unto the Lord of a lamb of the first year without blemish: thou shalt prepare it every morning.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And thou shalt prepare a meat offering for it every morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of an hin of oil, to temper with the fine flour; a meat offering continually by a perpetual ordinance unto the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus shall they prepare the lamb, and the meat offering, and the oil, every morning for a continual burnt offering.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; If the prince give a gift unto any of his sons, the inheritance thereof shall be his sons'; it shall be their possession by inheritance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But if he give a gift of his inheritance to one of his servants, then it shall be his to the year of liberty; after it shall return to the prince: but his inheritance shall be his sons' for them.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover the prince shall not take of the people's inheritance by oppression, to thrust them out of their possession; but he shall give his sons inheritance out of his own possession: that my people be not scattered every man from his possession.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: After he brought me through the entry, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers of the priests, which looked toward the north: and, behold, there was a place on the two sides westward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering, where they shall bake the meat offering; that they bear them not out into the utter court, to sanctify the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and, behold, in every corner of the court there was a court.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: In the four corners of the court there were courts joined of forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four corners were of one measure.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And there was a row of building round about in them, round about them four, and it was made with boiling places under the rows round about.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, These are the places of them that boil, where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house; and, behold, waters issued out from under the threshold of the house eastward: for the forefront of the house stood toward the east, and the waters came down from under from the right side of the house, at the south side of the altar.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward, and led me about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh eastward; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And when the man that had the line in his hand went forth eastward, he measured a thousand cubits, and he brought me through the waters; the waters were to the ankles.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through the waters; the waters were to the knees. Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through; the waters were to the loins.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass over: for the waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be passed over.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the brink of the river.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now when I had returned, behold, at the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Then said he unto me, These waters issue out toward the east country, and go down into the desert, and go into the sea: which being brought forth into the sea, the waters shall be healed.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever the rivers shall come, shall live: and there shall be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed; and every thing shall live whither the river cometh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that the fishers shall stand upon it from En-gedi even unto En-eglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: But the miry places thereof and the marshes thereof shall not be healed; they shall be given to salt.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Thus saith the Lord God; This shall be the border, whereby ye shall inherit the land according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another: concerning the which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And this shall be the border of the land toward the north side, from the great sea, the way of Hethlon, as men go to Zedad;

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazar-hatticon, which is by the coast of Hauran.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the border from the sea shall be Hazar-enan, the border of Damascus, and the north northward, and the border of Hamath. And this is the north side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the east side ye shall measure from Hauran, and from Damascus, and from Gilead, and from the land of Israel by Jordan, from the border unto the east sea. And this is the east side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the south side southward, from Tamar even to the waters of strife in Kadesh, the river to the great sea. And this is the south side southward.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The west side also shall be the great sea from the border, till a man come over against Hamath. This is the west side.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Now these are the names of the tribes. From the north end to the coast of the way of Hethlon, as one goeth to Hamath, Hazar-enan, the border of Damascus northward, to the coast of Hamath; for these are his sides east and west; a portion for Dan.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Dan, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Asher.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Asher, from the east side even unto the west side, a portion for Naphtali.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Naphtali, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Manasseh.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Manasseh, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Ephraim.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Ephraim, from the east side even unto the west side, a portion for Reuben.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Reuben, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Judah.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Judah, from the east side unto the west side, shall be the offering which ye shall offer of five and twenty thousand reeds in breadth, and in length as one of the other parts, from the east side unto the west side: and the sanctuary shall be in the midst of it.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: The oblation that ye shall offer unto the Lord shall be of five and twenty thousand in length, and of ten thousand in breadth.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And for them, even for the priests, shall be this holy oblation; toward the north five and twenty thousand in length, and toward the west ten thousand in breadth, and toward the east ten thousand in breadth, and toward the south five and twenty thousand in length: and the sanctuary of the Lord shall be in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It shall be for the priests that are sanctified of the sons of Zadok; which have kept my charge, which went not astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And this oblation of the land that is offered shall be unto them a thing most holy by the border of the Levites.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And over against the border of the priests the Levites shall have five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth: all the length shall be five and twenty thousand, and the breadth ten thousand.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they shall not sell of it, neither exchange, nor alienate the firstfruits of the land: for it is holy unto the Lord.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the five thousand, that are left in the breadth over against the five and twenty thousand, shall be a profane place for the city, for dwelling, and for suburbs: and the city shall be in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And these shall be the measures thereof; the north side four thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the west side four thousand and five hundred.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the suburbs of the city shall be toward the north two hundred and fifty, and toward the south two hundred and fifty, and toward the east two hundred and fifty, and toward the west two hundred and fifty.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the residue in length over against the oblation of the holy portion shall be ten thousand eastward, and ten thousand westward: and it shall be over against the oblation of the holy portion; and the increase thereof shall be for food unto them that serve the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And they that serve the city shall serve it out of all the tribes of Israel.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: All the oblation shall be five and twenty thousand by five and twenty thousand: ye shall offer the holy oblation foursquare, with the possession of the city.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the residue shall be for the prince, on the one side and on the other of the holy oblation, and of the possession of the city, over against the five and twenty thousand of the oblation toward the east border, and westward over against the five and twenty thousand toward the west border, over against the portions for the prince: and it shall be the holy oblation; and the sanctuary of the house shall be in the midst thereof.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: Moreover from the possession of the Levites, and from the possession of the city, being in the midst of that which is the prince's, between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin, shall be for the prince.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: As for the rest of the tribes, from the east side unto the west side, Benjamin shall have a portion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Benjamin, from the east side unto the west side, Simeon shall have a portion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Simeon, from the east side unto the west side, Issachar a portion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Issachar, from the east side unto the west side, Zebulun a portion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Zebulun, from the east side unto the west side, Gad a portion.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And by the border of Gad, at the south side southward, the border shall be even from Tamar unto the waters of strife in Kadesh, and to the river toward the great sea.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: This is the land which ye shall divide by lot unto the tribes of Israel for inheritance, and these are their portions, saith the Lord God.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And these are the goings out of the city on the north side, four thousand and five hundred measures.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And the gates of the city shall be after the names of the tribes of Israel: three gates northward; one gate of Reuben, one gate of Judah, one gate of Levi.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And at the east side four thousand and five hundred: and three gates; and one gate of Joseph, one gate of Benjamin, one gate of Dan.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: And at the south side four thousand and five hundred measures: and three gates; one gate of Simeon, one gate of Issachar, one gate of Zebulun.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: At the west side four thousand and five hundred, with their three gates; one gate of Gad, one gate of Asher, one gate of Naphtali.

column8: The Book of the Prophet Ezekiel
column17: It was round about eighteen thousand measures: and the name of the city from that day shall be, The Lord is there.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon unto Jerusalem, and besieged it.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, with part of the vessels of the house of God: which he carried into the land of Shinar to the house of his god; and he brought the vessels into the treasure house of his god.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the king spake unto Ashpenaz the master of his eunuchs, that he should bring certain of the children of Israel, and of the king's seed, and of the princes;

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Children in whom was no blemish, but well favoured, and skilful in all wisdom, and cunning in knowledge, and understanding science, and such as had ability in them to stand in the king's palace, and whom they might teach the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the king appointed them a daily provision of the king's meat, and of the wine which he drank: so nourishing them three years, that at the end thereof they might stand before the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Now among these were of the children of Judah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Unto whom the prince of the eunuchs gave names: for he gave unto Daniel the name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abed-nego.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the portion of the king's meat, nor with the wine which he drank: therefore he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Now God had brought Daniel into favour and tender love with the prince of the eunuchs.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the prince of the eunuchs said unto Daniel, I fear my lord the king, who hath appointed your meat and your drink: for why should he see your faces worse liking than the children which are of your sort? then shall ye make me endanger my head to the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then said Daniel to Melzar, whom the prince of the eunuchs had set over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah,

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Prove thy servants, I beseech thee, ten days; and let them give us pulse to eat, and water to drink.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and the countenance of the children that eat of the portion of the king's meat: and as thou seest, deal with thy servants.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: So he consented to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And at the end of ten days their countenances appeared fairer and fatter in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the king's meat.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thus Melzar took away the portion of their meat, and the wine that they should drink; and gave them pulse.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: As for these four children, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom: and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Now at the end of the days that the king had said he should bring them in, then the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the king communed with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And in all matters of wisdom and understanding, that the king inquired of them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and astrologers that were in all his realm.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And Daniel continued even unto the first year of king Cyrus.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And in the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams, wherewith his spirit was troubled, and his sleep brake from him.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then the king commanded to call the magicians, and the astrologers, and the sorcerers, and the Chaldeans, for to shew the king his dreams. So they came and stood before the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the king said unto them, I have dreamed a dream, and my spirit was troubled to know the dream.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then spake the Chaldeans to the king in Syriack, O king, live for ever: tell thy servants the dream, and we will shew the interpretation.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The king answered and said to the Chaldeans, The thing is gone from me: if ye will not make known unto me the dream, with the interpretation thereof, ye shall be cut in pieces, and your houses shall be made a dunghill.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But if ye shew the dream, and the interpretation thereof, ye shall receive of me gifts and rewards and great honour: therefore shew me the dream, and the interpretation thereof.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: They answered again and said, Let the king tell his servants the dream, and we will shew the interpretation of it.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The king answered and said, I know of certainty that ye would gain the time, because ye see the thing is gone from me.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But if ye will not make known unto me the dream, there is but one decree for you: for ye have prepared lying and corrupt words to speak before me, till the time be changed: therefore tell me the dream, and I shall know that ye can shew me the interpretation thereof.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The Chaldeans answered before the king, and said, There is not a man upon the earth that can shew the king's matter: therefore there is no king, lord, nor ruler, that asked such things at any magician, or astrologer, or Chaldean.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And it is a rare thing that the king requireth, and there is none other that can shew it before the king, except the gods, whose dwelling is not with flesh.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: For this cause the king was angry and very furious, and commanded to destroy all the wise men of Babylon.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the decree went forth that the wise men should be slain; and they sought Daniel and his fellows to be slain.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Daniel answered with counsel and wisdom to Arioch the captain of the king's guard, which was gone forth to slay the wise men of Babylon:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: He answered and said to Arioch the king's captain, Why is the decree so hasty from the king? Then Arioch made the thing known to Daniel.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Daniel went in, and desired of the king that he would give him time, and that he would shew the king the interpretation.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Daniel went to his house, and made the thing known to Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, his companions:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: That they would desire mercies of the God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his fellows should not perish with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then was the secret revealed unto Daniel in a night vision. Then Daniel blessed the God of heaven.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Daniel answered and said, Blessed be the name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are his:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And he changeth the times and the seasons: he removeth kings, and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom unto the wise, and knowledge to them that know understanding:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: He revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the darkness, and the light dwelleth with him.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: I thank thee, and praise thee, O thou God of my fathers, who hast given me wisdom and might, and hast made known unto me now what we desired of thee: for thou hast now made known unto us the king's matter.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Therefore Daniel went in unto Arioch, whom the king had ordained to destroy the wise men of Babylon: he went and said thus unto him; Destroy not the wise men of Babylon: bring me in before the king, and I will shew unto the king the interpretation.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Arioch brought in Daniel before the king in haste, and said thus unto him, I have found a man of the captives of Judah, that will make known unto the king the interpretation.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The king answered and said to Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, Art thou able to make known unto me the dream which I have seen, and the interpretation thereof?

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Daniel answered in the presence of the king, and said, The secret which the king hath demanded cannot the wise men, the astrologers, the magicians, the soothsayers, shew unto the king;

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But there is a God in heaven that revealeth secrets, and maketh known to the king Nebuchadnezzar what shall be in the latter days. Thy dream, and the visions of thy head upon thy bed, are these;

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: As for thee, O king, thy thoughts came into thy mind upon thy bed, what should come to pass hereafter: and he that revealeth secrets maketh known to thee what shall come to pass.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for any wisdom that I have more than any living, but for their sakes that shall make known the interpretation to the king, and that thou mightest know the thoughts of thy heart.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and the form thereof was terrible.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: This image's head was of fine gold, his breast and his arms of silver, his belly and his thighs of brass,

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: His legs of iron, his feet part of iron and part of clay.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thou sawest till that a stone was cut out without hands, which smote the image upon his feet that were of iron and clay, and brake them to pieces.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then was the iron, the clay, the brass, the silver, and the gold, broken to pieces together, and became like the chaff of the summer threshingfloors; and the wind carried them away, that no place was found for them: and the stone that smote the image became a great mountain, and filled the whole earth.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: This is the dream; and we will tell the interpretation thereof before the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thou, O king, art a king of kings: for the God of heaven hath given thee a kingdom, power, and strength, and glory.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And wheresoever the children of men dwell, the beasts of the field and the fowls of the heaven hath he given into thine hand, and hath made thee ruler over them all. Thou art this head of gold.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And after thee shall arise another kingdom inferior to thee, and another third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all the earth.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the fourth kingdom shall be strong as iron: forasmuch as iron breaketh in pieces and subdueth all things: and as iron that breaketh all these, shall it break in pieces and bruise.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And whereas thou sawest the feet and toes, part of potters' clay, and part of iron, the kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in it of the strength of the iron, forasmuch as thou sawest the iron mixed with miry clay.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And as the toes of the feet were part of iron, and part of clay, so the kingdom shall be partly strong, and partly broken.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And whereas thou sawest iron mixed with miry clay, they shall mingle themselves with the seed of men: but they shall not cleave one to another, even as iron is not mixed with clay.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And in the days of these kings shall the God of heaven set up a kingdom, which shall never be destroyed: and the kingdom shall not be left to other people, but it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand for ever.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Forasmuch as thou sawest that the stone was cut out of the mountain without hands, and that it brake in pieces the iron, the brass, the clay, the silver, and the gold; the great God hath made known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter: and the dream is certain, and the interpretation thereof sure.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then the king Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face, and worshipped Daniel, and commanded that they should offer an oblation and sweet odours unto him.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The king answered unto Daniel, and said, Of a truth it is, that your God is a God of gods, and a Lord of kings, and a revealer of secrets, seeing thou couldest reveal this secret.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then the king made Daniel a great man, and gave him many great gifts, and made him ruler over the whole province of Babylon, and chief of the governors over all the wise men of Babylon.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Daniel requested of the king, and he set Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, over the affairs of the province of Babylon: but Daniel sat in the gate of the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Nebuchadnezzar the king made an image of gold, whose height was threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof six cubits: he set it up in the plain of Dura, in the province of Babylon.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the princes, the governors, and the captains, the judges, the treasurers, the counsellors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, to come to the dedication of the image which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then the princes, the governors, and captains, the judges, the treasurers, the counsellors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, were gathered together unto the dedication of the image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up; and they stood before the image that Nebuchadnezzar had set up.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then an herald cried aloud, To you it is commanded, O people, nations, and languages,

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: That at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, ye fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Therefore at that time, when all the people heard the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and all kinds of musick, all the people, the nations, and the languages, fell down and worshipped the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Wherefore at that time certain Chaldeans came near, and accused the Jews.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: They spake and said to the king Nebuchadnezzar, O king, live for ever.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thou, O king, hast made a decree, that every man that shall hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, shall fall down and worship the golden image:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth, that he should be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: There are certain Jews whom thou hast set over the affairs of the province of Babylon, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego; these men, O king, have not regarded thee: they serve not thy gods, nor worship the golden image which thou hast set up.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Nebuchadnezzar in his rage and fury commanded to bring Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego. Then they brought these men before the king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, Is it true, O Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, do not ye serve my gods, nor worship the golden image which I have set up?

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Now if ye be ready that at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and dulcimer, and all kinds of musick, ye fall down and worship the image which I have made; well: but if ye worship not, ye shall be cast the same hour into the midst of a burning fiery furnace; and who is that God that shall deliver you out of my hands?

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, answered and said to the king, O Nebuchadnezzar, we are not careful to answer thee in this matter.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: If it be so, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and he will deliver us out of thine hand, O king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But if not, be it known unto thee, O king, that we will not serve thy gods, nor worship the golden image which thou hast set up.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego: therefore he spake, and commanded that they should heat the furnace one seven times more than it was wont to be heated.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And he commanded the most mighty men that were in his army to bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, and to cast them into the burning fiery furnace.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then these men were bound in their coats, their hosen, and their hats, and their other garments, and were cast into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Therefore because the king's commandment was urgent, and the furnace exceeding hot, the flame of the fire slew those men that took up Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And these three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, fell down bound into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Nebuchadnezzar the king was astonied, and rose up in haste, and spake, and said unto his counsellors, Did not we cast three men bound into the midst of the fire? They answered and said unto the king, True, O king.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: He answered and said, Lo, I see four men loose, walking in the midst of the fire, and they have no hurt; and the form of the fourth is like the Son of God.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace, and spake, and said, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, ye servants of the most high God, come forth, and come hither. Then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, came forth of the midst of the fire.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: And the princes, governors, and captains, and the king's counsellors, being gathered together, saw these men, upon whose bodies the fire had no power, nor was an hair of their head singed, neither were their coats changed, nor the smell of fire had passed on them.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Nebuchadnezzar spake, and said, Blessed be the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, who hath sent his angel, and delivered his servants that trusted in him, and have changed the king's word, and yielded their bodies, that they might not serve nor worship any god, except their own God.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Therefore I make a decree, That every people, nation, and language, which speak any thing amiss against the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, shall be cut in pieces, and their houses shall be made a dunghill: because there is no other God that can deliver after this sort.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then the king promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, in the province of Babylon.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Nebuchadnezzar the king, unto all people, nations, and languages, that dwell in all the earth; Peace be multiplied unto you.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: I thought it good to shew the signs and wonders that the high God hath wrought toward me.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: How great are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and his dominion is from generation to generation.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: I Nebuchadnezzar was at rest in mine house, and flourishing in my palace:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: I saw a dream which made me afraid, and the thoughts upon my bed and the visions of my head troubled me.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Therefore made I a decree to bring in all the wise men of Babylon before me, that they might make known unto me the interpretation of the dream.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then came in the magicians, the astrologers, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers: and I told the dream before them; but they did not make known unto me the interpretation thereof.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods: and before him I told the dream, saying,

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: O Belteshazzar, master of the magicians, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in thee, and no secret troubleth thee, tell me the visions of my dream that I have seen, and the interpretation thereof.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Thus were the visions of mine head in my bed; I saw, and behold a tree in the midst of the earth, and the height thereof was great.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The tree grew, and was strong, and the height thereof reached unto heaven, and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The leaves thereof were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all: the beasts of the field had shadow under it, and the fowls of the heaven dwelt in the boughs thereof, and all flesh was fed of it.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: I saw in the visions of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a watcher and an holy one came down from heaven;

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: He cried aloud, and said thus, Hew down the tree, and cut off his branches, shake off his leaves, and scatter his fruit: let the beasts get away from under it, and the fowls from his branches:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Nevertheless leave the stump of his roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts in the grass of the earth:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Let his heart be changed from man's, and let a beast's heart be given unto him; and let seven times pass over him.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: This matter is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones: to the intent that the living may know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will, and setteth up over it the basest of men.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: This dream I king Nebuchadnezzar have seen. Now thou, O Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation thereof, forasmuch as all the wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known unto me the interpretation: but thou art able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in thee.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was astonied for one hour, and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake, and said, Belteshazzar, let not the dream, or the interpretation thereof, trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My lord, the dream be to them that hate thee, and the interpretation thereof to thine enemies.

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: The tree that thou sawest, which grew, and was strong, whose height reached unto the heaven, and the sight thereof to all the earth;

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: Whose leaves were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all; under which the beasts of the field dwelt, and upon whose branches the fowls of the heaven had their habitation:

column8: The Book of Daniel
column17: It is thou, O king, that art grown and become strong: for thy greatness is grown, and reacheth unto heaven, and thy dominion to the end of the earth.

column8: The Book of Daniel
