column17: O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself; but in me is thine help.

column8: Hosea
column17: I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?

column8: Hosea
column17: I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath.

column8: Hosea
column17: The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is hid.

column8: Hosea
column17: The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in the place of the breaking forth of children.

column8: Hosea
column17: I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be thy plagues; O grave, I will be thy destruction: repentance shall be hid from mine eyes.

column8: Hosea
column17: Though he be fruitful among his brethren, an east wind shall come, the wind of the Lord shall come up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up: he shall spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.

column8: Hosea
column17: Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.

column8: Hosea
column17: O Israel, return unto the Lord thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.

column8: Hosea
column17: Take with you words, and turn to the Lord: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.

column8: Hosea
column17: Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.

column8: Hosea
column17: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him.

column8: Hosea
column17: I will be as the dew unto Israel: he shall grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.

column8: Hosea
column17: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.

column8: Hosea
column17: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.

column8: Hosea
column17: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is thy fruit found.

column8: Hosea
column17: Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the Lord are right, and the just shall walk in them: but the transgressors shall fall therein.

column8: Joel
column17: The word of the Lord that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.

column8: Joel
column17: Hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land. Hath this been in your days, or even in the days of your fathers?

column8: Joel
column17: Tell ye your children of it, and let your children tell their children, and their children another generation.

column8: Joel
column17: That which the palmerworm hath left hath the locust eaten; and that which the locust hath left hath the cankerworm eaten; and that which the cankerworm hath left hath the caterpiller eaten.

column8: Joel
column17: Awake, ye drunkards, and weep; and howl, all ye drinkers of wine, because of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.

column8: Joel
column17: For a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number, whose teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he hath the cheek teeth of a great lion.

column8: Joel
column17: He hath laid my vine waste, and barked my fig tree: he hath made it clean bare, and cast it away; the branches thereof are made white.

column8: Joel
column17: Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.

column8: Joel
column17: The meat offering and the drink offering is cut off from the house of the Lord; the priests, the Lord's ministers, mourn.

column8: Joel
column17: The field is wasted, the land mourneth; for the corn is wasted: the new wine is dried up, the oil languisheth.

column8: Joel
column17: Be ye ashamed, O ye husbandmen; howl, O ye vinedressers, for the wheat and for the barley; because the harvest of the field is perished.

column8: Joel
column17: The vine is dried up, and the fig tree languisheth; the pomegranate tree, the palm tree also, and the apple tree, even all the trees of the field, are withered: because joy is withered away from the sons of men.

column8: Joel
column17: Gird yourselves, and lament, ye priests: howl, ye ministers of the altar: come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God: for the meat offering and the drink offering is withholden from the house of your God.

column8: Joel
column17: Sanctify ye a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land into the house of the Lord your God, and cry unto the Lord,

column8: Joel
column17: Alas for the day! for the day of the Lord is at hand, and as a destruction from the Almighty shall it come.

column8: Joel
column17: Is not the meat cut off before our eyes, yea, joy and gladness from the house of our God?

column8: Joel
column17: The seed is rotten under their clods, the garners are laid desolate, the barns are broken down; for the corn is withered.

column8: Joel
column17: How do the beasts groan! the herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture; yea, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.

column8: Joel
column17: O Lord, to thee will I cry: for the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness, and the flame hath burned all the trees of the field.

column8: Joel
column17: The beasts of the field cry also unto thee: for the rivers of waters are dried up, and the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness.

column8: Joel
column17: Blow ye the trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: for the day of the Lord cometh, for it is nigh at hand;

column8: Joel
column17: A day of darkness and of gloominess, a day of clouds and of thick darkness, as the morning spread upon the mountains: a great people and a strong; there hath not been ever the like, neither shall be any more after it, even to the years of many generations.

column8: Joel
column17: A fire devoureth before them; and behind them a flame burneth: the land is as the garden of Eden before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness; yea, and nothing shall escape them.

column8: Joel
column17: The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses; and as horsemen, so shall they run.

column8: Joel
column17: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of mountains shall they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as a strong people set in battle array.

column8: Joel
column17: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.

column8: Joel
column17: They shall run like mighty men; they shall climb the wall like men of war; and they shall march every one on his ways, and they shall not break their ranks:

column8: Joel
column17: Neither shall one thrust another; they shall walk every one in his path: and when they fall upon the sword, they shall not be wounded.

column8: Joel
column17: They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.

column8: Joel
column17: The earth shall quake before them; the heavens shall tremble: the sun and the moon shall be dark, and the stars shall withdraw their shining:

column8: Joel
column17: And the Lord shall utter his voice before his army: for his camp is very great: for he is strong that executeth his word: for the day of the Lord is great and very terrible; and who can abide it?

column8: Joel
column17: Therefore also now, saith the Lord, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning:

column8: Joel
column17: And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the Lord your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.

column8: Joel
column17: Who knoweth if he will return and repent, and leave a blessing behind him; even a meat offering and a drink offering unto the Lord your God?

column8: Joel
column17: Blow the trumpet in Zion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly:

column8: Joel
column17: Gather the people, sanctify the congregation, assemble the elders, gather the children, and those that suck the breasts: let the bridegroom go forth of his chamber, and the bride out of her closet.

column8: Joel
column17: Let the priests, the ministers of the Lord, weep between the porch and the altar, and let them say, Spare thy people, O Lord, and give not thine heritage to reproach, that the heathen should rule over them: wherefore should they say among the people, Where is their God?

column8: Joel
column17: Then will the Lord be jealous for his land, and pity his people.

column8: Joel
column17: Yea, the Lord will answer and say unto his people, Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfied therewith: and I will no more make you a reproach among the heathen:

column8: Joel
column17: But I will remove far off from you the northern army, and will drive him into a land barren and desolate, with his face toward the east sea, and his hinder part toward the utmost sea, and his stink shall come up, and his ill savour shall come up, because he hath done great things.

column8: Joel
column17: Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for the Lord will do great things.

column8: Joel
column17: Be not afraid, ye beasts of the field: for the pastures of the wilderness do spring, for the tree beareth her fruit, the fig tree and the vine do yield their strength.

column8: Joel
column17: Be glad then, ye children of Zion, and rejoice in the Lord your God: for he hath given you the former rain moderately, and he will cause to come down for you the rain, the former rain, and the latter rain in the first month.

column8: Joel
column17: And the floors shall be full of wheat, and the fats shall overflow with wine and oil.

column8: Joel
column17: And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.

column8: Joel
column17: And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the Lord your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.

column8: Joel
column17: And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and that I am the Lord your God, and none else: and my people shall never be ashamed.

column8: Joel
column17: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions:

column8: Joel
column17: And also upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days will I pour out my spirit.

column8: Joel
column17: And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.

column8: Joel
column17: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and the terrible day of the Lord come.

column8: Joel
column17: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance, as the Lord hath said, and in the remnant whom the Lord shall call.

column8: Joel
column17: For, behold, in those days, and in that time, when I shall bring again the captivity of Judah and Jerusalem,

column8: Joel
column17: I will also gather all nations, and will bring them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat, and will plead with them there for my people and for my heritage Israel, whom they have scattered among the nations, and parted my land.

column8: Joel
column17: And they have cast lots for my people; and have given a boy for an harlot, and sold a girl for wine, that they might drink.

column8: Joel
column17: Yea, and what have ye to do with me, O Tyre, and Zidon, and all the coasts of Palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye recompense me, swiftly and speedily will I return your recompence upon your own head;

column8: Joel
column17: Because ye have taken my silver and my gold, and have carried into your temples my goodly pleasant things:

column8: Joel
column17: The children also of Judah and the children of Jerusalem have ye sold unto the Grecians, that ye might remove them far from their border.

column8: Joel
column17: Behold, I will raise them out of the place whither ye have sold them, and will return your recompence upon your own head:

column8: Joel
column17: And I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the children of Judah, and they shall sell them to the Sabeans, to a people far off: for the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: Joel
column17: Proclaim ye this among the Gentiles; Prepare war, wake up the mighty men, let all the men of war draw near; let them come up:

column8: Joel
column17: Beat your plowshares into swords, and your pruninghooks into spears: let the weak say, I am strong.

column8: Joel
column17: Assemble yourselves, and come, all ye heathen, and gather yourselves together round about: thither cause thy mighty ones to come down, O Lord.

column8: Joel
column17: Let the heathen be wakened, and come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat: for there will I sit to judge all the heathen round about.

column8: Joel
column17: Put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe: come, get you down; for the press is full, the fats overflow; for their wickedness is great.

column8: Joel
column17: Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision: for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.

column8: Joel
column17: The sun and the moon shall be darkened, and the stars shall withdraw their shining.

column8: Joel
column17: The Lord also shall roar out of Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth shall shake: but the Lord will be the hope of his people, and the strength of the children of Israel.

column8: Joel
column17: So shall ye know that I am the Lord your God dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain: then shall Jerusalem be holy, and there shall no strangers pass through her any more.

column8: Joel
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the mountains shall drop down new wine, and the hills shall flow with milk, and all the rivers of Judah shall flow with waters, and a fountain shall come forth of the house of the Lord, and shall water the valley of Shittim.

column8: Joel
column17: Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for the violence against the children of Judah, because they have shed innocent blood in their land.

column8: Joel
column17: But Judah shall dwell for ever, and Jerusalem from generation to generation.

column8: Joel
column17: For I will cleanse their blood that I have not cleansed: for the Lord dwelleth in Zion.

column8: Amos
column17: The words of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

column8: Amos
column17: And he said, The Lord will roar from Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds shall mourn, and the top of Carmel shall wither.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have threshed Gilead with threshing instruments of iron:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, which shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.

column8: Amos
column17: I will break also the bar of Damascus, and cut off the inhabitant from the plain of Aven, and him that holdeth the sceptre from the house of Eden: and the people of Syria shall go into captivity unto Kir, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they carried away captive the whole captivity, to deliver them up to Edom:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza, which shall devour the palaces thereof:

column8: Amos
column17: And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, and him that holdeth the sceptre from Ashkelon, and I will turn mine hand against Ekron: and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish, saith the Lord God.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Tyrus, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, and remembered not the brotherly covenant:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyrus, which shall devour the palaces thereof.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he did pursue his brother with the sword, and did cast off all pity, and his anger did tear perpetually, and he kept his wrath for ever:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire upon Teman, which shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of the children of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead, that they might enlarge their border:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind:

column8: Amos
column17: And their king shall go into captivity, he and his princes together, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet:

column8: Amos
column17: And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the Lord, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after the which their fathers have walked:

column8: Amos
column17: But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;

column8: Amos
column17: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in unto the same maid, to profane my holy name:

column8: Amos
column17: And they lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.

column8: Amos
column17: Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

column8: Amos
column17: Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.

column8: Amos
column17: And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: But ye gave the Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded the prophets, saying, Prophesy not.

column8: Amos
column17: Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver himself:

column8: Amos
column17: Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver himself: neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself.

column8: Amos
column17: And he that is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Hear this word that the Lord hath spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying,

column8: Amos
column17: You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.

column8: Amos
column17: Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

column8: Amos
column17: Will a lion roar in the forest, when he hath no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den, if he have taken nothing?

column8: Amos
column17: Can a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where no gin is for him? shall one take up a snare from the earth, and have taken nothing at all?

column8: Amos
column17: Shall a trumpet be blown in the city, and the people not be afraid? shall there be evil in a city, and the Lord hath not done it?

column8: Amos
column17: Surely the Lord God will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets.

column8: Amos
column17: The lion hath roared, who will not fear? the Lord God hath spoken, who can but prophesy?

column8: Amos
column17: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the great tumults in the midst thereof, and the oppressed in the midst thereof.

column8: Amos
column17: For they know not to do right, saith the Lord, who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; An adversary there shall be even round about the land; and he shall bring down thy strength from thee, and thy palaces shall be spoiled.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus saith the Lord; As the shepherd taketh out of the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear; so shall the children of Israel be taken out that dwell in Samaria in the corner of a bed, and in Damascus in a couch.

column8: Amos
column17: Hear ye, and testify in the house of Jacob, saith the Lord God, the God of hosts,

column8: Amos
column17: That in the day that I shall visit the transgressions of Israel upon him I will also visit the altars of Beth-el: and the horns of the altar shall be cut off, and fall to the ground.

column8: Amos
column17: And I will smite the winter house with the summer house; and the houses of ivory shall perish, and the great houses shall have an end, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Hear this word, ye kine of Bashan, that are in the mountain of Samaria, which oppress the poor, which crush the needy, which say to their masters, Bring, and let us drink.

column8: Amos
column17: The Lord God hath sworn by his holiness, that, lo, the days shall come upon you, that he will take you away with hooks, and your posterity with fishhooks.

column8: Amos
column17: And ye shall go out at the breaches, every cow at that which is before her; and ye shall cast them into the palace, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Come to Beth-el, and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning, and your tithes after three years:

column8: Amos
column17: And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, and proclaim and publish the free offerings: for this liketh you, O ye children of Israel, saith the Lord God.

column8: Amos
column17: And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: And also I have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest: and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city: one piece was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it rained not withered.

column8: Amos
column17: So two or three cities wandered unto one city, to drink water; but they were not satisfied: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: I have smitten you with blasting and mildew: when your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees increased, the palmerworm devoured them: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: I have sent among you the pestilence after the manner of Egypt: your young men have I slain with the sword, and have taken away your horses; and I have made the stink of your camps to come up unto your nostrils: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: I have overthrown some of you, as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and ye were as a firebrand plucked out of the burning: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel: and because I will do this unto thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel.

column8: Amos
column17: For, lo, he that formeth the mountains, and createth the wind, and declareth unto man what is his thought, that maketh the morning darkness, and treadeth upon the high places of the earth, The Lord, The God of hosts, is his name.

column8: Amos
column17: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.

column8: Amos
column17: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.

column8: Amos
column17: For thus saith the Lord God; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

column8: Amos
column17: For thus saith the Lord unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

column8: Amos
column17: But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.

column8: Amos
column17: Seek the Lord, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth-el.

column8: Amos
column17: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

column8: Amos
column17: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name:

column8: Amos
column17: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.

column8: Amos
column17: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

column8: Amos
column17: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.

column8: Amos
column17: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.

column8: Amos
column17: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the Lord, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

column8: Amos
column17: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the Lord God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore the Lord, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

column8: Amos
column17: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Woe unto you that desire the day of the Lord! to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.

column8: Amos
column17: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

column8: Amos
column17: Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

column8: Amos
column17: I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.

column8: Amos
column17: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.

column8: Amos
column17: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.

column8: Amos
column17: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.

column8: Amos
column17: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

column8: Amos
column17: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, whose name is The God of hosts.

column8: Amos
column17: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion, and trust in the mountain of Samaria, which are named chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel came!

column8: Amos
column17: Pass ye unto Calneh, and see; and from thence go ye to Hamath the great: then go down to Gath of the Philistines: be they better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?

column8: Amos
column17: Ye that put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence to come near;

column8: Amos
column17: That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the midst of the stall;

column8: Amos
column17: That chant to the sound of the viol, and invent to themselves instruments of musick, like David;

column8: Amos
column17: That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the chief ointments: but they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore now shall they go captive with the first that go captive, and the banquet of them that stretched themselves shall be removed.

column8: Amos
column17: The Lord God hath sworn by himself, saith the Lord the God of hosts, I abhor the excellency of Jacob, and hate his palaces: therefore will I deliver up the city with all that is therein.

column8: Amos
column17: And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.

column8: Amos
column17: And a man's uncle shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to bring out the bones out of the house, and shall say unto him that is by the sides of the house, Is there yet any with thee? and he shall say, No. Then shall he say, Hold thy tongue: for we may not make mention of the name of the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: For, behold, the Lord commandeth, and he will smite the great house with breaches, and the little house with clefts.

column8: Amos
column17: Shall horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:

column8: Amos
column17: Ye which rejoice in a thing of nought, which say, Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength?

column8: Amos
column17: But, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, saith the Lord the God of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the entering in of Hemath unto the river of the wilderness.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus hath the Lord God shewed unto me; and, behold, he formed grasshoppers in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the king's mowings.

column8: Amos
column17: And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O Lord God, forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

column8: Amos
column17: The Lord repented for this: It shall not be, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus hath the Lord God shewed unto me: and, behold, the Lord God called to contend by fire, and it devoured the great deep, and did eat up a part.

column8: Amos
column17: Then said I, O Lord God, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.

column8: Amos
column17: The Lord repented for this: This also shall not be, saith the Lord God.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the Lord stood upon a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.

column8: Amos
column17: And the Lord said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the Lord, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:

column8: Amos
column17: And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.

column8: Amos
column17: Then Amaziah the priest of Beth-el sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.

column8: Amos
column17: For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land.

column8: Amos
column17: Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:

column8: Amos
column17: But prophesy not again any more at Beth-el: for it is the king's chapel, and it is the king's court.

column8: Amos
column17: Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet's son; but I was an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:

column8: Amos
column17: And the Lord took me as I followed the flock, and the Lord said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel.

column8: Amos
column17: Now therefore hear thou the word of the Lord: Thou sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not thy word against the house of Isaac.

column8: Amos
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Thy wife shall be an harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his land.

column8: Amos
column17: Thus hath the Lord God shewed unto me: and behold a basket of summer fruit.

column8: Amos
column17: And he said, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then said the Lord unto me, The end is come upon my people of Israel; I will not again pass by them any more.

column8: Amos
column17: And the songs of the temple shall be howlings in that day, saith the Lord God: there shall be many dead bodies in every place; they shall cast them forth with silence.

column8: Amos
column17: Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,

column8: Amos
column17: Saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell corn? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small, and the shekel great, and falsifying the balances by deceit?

column8: Amos
column17: That we may buy the poor for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes; yea, and sell the refuse of the wheat?

column8: Amos
column17: The Lord hath sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.

column8: Amos
column17: Shall not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholly as a flood; and it shall be cast out and drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.

column8: Amos
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord God, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the earth in the clear day:

column8: Amos
column17: And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son, and the end thereof as a bitter day.

column8: Amos
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord God, that I will send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the Lord:

column8: Amos
column17: And they shall wander from sea to sea, and from the north even to the east, they shall run to and fro to seek the word of the Lord, and shall not find it.

column8: Amos
column17: In that day shall the fair virgins and young men faint for thirst.

column8: Amos
column17: They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say, Thy god, O Dan, liveth; and, The manner of Beer-sheba liveth; even they shall fall, and never rise up again.

column8: Amos
column17: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and he said, Smite the lintel of the door, that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head, all of them; and I will slay the last of them with the sword: he that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth of them shall not be delivered.

column8: Amos
column17: Though they dig into hell, thence shall mine hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down:

column8: Amos
column17: And though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea, thence will I command the serpent, and he shall bite them:

column8: Amos
column17: And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I command the sword, and it shall slay them: and I will set mine eyes upon them for evil, and not for good.

column8: Amos
column17: And the Lord God of hosts is he that toucheth the land, and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise up wholly like a flood; and shall be drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.

column8: Amos
column17: It is he that buildeth his stories in the heaven, and hath founded his troop in the earth; he that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name.

column8: Amos
column17: Are ye not as children of the Ethiopians unto me, O children of Israel? saith the Lord. Have not I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?

column8: Amos
column17: Behold, the eyes of the Lord God are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth; saving that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith the Lord.

column8: Amos
column17: For, lo, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations, like as corn is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not the least grain fall upon the earth.

column8: Amos
column17: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

column8: Amos
column17: In that day will I raise up the tabernacle of David that is fallen, and close up the breaches thereof; and I will raise up his ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old:

column8: Amos
column17: That they may possess the remnant of Edom, and of all the heathen, which are called by my name, saith the Lord that doeth this.

column8: Amos
column17: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him that soweth seed; and the mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all the hills shall melt.

column8: Amos
column17: And I will bring again the captivity of my people of Israel, and they shall build the waste cities, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and drink the wine thereof; they shall also make gardens, and eat the fruit of them.

column8: Amos
column17: And I will plant them upon their land, and they shall no more be pulled up out of their land which I have given them, saith the Lord thy God.

column8: Obadiah
column17: The vision of Obadiah. Thus saith the Lord God concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from the Lord, and an ambassador is sent among the heathen, Arise ye, and let us rise up against her in battle.

column8: Obadiah
column17: Behold, I have made thee small among the heathen: thou art greatly despised.

column8: Obadiah
column17: The pride of thine heart hath deceived thee, thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high; that saith in his heart, Who shall bring me down to the ground?

column8: Obadiah
column17: Though thou exalt thyself as the eagle, and though thou set thy nest among the stars, thence will I bring thee down, saith the Lord.

column8: Obadiah
column17: If thieves came to thee, if robbers by night, (how art thou cut off!) would they not have stolen till they had enough? if the grapegatherers came to thee, would they not leave some grapes?

column8: Obadiah
column17: How are the things of Esau searched out! how are his hidden things sought up!

column8: Obadiah
column17: All the men of thy confederacy have brought thee even to the border: the men that were at peace with thee have deceived thee, and prevailed against thee; they that eat thy bread have laid a wound under thee: there is none understanding in him.

column8: Obadiah
column17: Shall I not in that day, saith the Lord, even destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of the mount of Esau?

column8: Obadiah
column17: And thy mighty men, O Teman, shall be dismayed, to the end that every one of the mount of Esau may be cut off by slaughter.

column8: Obadiah
column17: For thy violence against thy brother Jacob shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.

column8: Obadiah
column17: In the day that thou stoodest on the other side, in the day that the strangers carried away captive his forces, and foreigners entered into his gates, and cast lots upon Jerusalem, even thou wast as one of them.

column8: Obadiah
column17: But thou shouldest not have looked on the day of thy brother in the day that he became a stranger; neither shouldest thou have rejoiced over the children of Judah in the day of their destruction; neither shouldest thou have spoken proudly in the day of distress.

column8: Obadiah
column17: Thou shouldest not have entered into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity; yea, thou shouldest not have looked on their affliction in the day of their calamity, nor have laid hands on their substance in the day of their calamity;

column8: Obadiah
column17: Neither shouldest thou have stood in the crossway, to cut off those of his that did escape; neither shouldest thou have delivered up those of his that did remain in the day of distress.

column8: Obadiah
column17: For the day of the Lord is near upon all the heathen: as thou hast done, it shall be done unto thee: thy reward shall return upon thine own head.

column8: Obadiah
column17: For as ye have drunk upon my holy mountain, so shall all the heathen drink continually, yea, they shall drink, and they shall swallow down, and they shall be as though they had not been.

column8: Obadiah
column17: But upon mount Zion shall be deliverance, and there shall be holiness; and the house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.

column8: Obadiah
column17: And the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble, and they shall kindle in them, and devour them; and there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau; for the Lord hath spoken it.

column8: Obadiah
column17: And they of the south shall possess the mount of Esau; and they of the plain the Philistines: and they shall possess the fields of Ephraim, and the fields of Samaria: and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.

column8: Obadiah
column17: And the captivity of this host of the children of Israel shall possess that of the Canaanites, even unto Zarephath; and the captivity of Jerusalem, which is in Sepharad, shall possess the cities of the south.

column8: Obadiah
column17: And saviours shall come up on mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau; and the kingdom shall be the Lord's.

column8: Jonah
column17: Now the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,

column8: Jonah
column17: Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and cry against it; for their wickedness is come up before me.

column8: Jonah
column17: But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord, and went down to Joppa; and he found a ship going to Tarshish: so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.

column8: Jonah
column17: But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was like to be broken.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast forth the wares that were in the ship into the sea, to lighten it of them. But Jonah was gone down into the sides of the ship; and he lay, and was fast asleep.

column8: Jonah
column17: So the shipmaster came to him, and said unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper? arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not.

column8: Jonah
column17: And they said every one to his fellow, Come, and let us cast lots, that we may know for whose cause this evil is upon us. So they cast lots, and the lot fell upon Jonah.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then said they unto him, Tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil is upon us; What is thine occupation? and whence comest thou? what is thy country? and of what people art thou?

column8: Jonah
column17: And he said unto them, I am an Hebrew; and I fear the Lord, the God of heaven, which hath made the sea and the dry land.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then were the men exceedingly afraid, and said unto him, Why hast thou done this? For the men knew that he fled from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then said they unto him, What shall we do unto thee, that the sea may be calm unto us? for the sea wrought, and was tempestuous.

column8: Jonah
column17: And he said unto them, Take me up, and cast me forth into the sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you.

column8: Jonah
column17: Nevertheless the men rowed hard to bring it to the land; but they could not: for the sea wrought, and was tempestuous against them.

column8: Jonah
column17: Wherefore they cried unto the Lord, and said, We beseech thee, O Lord, we beseech thee, let us not perish for this man's life, and lay not upon us innocent blood: for thou, O Lord, hast done as it pleased thee.

column8: Jonah
column17: So they took up Jonah, and cast him forth into the sea: and the sea ceased from her raging.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then the men feared the Lord exceedingly, and offered a sacrifice unto the Lord, and made vows.

column8: Jonah
column17: Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God out of the fish's belly,

column8: Jonah
column17: And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.

column8: Jonah
column17: For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.

column8: Jonah
column17: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

column8: Jonah
column17: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O Lord my God.

column8: Jonah
column17: When my soul fainted within me I remembered the Lord: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.

column8: Jonah
column17: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

column8: Jonah
column17: But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the Lord.

column8: Jonah
column17: And the Lord spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.

column8: Jonah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the second time, saying,

column8: Jonah
column17: Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee.

column8: Jonah
column17: So Jonah arose, and went unto Nineveh, according to the word of the Lord. Now Nineveh was an exceeding great city of three days' journey.

column8: Jonah
column17: And Jonah began to enter into the city a day's journey, and he cried, and said, Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.

column8: Jonah
column17: So the people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.

column8: Jonah
column17: For word came unto the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.

column8: Jonah
column17: And he caused it to be proclaimed and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste any thing: let them not feed, nor drink water:

column8: Jonah
column17: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands.

column8: Jonah
column17: Who can tell if God will turn and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger, that we perish not?

column8: Jonah
column17: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way; and God repented of the evil, that he had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not.

column8: Jonah
column17: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.

column8: Jonah
column17: And he prayed unto the Lord, and said, I pray thee, O Lord, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.

column8: Jonah
column17: Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry?

column8: Jonah
column17: So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see what would become of the city.

column8: Jonah
column17: And the Lord God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd.

column8: Jonah
column17: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.

column8: Jonah
column17: And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live.

column8: Jonah
column17: And God said to Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death.

column8: Jonah
column17: Then said the Lord, Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night:

column8: Jonah
column17: And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle?

column8: Micah
column17: The word of the Lord that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.

column8: Micah
column17: Hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: and let the Lord God be witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.

column8: Micah
column17: For, behold, the Lord cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.

column8: Micah
column17: And the mountains shall be molten under him, and the valleys shall be cleft, as wax before the fire, and as the waters that are poured down a steep place.

column8: Micah
column17: For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of the field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, and I will discover the foundations thereof.

column8: Micah
column17: And all the graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and all the hires thereof shall be burned with the fire, and all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of the hire of an harlot, and they shall return to the hire of an harlot.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, and mourning as the owls.

column8: Micah
column17: For her wound is incurable; for it is come unto Judah; he is come unto the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.

column8: Micah
column17: Declare ye it not at Gath, weep ye not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll thyself in the dust.

column8: Micah
column17: Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in the mourning of Beth-ezel; he shall receive of you his standing.

column8: Micah
column17: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the Lord unto the gate of Jerusalem.

column8: Micah
column17: O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: she is the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: for the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore shalt thou give presents to Moresheth-gath: the houses of Achzib shall be a lie to the kings of Israel.

column8: Micah
column17: Yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah: he shall come unto Adullam the glory of Israel.

column8: Micah
column17: Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; enlarge thy baldness as the eagle; for they are gone into captivity from thee.

column8: Micah
column17: Woe to them that devise iniquity, and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light, they practise it, because it is in the power of their hand.

column8: Micah
column17: And they covet fields, and take them by violence; and houses, and take them away: so they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, against this family do I devise an evil, from which ye shall not remove your necks; neither shall ye go haughtily: for this time is evil.

column8: Micah
column17: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed it from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in the congregation of the Lord.

column8: Micah
column17: Prophesy ye not, say they to them that prophesy: they shall not prophesy to them, that they shall not take shame.

column8: Micah
column17: O thou that art named the house of Jacob, is the spirit of the Lord straitened? are these his doings? do not my words do good to him that walketh uprightly?

column8: Micah
column17: Even of late my people is risen up as an enemy: ye pull off the robe with the garment from them that pass by securely as men averse from war.

column8: Micah
column17: The women of my people have ye cast out from their pleasant houses; from their children have ye taken away my glory for ever.

column8: Micah
column17: Arise ye, and depart; for this is not your rest: because it is polluted, it shall destroy you, even with a sore destruction.

column8: Micah
column17: If a man walking in the spirit and falsehood do lie, saying, I will prophesy unto thee of wine and of strong drink; he shall even be the prophet of this people.

column8: Micah
column17: I will surely assemble, O Jacob, all of thee; I will surely gather the remnant of Israel; I will put them together as the sheep of Bozrah, as the flock in the midst of their fold: they shall make great noise by reason of the multitude of men.

column8: Micah
column17: The breaker is come up before them: they have broken up, and have passed through the gate, and are gone out by it: and their king shall pass before them, and the Lord on the head of them.

column8: Micah
column17: And I said, Hear, I pray you, O heads of Jacob, and ye princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?

column8: Micah
column17: Who hate the good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones;

column8: Micah
column17: Who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.

column8: Micah
column17: Then shall they cry unto the Lord, but he will not hear them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings.

column8: Micah
column17: Thus saith the Lord concerning the prophets that make my people err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark over them.

column8: Micah
column17: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.

column8: Micah
column17: But truly I am full of power by the spirit of the Lord, and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.

column8: Micah
column17: Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity.

column8: Micah
column17: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.

column8: Micah
column17: The heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the Lord, and say, Is not the Lord among us? none evil can come upon us.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of the forest.

column8: Micah
column17: But in the last days it shall come to pass, that the mountain of the house of the Lord shall be established in the top of the mountains, and it shall be exalted above the hills; and people shall flow unto it.

column8: Micah
column17: And many nations shall come, and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, and to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for the law shall go forth of Zion, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

column8: Micah
column17: And he shall judge among many people, and rebuke strong nations afar off; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up a sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.

column8: Micah
column17: But they shall sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree; and none shall make them afraid: for the mouth of the Lord of hosts hath spoken it.

column8: Micah
column17: For all people will walk every one in the name of his god, and we will walk in the name of the Lord our God for ever and ever.

column8: Micah
column17: In that day, saith the Lord, will I assemble her that halteth, and I will gather her that is driven out, and her that I have afflicted;

column8: Micah
column17: And I will make her that halted a remnant, and her that was cast far off a strong nation: and the Lord shall reign over them in mount Zion from henceforth, even for ever.

column8: Micah
column17: And thou, O tower of the flock, the strong hold of the daughter of Zion, unto thee shall it come, even the first dominion; the kingdom shall come to the daughter of Jerusalem.

column8: Micah
column17: Now why dost thou cry out aloud? is there no king in thee? is thy counsellor perished? for pangs have taken thee as a woman in travail.

column8: Micah
column17: Be in pain, and labour to bring forth, O daughter of Zion, like a woman in travail: for now shalt thou go forth out of the city, and thou shalt dwell in the field, and thou shalt go even to Babylon; there shalt thou be delivered; there the Lord shall redeem thee from the hand of thine enemies.

column8: Micah
column17: Now also many nations are gathered against thee, that say, Let her be defiled, and let our eye look upon Zion.

column8: Micah
column17: But they know not the thoughts of the Lord, neither understand they his counsel: for he shall gather them as the sheaves into the floor.

column8: Micah
column17: Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion: for I will make thine horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass: and thou shalt beat in pieces many people: and I will consecrate their gain unto the Lord, and their substance unto the Lord of the whole earth.

column8: Micah
column17: Now gather thyself in troops, O daughter of troops: he hath laid siege against us: they shall smite the judge of Israel with a rod upon the cheek.

column8: Micah
column17: But thou, Beth-lehem Ephratah, though thou be little among the thousands of Judah, yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth have been from of old, from everlasting.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore will he give them up, until the time that she which travaileth hath brought forth: then the remnant of his brethren shall return unto the children of Israel.

column8: Micah
column17: And he shall stand and feed in the strength of the Lord, in the majesty of the name of the Lord his God; and they shall abide: for now shall he be great unto the ends of the earth.

column8: Micah
column17: And this man shall be the peace, when the Assyrian shall come into our land: and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise against him seven shepherds, and eight principal men.

column8: Micah
column17: And they shall waste the land of Assyria with the sword, and the land of Nimrod in the entrances thereof: thus shall he deliver us from the Assyrian, when he cometh into our land, and when he treadeth within our borders.

column8: Micah
column17: And the remnant of Jacob shall be in the midst of many people as a dew from the Lord, as the showers upon the grass, that tarrieth not for man, nor waiteth for the sons of men.

column8: Micah
column17: And the remnant of Jacob shall be among the Gentiles in the midst of many people as a lion among the beasts of the forest, as a young lion among the flocks of sheep: who, if he go through, both treadeth down, and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.

column8: Micah
column17: Thine hand shall be lifted up upon thine adversaries, and all thine enemies shall be cut off.

column8: Micah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord, that I will cut off thy horses out of the midst of thee, and I will destroy thy chariots:

column8: Micah
column17: And I will cut off the cities of thy land, and throw down all thy strong holds:

column8: Micah
column17: And I will cut off witchcrafts out of thine hand; and thou shalt have no more soothsayers:

column8: Micah
column17: Thy graven images also will I cut off, and thy standing images out of the midst of thee; and thou shalt no more worship the work of thine hands.

column8: Micah
column17: And I will pluck up thy groves out of the midst of thee: so will I destroy thy cities.

column8: Micah
column17: And I will execute vengeance in anger and fury upon the heathen, such as they have not heard.

column8: Micah
column17: Hear ye now what the Lord saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.

column8: Micah
column17: Hear ye, O mountains, the Lord's controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.

column8: Micah
column17: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.

column8: Micah
column17: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

column8: Micah
column17: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the Lord.

column8: Micah
column17: Wherewith shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?

column8: Micah
column17: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

column8: Micah
column17: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

column8: Micah
column17: The Lord's voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.

column8: Micah
column17: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?

column8: Micah
column17: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?

column8: Micah
column17: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.

column8: Micah
column17: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.

column8: Micah
column17: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

column8: Micah
column17: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.

column8: Micah
column17: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits, as the grapegleanings of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my soul desired the firstripe fruit.

column8: Micah
column17: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.

column8: Micah
column17: That they may do evil with both hands earnestly, the prince asketh, and the judge asketh for a reward; and the great man, he uttereth his mischievous desire: so they wrap it up.

column8: Micah
column17: The best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a thorn hedge: the day of thy watchmen and thy visitation cometh; now shall be their perplexity.

column8: Micah
column17: Trust ye not in a friend, put ye not confidence in a guide: keep the doors of thy mouth from her that lieth in thy bosom.

column8: Micah
column17: For the son dishonoureth the father, the daughter riseth up against her mother, the daughter in law against her mother in law; a man's enemies are the men of his own house.

column8: Micah
column17: Therefore I will look unto the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.

column8: Micah
column17: Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise; when I sit in darkness, the Lord shall be a light unto me.

column8: Micah
column17: I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him, until he plead my cause, and execute judgment for me: he will bring me forth to the light, and I shall behold his righteousness.

column8: Micah
column17: Then she that is mine enemy shall see it, and shame shall cover her which said unto me, Where is the Lord thy God? mine eyes shall behold her: now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the streets.

column8: Micah
column17: In the day that thy walls are to be built, in that day shall the decree be far removed.

column8: Micah
column17: In that day also he shall come even to thee from Assyria, and from the fortified cities, and from the fortress even to the river, and from sea to sea, and from mountain to mountain.

column8: Micah
column17: Notwithstanding the land shall be desolate because of them that dwell therein, for the fruit of their doings.

column8: Micah
column17: Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thine heritage, which dwell solitarily in the wood, in the midst of Carmel: let them feed in Bashan and Gilead, as in the days of old.

column8: Micah
column17: According to the days of thy coming out of the land of Egypt will I shew unto him marvellous things.

column8: Micah
column17: The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might: they shall lay their hand upon their mouth, their ears shall be deaf.

column8: Micah
column17: They shall lick the dust like a serpent, they shall move out of their holes like worms of the earth: they shall be afraid of the Lord our God, and shall fear because of thee.

column8: Micah
column17: Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? he retaineth not his anger for ever, because he delighteth in mercy.

column8: Micah
column17: He will turn again, he will have compassion upon us; he will subdue our iniquities; and thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.

column8: Micah
column17: Thou wilt perform the truth to Jacob, and the mercy to Abraham, which thou hast sworn unto our fathers from the days of old.

column8: Nahum
column17: The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

column8: Nahum
column17: God is jealous, and the Lord revengeth; the Lord revengeth, and is furious; the Lord will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserveth wrath for his enemies.

column8: Nahum
column17: The Lord is slow to anger, and great in power, and will not at all acquit the wicked: the Lord hath his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.

column8: Nahum
column17: He rebuketh the sea, and maketh it dry, and drieth up all the rivers: Bashan languisheth, and Carmel, and the flower of Lebanon languisheth.

column8: Nahum
column17: The mountains quake at him, and the hills melt, and the earth is burned at his presence, yea, the world, and all that dwell therein.

column8: Nahum
column17: Who can stand before his indignation? and who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? his fury is poured out like fire, and the rocks are thrown down by him.

column8: Nahum
column17: The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.

column8: Nahum
column17: But with an overrunning flood he will make an utter end of the place thereof, and darkness shall pursue his enemies.

column8: Nahum
column17: What do ye imagine against the Lord? he will make an utter end: affliction shall not rise up the second time.

column8: Nahum
column17: For while they be folden together as thorns, and while they are drunken as drunkards, they shall be devoured as stubble fully dry.

column8: Nahum
column17: There is one come out of thee, that imagineth evil against the Lord, a wicked counsellor.

column8: Nahum
column17: Thus saith the Lord; Though they be quiet, and likewise many, yet thus shall they be cut down, when he shall pass through. Though I have afflicted thee, I will afflict thee no more.

column8: Nahum
column17: For now will I break his yoke from off thee, and will burst thy bonds in sunder.

column8: Nahum
column17: And the Lord hath given a commandment concerning thee, that no more of thy name be sown: out of the house of thy gods will I cut off the graven image and the molten image: I will make thy grave; for thou art vile.

column8: Nahum
column17: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.

column8: Nahum
column17: He that dasheth in pieces is come up before thy face: keep the munition, watch the way, make thy loins strong, fortify thy power mightily.

column8: Nahum
column17: For the Lord hath turned away the excellency of Jacob, as the excellency of Israel: for the emptiers have emptied them out, and marred their vine branches.

column8: Nahum
column17: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men are in scarlet: the chariots shall be with flaming torches in the day of his preparation, and the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.

column8: Nahum
column17: The chariots shall rage in the streets, they shall justle one against another in the broad ways: they shall seem like torches, they shall run like the lightnings.

column8: Nahum
column17: He shall recount his worthies: they shall stumble in their walk; they shall make haste to the wall thereof, and the defence shall be prepared.

column8: Nahum
column17: The gates of the rivers shall be opened, and the palace shall be dissolved.

column8: Nahum
column17: And Huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, and her maids shall lead her as with the voice of doves, tabering upon their breasts.

column8: Nahum
column17: But Nineveh is of old like a pool of water: yet they shall flee away. Stand, stand, shall they cry; but none shall look back.

column8: Nahum
column17: Take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold: for there is none end of the store and glory out of all the pleasant furniture.

column8: Nahum
column17: She is empty, and void, and waste: and the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, and much pain is in all loins, and the faces of them all gather blackness.

column8: Nahum
column17: Where is the dwelling of the lions, and the feedingplace of the young lions, where the lion, even the old lion, walked, and the lion's whelp, and none made them afraid?

column8: Nahum
column17: The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his holes with prey, and his dens with ravin.

column8: Nahum
column17: Behold, I am against thee, saith the Lord of hosts, and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword shall devour thy young lions: and I will cut off thy prey from the earth, and the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.

column8: Nahum
column17: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and robbery; the prey departeth not;

column8: Nahum
column17: The noise of a whip, and the noise of the rattling of the wheels, and of the pransing horses, and of the jumping chariots.

column8: Nahum
column17: The horseman lifteth up both the bright sword and the glittering spear: and there is a multitude of slain, and a great number of carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumble upon their corpses:

column8: Nahum
column17: Because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the wellfavoured harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations through her whoredoms, and families through her witchcrafts.

column8: Nahum
column17: Behold, I am against thee, saith the Lord of hosts; and I will discover thy skirts upon thy face, and I will shew the nations thy nakedness, and the kingdoms thy shame.

column8: Nahum
column17: And I will cast abominable filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazingstock.

column8: Nahum
column17: And it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee shall flee from thee, and say, Nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her? whence shall I seek comforters for thee?

column8: Nahum
column17: Art thou better than populous No, that was situate among the rivers, that had the waters round about it, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was from the sea?

column8: Nahum
column17: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and it was infinite; Put and Lubim were thy helpers.

column8: Nahum
column17: Yet was she carried away, she went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.

column8: Nahum
column17: Thou also shalt be drunken: thou shalt be hid, thou also shalt seek strength because of the enemy.

column8: Nahum
column17: All thy strong holds shall be like fig trees with the firstripe figs: if they be shaken, they shall even fall into the mouth of the eater.

column8: Nahum
column17: Behold, thy people in the midst of thee are women: the gates of thy land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire shall devour thy bars.

column8: Nahum
column17: Draw thee waters for the siege, fortify thy strong holds: go into clay, and tread the mortar, make strong the brickkiln.

column8: Nahum
column17: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.

column8: Nahum
column17: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven: the cankerworm spoileth, and flieth away.

column8: Nahum
column17: Thy crowned are as the locusts, and thy captains as the great grasshoppers, which camp in the hedges in the cold day, but when the sun ariseth they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.

column8: Nahum
column17: Thy shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria: thy nobles shall dwell in the dust: thy people is scattered upon the mountains, and no man gathereth them.

column8: Nahum
