column17: There is no healing of thy bruise; thy wound is grievous: all that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hands over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed continually?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: O Lord, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Art thou not from everlasting, O Lord my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O Lord, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon the tower, and will watch to see what he will say unto me, and what I shall answer when I am reproved.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: And the Lord answered me, and said, Write the vision, and make it plain upon tables, that he may run that readeth it.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: For the vision is yet for an appointed time, but at the end it shall speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; because it will surely come, it will not tarry.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Behold, his soul which is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Yea also, because he transgresseth by wine, he is a proud man, neither keepeth at home, who enlargeth his desire as hell, and is as death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth unto him all nations, and heapeth unto him all people:

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick clay!

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee, and awake that shall vex thee, and thou shalt be for booties unto them?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Because thou hast spoiled many nations, all the remnant of the people shall spoil thee; because of men's blood, and for the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Woe to him that coveteth an evil covetousness to his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the power of evil!

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou hast consulted shame to thy house by cutting off many people, and hast sinned against thy soul.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Woe to him that buildeth a town with blood, and stablisheth a city by iniquity!

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Behold, is it not of the Lord of hosts that the people shall labour in the very fire, and the people shall weary themselves for very vanity?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Woe unto him that giveth his neighbour drink, that puttest thy bottle to him, and makest him drunken also, that thou mayest look on their nakedness!

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou art filled with shame for glory: drink thou also, and let thy foreskin be uncovered: the cup of the Lord's right hand shall be turned unto thee, and shameful spewing shall be on thy glory.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: For the violence of Lebanon shall cover thee, and the spoil of beasts, which made them afraid, because of men's blood, and for the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: What profiteth the graven image that the maker thereof hath graven it; the molten image, and a teacher of lies, that the maker of his work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Woe unto him that saith to the wood, Awake; to the dumb stone, Arise, it shall teach! Behold, it is laid over with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in the midst of it.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: But the Lord is in his holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before him.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: O Lord, I have heard thy speech, and was afraid: O Lord, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: And his brightness was as the light; he had horns coming out of his hand: and there was the hiding of his power.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways are everlasting.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Was the Lord displeased against the rivers? was thine anger against the rivers? was thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses and thy chariots of salvation?

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thy bow was made quite naked, according to the oaths of the tribes, even thy word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: The mountains saw thee, and they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, and lifted up his hands on high.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thine arrows they went, and at the shining of thy glittering spear.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing was as to devour the poor secretly.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the heap of great waters.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls:

column8: Habakkuk
column17: Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation.

column8: Habakkuk
column17: The Lord God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The word of the Lord which came unto Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hizkiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I will utterly consume all things from off the land, saith the Lord.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I will consume man and beast; I will consume the fowls of the heaven, and the fishes of the sea, and the stumblingblocks with the wicked; and I will cut off man from off the land, saith the Lord.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I will also stretch out mine hand upon Judah, and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place, and the name of the Chemarims with the priests;

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the Lord, and that swear by Malcham;

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And them that are turned back from the Lord; and those that have not sought the Lord, nor inquired for him.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Hold thy peace at the presence of the Lord God: for the day of the Lord is at hand: for the Lord hath prepared a sacrifice, he hath bid his guests.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And it shall come to pass in the day of the Lord's sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, and the king's children, and all such as are clothed with strange apparel.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: In the same day also will I punish all those that leap on the threshold, which fill their masters' houses with violence and deceit.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord, that there shall be the noise of a cry from the fish gate, and an howling from the second, and a great crashing from the hills.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Howl, ye inhabitants of Maktesh, for all the merchant people are cut down; all they that bear silver are cut off.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settled on their lees: that say in their heart, The Lord will not do good, neither will he do evil.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Therefore their goods shall become a booty, and their houses a desolation: they shall also build houses, but not inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, but not drink the wine thereof.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The great day of the Lord is near, it is near, and hasteth greatly, even the voice of the day of the Lord: the mighty man shall cry there bitterly.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,

column8: Zephaniah
column17: A day of the trumpet and alarm against the fenced cities, and against the high towers.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And I will bring distress upon men, that they shall walk like blind men, because they have sinned against the Lord: and their blood shall be poured out as dust, and their flesh as the dung.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver them in the day of the Lord's wrath; but the whole land shall be devoured by the fire of his jealousy: for he shall make even a speedy riddance of all them that dwell in the land.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together, O nation not desired;

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Before the decree bring forth, before the day pass as the chaff, before the fierce anger of the Lord come upon you, before the day of the Lord's anger come upon you.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Seek ye the Lord, all ye meek of the earth, which have wrought his judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid in the day of the Lord's anger.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: For Gaza shall be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation: they shall drive out Ashdod at the noon day, and Ekron shall be rooted up.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Woe unto the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the Cherethites! the word of the Lord is against you; O Canaan, the land of the Philistines, I will even destroy thee, that there shall be no inhabitant.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And the sea coast shall be dwellings and cottages for shepherds, and folds for flocks.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And the coast shall be for the remnant of the house of Judah; they shall feed thereupon: in the houses of Ashkelon shall they lie down in the evening: for the Lord their God shall visit them, and turn away their captivity.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I have heard the reproach of Moab, and the revilings of the children of Ammon, whereby they have reproached my people, and magnified themselves against their border.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Therefore as I live, saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Surely Moab shall be as Sodom, and the children of Ammon as Gomorrah, even the breeding of nettles, and saltpits, and a perpetual desolation: the residue of my people shall spoil them, and the remnant of my people shall possess them.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: This shall they have for their pride, because they have reproached and magnified themselves against the people of the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The Lord will be terrible unto them: for he will famish all the gods of the earth; and men shall worship him, every one from his place, even all the isles of the heathen.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Ye Ethiopians also, ye shall be slain by my sword.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And he will stretch out his hand against the north, and destroy Assyria; and will make Nineveh a desolation, and dry like a wilderness.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: And flocks shall lie down in the midst of her, all the beasts of the nations: both the cormorant and the bittern shall lodge in the upper lintels of it; their voice shall sing in the windows; desolation shall be in the thresholds: for he shall uncover the cedar work.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: This is the rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly, that said in her heart, I am, and there is none beside me: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down in! every one that passeth by her shall hiss, and wag his hand.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!

column8: Zephaniah
column17: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the Lord; she drew not near to her God.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The just Lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the Lord, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Lord, to serve him with one consent.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the Lord.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The Lord hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.

column8: Zephaniah
column17: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.

column8: Haggai
column17: In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, came the word of the Lord by Haggai the prophet unto Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, saying, This people say, The time is not come, the time that the Lord's house should be built.

column8: Haggai
column17: Then came the word of the Lord by Haggai the prophet, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Is it time for you, O ye, to dwell in your ceiled houses, and this house lie waste?

column8: Haggai
column17: Now therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts; Consider your ways.

column8: Haggai
column17: Ye have sown much, and bring in little; ye eat, but ye have not enough; ye drink, but ye are not filled with drink; ye clothe you, but there is none warm; and he that earneth wages earneth wages to put it into a bag with holes.

column8: Haggai
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Consider your ways.

column8: Haggai
column17: Go up to the mountain, and bring wood, and build the house; and I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, saith the Lord.

column8: Haggai
column17: Ye looked for much, and, lo, it came to little; and when ye brought it home, I did blow upon it. Why? saith the Lord of hosts. Because of mine house that is waste, and ye run every man unto his own house.

column8: Haggai
column17: Therefore the heaven over you is stayed from dew, and the earth is stayed from her fruit.

column8: Haggai
column17: And I called for a drought upon the land, and upon the mountains, and upon the corn, and upon the new wine, and upon the oil, and upon that which the ground bringeth forth, and upon men, and upon cattle, and upon all the labour of the hands.

column8: Haggai
column17: Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, with all the remnant of the people, obeyed the voice of the Lord their God, and the words of Haggai the prophet, as the Lord their God had sent him, and the people did fear before the Lord.

column8: Haggai
column17: Then spake Haggai the Lord's messenger in the Lord's message unto the people, saying, I am with you, saith the Lord.

column8: Haggai
column17: And the Lord stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people; and they came and did work in the house of the Lord of hosts, their God,

column8: Haggai
column17: In the four and twentieth day of the sixth month, in the second year of Darius the king.

column8: Haggai
column17: In the seventh month, in the one and twentieth day of the month, came the word of the Lord by the prophet Haggai, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, and to the residue of the people, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eyes in comparison of it as nothing?

column8: Haggai
column17: Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, saith the Lord; and be strong, O Joshua, son of Josedech, the high priest; and be strong, all ye people of the land, saith the Lord, and work: for I am with you, saith the Lord of hosts:

column8: Haggai
column17: According to the word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt, so my spirit remaineth among you: fear ye not.

column8: Haggai
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts; Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry land;

column8: Haggai
column17: And I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come: and I will fill this house with glory, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Haggai
column17: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Haggai
column17: The glory of this latter house shall be greater than of the former, saith the Lord of hosts: and in this place will I give peace, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Haggai
column17: In the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the Lord by Haggai the prophet, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: If one bear holy flesh in the skirt of his garment, and with his skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any meat, shall it be holy? And the priests answered and said, No.

column8: Haggai
column17: Then said Haggai, If one that is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, shall it be unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.

column8: Haggai
column17: Then answered Haggai, and said, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, saith the Lord; and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.

column8: Haggai
column17: And now, I pray you, consider from this day and upward, from before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of the Lord:

column8: Haggai
column17: Since those days were, when one came to an heap of twenty measures, there were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out fifty vessels out of the press, there were but twenty.

column8: Haggai
column17: I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the labours of your hands; yet ye turned not to me, saith the Lord.

column8: Haggai
column17: Consider now from this day and upward, from the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, even from the day that the foundation of the Lord's temple was laid, consider it.

column8: Haggai
column17: Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, as yet the vine, and the fig tree, and the pomegranate, and the olive tree, hath not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.

column8: Haggai
column17: And again the word of the Lord came unto Haggai in the four and twentieth day of the month, saying,

column8: Haggai
column17: Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;

column8: Haggai
column17: And I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the heathen; and I will overthrow the chariots, and those that ride in them; and the horses and their riders shall come down, every one by the sword of his brother.

column8: Haggai
column17: In that day, saith the Lord of hosts, will I take thee, O Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, saith the Lord, and will make thee as a signet: for I have chosen thee, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the Lord unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: The Lord hath been sore displeased with your fathers.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Therefore say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Turn ye unto me, saith the Lord of hosts, and I will turn unto you, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Be ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophets have cried, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Turn ye now from your evil ways, and from your evil doings: but they did not hear, nor hearken unto me, saith the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for ever?

column8: Zechariah
column17: But my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not take hold of your fathers? and they returned and said, Like as the Lord of hosts thought to do unto us, according to our ways, and according to our doings, so hath he dealt with us.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Sebat, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the Lord unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: I saw by night, and behold a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in the bottom; and behind him were there red horses, speckled, and white.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said I, O my lord, what are these? And the angel that talked with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these be.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the man that stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These are they whom the Lord hath sent to walk to and fro through the earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And they answered the angel of the Lord that stood among the myrtle trees, and said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, and, behold, all the earth sitteth still, and is at rest.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then the angel of the Lord answered and said, O Lord of hosts, how long wilt thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which thou hast had indignation these threescore and ten years?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord answered the angel that talked with me with good words and comfortable words.

column8: Zechariah
column17: So the angel that communed with me said unto me, Cry thou, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I am very sore displeased with the heathen that are at ease: for I was but a little displeased, and they helped forward the affliction.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Therefore thus saith the Lord; I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies: my house shall be built in it, saith the Lord of hosts, and a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Cry yet, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad; and the Lord shall yet comfort Zion, and shall yet choose Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then lifted I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I said unto the angel that talked with me, What be these? And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord shewed me four carpenters.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said I, What come these to do? And he spake, saying, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, so that no man did lift up his head: but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horns of the Gentiles, which lifted up their horn over the land of Judah to scatter it.

column8: Zechariah
column17: I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And, behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

column8: Zechariah
column17: And said unto him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein:

column8: Zechariah
column17: For I, saith the Lord, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the midst of her.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, saith the Lord: for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, saith the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Deliver thyself, O Zion, that dwellest with the daughter of Babylon.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts; After the glory hath he sent me unto the nations which spoiled you: for he that toucheth you toucheth the apple of his eye.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For, behold, I will shake mine hand upon them, and they shall be a spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion: for, lo, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And many nations shall be joined to the Lord in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto thee.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Be silent, O all flesh, before the Lord: for he is raised up out of his holy habitation.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he shewed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord, and Satan standing at his right hand to resist him.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord said unto Satan, The Lord rebuke thee, O Satan; even the Lord that hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee: is not this a brand plucked out of the fire?

column8: Zechariah
column17: Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and stood before the angel.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he answered and spake unto those that stood before him, saying, Take away the filthy garments from him. And unto him he said, Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee, and I will clothe thee with change of raiment.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I said, Let them set a fair mitre upon his head. So they set a fair mitre upon his head, and clothed him with garments. And the angel of the Lord stood by.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the angel of the Lord protested unto Joshua, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; If thou wilt walk in my ways, and if thou wilt keep my charge, then thou shalt also judge my house, and shalt also keep my courts, and I will give thee places to walk among these that stand by.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Hear now, O Joshua the high priest, thou, and thy fellows that sit before thee: for they are men wondered at: for, behold, I will bring forth my servant the Branch.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For behold the stone that I have laid before Joshua; upon one stone shall be seven eyes: behold, I will engrave the graving thereof, saith the Lord of hosts, and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day, saith the Lord of hosts, shall ye call every man his neighbour under the vine and under the fig tree.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the angel that talked with me came again, and waked me, as a man that is wakened out of his sleep,

column8: Zechariah
column17: And said unto me, What seest thou? And I said, I have looked, and behold a candlestick all of gold, with a bowl upon the top of it, and his seven lamps thereon, and seven pipes to the seven lamps, which are upon the top thereof:

column8: Zechariah
column17: And two olive trees by it, one upon the right side of the bowl, and the other upon the left side thereof.

column8: Zechariah
column17: So I answered and spake to the angel that talked with me, saying, What are these, my lord?

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then the angel that talked with me answered and said unto me, Knowest thou not what these be? And I said, No, my lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then he answered and spake unto me, saying, This is the word of the Lord unto Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Who art thou, O great mountain? before Zerubbabel thou shalt become a plain: and he shall bring forth the headstone thereof with shoutings, crying, Grace, grace unto it.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house; his hands shall also finish it; and thou shalt know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto you.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For who hath despised the day of small things? for they shall rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of Zerubbabel with those seven; they are the eyes of the Lord, which run to and fro through the whole earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then answered I, and said unto him, What are these two olive trees upon the right side of the candlestick and upon the left side thereof?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I answered again, and said unto him, What be these two olive branches which through the two golden pipes empty the golden oil out of themselves?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he answered me and said, Knowest thou not what these be? And I said, No, my lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said he, These are the two anointed ones, that stand by the Lord of the whole earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then I turned, and lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a flying roll.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he said unto me, What seest thou? And I answered, I see a flying roll; the length thereof is twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof ten cubits.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said he unto me, This is the curse that goeth forth over the face of the whole earth: for every one that stealeth shall be cut off as on this side according to it; and every one that sweareth shall be cut off as on that side according to it.

column8: Zechariah
column17: I will bring it forth, saith the Lord of hosts, and it shall enter into the house of the thief, and into the house of him that sweareth falsely by my name: and it shall remain in the midst of his house, and shall consume it with the timber thereof and the stones thereof.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then the angel that talked with me went forth, and said unto me, Lift up now thine eyes, and see what is this that goeth forth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I said, What is it? And he said, This is an ephah that goeth forth. He said moreover, This is their resemblance through all the earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And, behold, there was lifted up a talent of lead: and this is a woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he said, This is wickedness. And he cast it into the midst of the ephah; and he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth thereof.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then lifted I up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came out two women, and the wind was in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the heaven.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said I to the angel that talked with me, Whither do these bear the ephah?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he said unto me, To build it an house in the land of Shinar: and it shall be established, and set there upon her own base.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I turned, and lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came four chariots out from between two mountains; and the mountains were mountains of brass.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In the first chariot were red horses; and in the second chariot black horses;

column8: Zechariah
column17: And in the third chariot white horses; and in the fourth chariot grisled and bay horses.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then I answered and said unto the angel that talked with me, What are these, my lord?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the angel answered and said unto me, These are the four spirits of the heavens, which go forth from standing before the Lord of all the earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: The black horses which are therein go forth into the north country; and the white go forth after them; and the grisled go forth toward the south country.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the bay went forth, and sought to go that they might walk to and fro through the earth: and he said, Get you hence, walk to and fro through the earth. So they walked to and fro through the earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then cried he upon me, and spake unto me, saying, Behold, these that go toward the north country have quieted my spirit in the north country.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Take of them of the captivity, even of Heldai, of Tobijah, and of Jedaiah, which are come from Babylon, and come thou the same day, and go into the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah;

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then take silver and gold, and make crowns, and set them upon the head of Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest;

column8: Zechariah
column17: And speak unto him, saying, Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, saying, Behold the man whose name is The Branch; and he shall grow up out of his place, and he shall build the temple of the Lord:

column8: Zechariah
column17: Even he shall build the temple of the Lord; and he shall bear the glory, and shall sit and rule upon his throne; and he shall be a priest upon his throne: and the counsel of peace shall be between them both.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the crowns shall be to Helem, and to Tobijah, and to Jedaiah, and to Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And they that are far off shall come and build in the temple of the Lord, and ye shall know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto you. And this shall come to pass, if ye will diligently obey the voice of the Lord your God.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Darius, that the word of the Lord came unto Zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth month, even in Chisleu;

column8: Zechariah
column17: When they had sent unto the house of God Sherezer and Regem-melech, and their men, to pray before the Lord,

column8: Zechariah
column17: And to speak unto the priests which were in the house of the Lord of hosts, and to the prophets, saying, Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then came the word of the Lord of hosts unto me, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Speak unto all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying, When ye fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh month, even those seventy years, did ye at all fast unto me, even to me?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And when ye did eat, and when ye did drink, did not ye eat for yourselves, and drink for yourselves?

column8: Zechariah
column17: Should ye not hear the words which the Lord hath cried by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity, and the cities thereof round about her, when men inhabited the south and the plain?

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the word of the Lord came unto Zechariah, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, saying, Execute true judgment, and shew mercy and compassions every man to his brother:

column8: Zechariah
column17: And oppress not the widow, nor the fatherless, the stranger, nor the poor; and let none of you imagine evil against his brother in your heart.

column8: Zechariah
column17: But they refused to hearken, and pulled away the shoulder, and stopped their ears, that they should not hear.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Yea, they made their hearts as an adamant stone, lest they should hear the law, and the words which the Lord of hosts hath sent in his spirit by the former prophets: therefore came a great wrath from the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Therefore it is come to pass, that as he cried, and they would not hear; so they cried, and I would not hear, saith the Lord of hosts:

column8: Zechariah
column17: But I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations whom they knew not. Thus the land was desolate after them, that no man passed through nor returned: for they laid the pleasant land desolate.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Again the word of the Lord of hosts came to me, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; I was jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and I was jealous for her with great fury.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord; I am returned unto Zion, and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem: and Jerusalem shall be called a city of truth; and the mountain of the Lord of hosts the holy mountain.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; There shall yet old men and old women dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, and every man with his staff in his hand for very age.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the streets of the city shall be full of boys and girls playing in the streets thereof.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; If it be marvellous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, should it also be marvellous in mine eyes? saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Behold, I will save my people from the east country, and from the west country;

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will bring them, and they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Let your hands be strong, ye that hear in these days these words by the mouth of the prophets, which were in the day that the foundation of the house of the Lord of hosts was laid, that the temple might be built.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For before these days there was no hire for man, nor any hire for beast; neither was there any peace to him that went out or came in because of the affliction: for I set all men every one against his neighbour.

column8: Zechariah
column17: But now I will not be unto the residue of this people as in the former days, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For the seed shall be prosperous; the vine shall give her fruit, and the ground shall give her increase, and the heavens shall give their dew; and I will cause the remnant of this people to possess all these things.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that as ye were a curse among the heathen, O house of Judah, and house of Israel; so will I save you, and ye shall be a blessing: fear not, but let your hands be strong.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For thus saith the Lord of hosts; As I thought to punish you, when your fathers provoked me to wrath, saith the Lord of hosts, and I repented not:

column8: Zechariah
column17: So again have I thought in these days to do well unto Jerusalem and to the house of Judah: fear ye not.

column8: Zechariah
column17: These are the things that ye shall do; Speak ye every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:

column8: Zechariah
column17: And let none of you imagine evil in your hearts against his neighbour; and love no false oath: for all these are things that I hate, saith the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the word of the Lord of hosts came unto me, saying,

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; The fast of the fourth month, and the fast of the fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth, shall be to the house of Judah joy and gladness, and cheerful feasts; therefore love the truth and peace.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; It shall yet come to pass, that there shall come people, and the inhabitants of many cities:

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, Let us go speedily to pray before the Lord, and to seek the Lord of hosts: I will go also.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Yea, many people and strong nations shall come to seek the Lord of hosts in Jerusalem, and to pray before the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; In those days it shall come to pass, that ten men shall take hold out of all languages of the nations, even shall take hold of the skirt of him that is a Jew, saying, We will go with you: for we have heard that God is with you.

column8: Zechariah
column17: The burden of the word of the Lord in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;

column8: Zechariah
column17: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the Lord God shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.

column8: Zechariah
column17: The Lord of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Ask ye of the Lord rain in the time of the latter rain; so the Lord shall make bright clouds, and give them showers of rain, to every one grass in the field.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For the idols have spoken vanity, and the diviners have seen a lie, and have told false dreams; they comfort in vain: therefore they went their way as a flock, they were troubled, because there was no shepherd.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Mine anger was kindled against the shepherds, and I punished the goats: for the Lord of hosts hath visited his flock the house of Judah, and hath made them as his goodly horse in the battle.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Out of him came forth the corner, out of him the nail, out of him the battle bow, out of him every oppressor together.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And they shall be as mighty men, which tread down their enemies in the mire of the streets in the battle: and they shall fight, because the Lord is with them, and the riders on horses shall be confounded.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will bring them again to place them; for I have mercy upon them: and they shall be as though I had not cast them off: for I am the Lord their God, and will hear them.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And they of Ephraim shall be like a mighty man, and their heart shall rejoice as through wine: yea, their children shall see it, and be glad; their heart shall rejoice in the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: I will hiss for them, and gather them; for I have redeemed them: and they shall increase as they have increased.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will sow them among the people: and they shall remember me in far countries; and they shall live with their children, and turn again.

column8: Zechariah
column17: I will bring them again also out of the land of Egypt, and gather them out of Assyria; and I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon; and place shall not be found for them.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And he shall pass through the sea with affliction, and shall smite the waves in the sea, and all the deeps of the river shall dry up: and the pride of Assyria shall be brought down, and the sceptre of Egypt shall depart away.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will strengthen them in the Lord; and they shall walk up and down in his name, saith the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Howl, fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; because the mighty are spoiled: howl, O ye oaks of Bashan; for the forest of the vintage is come down.

column8: Zechariah
column17: There is a voice of the howling of the shepherds; for their glory is spoiled: a voice of the roaring of young lions; for the pride of Jordan is spoiled.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Thus saith the Lord my God; Feed the flock of the slaughter;

column8: Zechariah
column17: Whose possessors slay them, and hold themselves not guilty: and they that sell them say, Blessed be the Lord; for I am rich: and their own shepherds pity them not.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land, saith the Lord: but, lo, I will deliver the men every one into his neighbour's hand, and into the hand of his king: and they shall smite the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver them.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will feed the flock of slaughter, even you, O poor of the flock. And I took unto me two staves; the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bands; and I fed the flock.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Three shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them, and their soul also abhorred me.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth, let it die; and that that is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest eat every one the flesh of another.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I took my staff, even Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it was broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that waited upon me knew that it was the word of the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I said unto them, If ye think good, give me my price; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty pieces of silver.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord said unto me, Cast it unto the potter: a goodly price that I was prised at of them. And I took the thirty pieces of silver, and cast them to the potter in the house of the Lord.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then I cut asunder mine other staff, even Bands, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord said unto me, Take unto thee yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, which shall not visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claws in pieces.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword shall be upon his arm, and upon his right eye: his arm shall be clean dried up, and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.

column8: Zechariah
column17: The burden of the word of the Lord for Israel, saith the Lord, which stretcheth forth the heavens, and layeth the foundation of the earth, and formeth the spirit of man within him.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of trembling unto all the people round about, when they shall be in the siege both against Judah and against Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And in that day will I make Jerusalem a burdensome stone for all people: all that burden themselves with it shall be cut in pieces, though all the people of the earth be gathered together against it.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day, saith the Lord, I will smite every horse with astonishment, and his rider with madness: and I will open mine eyes upon the house of Judah, and will smite every horse of the people with blindness.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the governors of Judah shall say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be my strength in the Lord of hosts their God.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day will I make the governors of Judah like an hearth of fire among the wood, and like a torch of fire in a sheaf; and they shall devour all the people round about, on the right hand and on the left: and Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place, even in Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: The Lord also shall save the tents of Judah first, that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem do not magnify themselves against Judah.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day shall the Lord defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and he that is feeble among them at that day shall be as David; and the house of David shall be as God, as the angel of the Lord before them.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will pour upon the house of David, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, and they shall mourn for him, as one mourneth for his only son, and shall be in bitterness for him, as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, as the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the land shall mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;

column8: Zechariah
column17: The family of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; the family of Shimei apart, and their wives apart;

column8: Zechariah
column17: All the families that remain, every family apart, and their wives apart.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day there shall be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord of hosts, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land, and they shall no more be remembered: and also I will cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that when any shall yet prophesy, then his father and his mother that begat him shall say unto him, Thou shalt not live; for thou speakest lies in the name of the Lord: and his father and his mother that begat him shall thrust him through when he prophesieth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the prophets shall be ashamed every one of his vision, when he hath prophesied; neither shall they wear a rough garment to deceive:

column8: Zechariah
column17: But he shall say, I am no prophet, I am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And one shall say unto him, What are these wounds in thine hands? Then he shall answer, Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, and against the man that is my fellow, saith the Lord of hosts: smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered: and I will turn mine hand upon the little ones.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that in all the land, saith the Lord, two parts therein shall be cut off and die; but the third shall be left therein.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will try them as gold is tried: they shall call on my name, and I will hear them: I will say, It is my people: and they shall say, The Lord is my God.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, and thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.

column8: Zechariah
column17: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city shall be taken, and the houses rifled, and the women ravished; and half of the city shall go forth into captivity, and the residue of the people shall not be cut off from the city.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Then shall the Lord go forth, and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east, and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west, and there shall be a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north, and half of it toward the south.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And ye shall flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach unto Azal: yea, ye shall flee, like as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah: and the Lord my God shall come, and all the saints with thee.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not be clear, nor dark:

column8: Zechariah
column17: But it shall be one day which shall be known to the Lord, not day, nor night: but it shall come to pass, that at evening time it shall be light.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall be in that day, that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the former sea, and half of them toward the hinder sea: in summer and in winter shall it be.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And the Lord shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall there be one Lord, and his name one.

column8: Zechariah
column17: All the land shall be turned as a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem: and it shall be lifted up, and inhabited in her place, from Benjamin's gate unto the place of the first gate, unto the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananeel unto the king's winepresses.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And this shall be the plague wherewith the Lord will smite all the people that have fought against Jerusalem; Their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet, and their eyes shall consume away in their holes, and their tongue shall consume away in their mouth.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great tumult from the Lord shall be among them; and they shall lay hold every one on the hand of his neighbour, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the heathen round about shall be gathered together, gold, and silver, and apparel, in great abundance.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And so shall be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the ass, and of all the beasts that shall be in these tents, as this plague.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall even go up from year to year to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, and to keep the feast of tabernacles.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And it shall be, that whoso will not come up of all the families of the earth unto Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord of hosts, even upon them shall be no rain.

column8: Zechariah
column17: And if the family of Egypt go not up, and come not, that have no rain; there shall be the plague, wherewith the Lord will smite the heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.

column8: Zechariah
column17: This shall be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all nations that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.

column8: Zechariah
column17: In that day shall there be upon the bells of the horses, Holiness unto the Lord; and the pots in the Lord's house shall be like the bowls before the altar.

column8: Zechariah
column17: Yea, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holiness unto the Lord of hosts: and all they that sacrifice shall come and take of them, and seethe therein: and in that day there shall be no more the Canaanite in the house of the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: The burden of the word of the Lord to Israel by Malachi.

column8: Malachi
column17: I have loved you, saith the Lord. Yet ye say, Wherein hast thou loved us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother? saith the Lord: yet I loved Jacob,

column8: Malachi
column17: And I hated Esau, and laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.

column8: Malachi
column17: Whereas Edom saith, We are impoverished, but we will return and build the desolate places; thus saith the Lord of hosts, They shall build, but I will throw down; and they shall call them, The border of wickedness, and, The people against whom the Lord hath indignation for ever.

column8: Malachi
column17: And your eyes shall see, and ye shall say, The Lord will be magnified from the border of Israel.

column8: Malachi
column17: A son honoureth his father, and a servant his master: if then I be a father, where is mine honour? and if I be a master, where is my fear? saith the Lord of hosts unto you, O priests, that despise my name. And ye say, Wherein have we despised thy name?

column8: Malachi
column17: Ye offer polluted bread upon mine altar; and ye say, Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of the Lord is contemptible.

column8: Malachi
column17: And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil? and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil? offer it now unto thy governor; will he be pleased with thee, or accept thy person? saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: this hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do ye kindle fire on mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you, saith the Lord of hosts, neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

column8: Malachi
column17: For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same my name shall be great among the Gentiles; and in every place incense shall be offered unto my name, and a pure offering: for my name shall be great among the heathen, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: But ye have profaned it, in that ye say, The table of the Lord is polluted; and the fruit thereof, even his meat, is contemptible.

column8: Malachi
column17: Ye said also, Behold, what a weariness is it! and ye have snuffed at it, saith the Lord of hosts; and ye brought that which was torn, and the lame, and the sick; thus ye brought an offering: should I accept this of your hand? saith the Lord.

column8: Malachi
column17: But cursed be the deceiver, which hath in his flock a male, and voweth, and sacrificeth unto the Lord a corrupt thing: for I am a great King, saith the Lord of hosts, and my name is dreadful among the heathen.

column8: Malachi
column17: And now, O ye priests, this commandment is for you.

column8: Malachi
column17: If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the Lord of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.

column8: Malachi
column17: Behold, I will corrupt your seed, and spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with it.

column8: Malachi
column17: And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, that my covenant might be with Levi, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him for the fear wherewith he feared me, and was afraid before my name.

column8: Malachi
column17: The law of truth was in his mouth, and iniquity was not found in his lips: he walked with me in peace and equity, and did turn many away from iniquity.

column8: Malachi
column17: For the priest's lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth: for he is the messenger of the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: But ye are departed out of the way; ye have caused many to stumble at the law; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.

column8: Malachi
column17: Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?

column8: Malachi
column17: Judah hath dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the Lord which he loved, and hath married the daughter of a strange god.

column8: Malachi
column17: The Lord will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the scholar, out of the tabernacles of Jacob, and him that offereth an offering unto the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: And this have ye done again, covering the altar of the Lord with tears, with weeping, and with crying out, insomuch that he regardeth not the offering any more, or receiveth it with good will at your hand.

column8: Malachi
column17: Yet ye say, Wherefore? Because the Lord hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, against whom thou hast dealt treacherously: yet is she thy companion, and the wife of thy covenant.

column8: Malachi
column17: And did not he make one? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.

column8: Malachi
column17: For the Lord, the God of Israel, saith that he hateth putting away: for one covereth violence with his garment, saith the Lord of hosts: therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.

column8: Malachi
column17: Ye have wearied the Lord with your words. Yet ye say, Wherein have we wearied him? When ye say, Every one that doeth evil is good in the sight of the Lord, and he delighteth in them; or, Where is the God of judgment?

column8: Malachi
column17: Behold, I will send my messenger, and he shall prepare the way before me: and the Lord, whom ye seek, shall suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in: behold, he shall come, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: But who may abide the day of his coming? and who shall stand when he appeareth? for he is like a refiner's fire, and like fullers' soap:

column8: Malachi
column17: And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver: and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver, that they may offer unto the Lord an offering in righteousness.

column8: Malachi
column17: Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the Lord, as in the days of old, and as in former years.

column8: Malachi
column17: And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from his right, and fear not me, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: For I am the Lord, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.

column8: Malachi
column17: Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto me, and I will return unto you, saith the Lord of hosts. But ye said, Wherein shall we return?

column8: Malachi
column17: Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say, Wherein have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.

column8: Malachi
column17: Ye are cursed with a curse: for ye have robbed me, even this whole nation.

column8: Malachi
column17: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the Lord of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receive it.

column8: Malachi
column17: And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the field, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: And all nations shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: Your words have been stout against me, saith the Lord. Yet ye say, What have we spoken so much against thee?

column8: Malachi
column17: Ye have said, It is vain to serve God: and what profit is it that we have kept his ordinance, and that we have walked mournfully before the Lord of hosts?

column8: Malachi
column17: And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are set up; yea, they that tempt God are even delivered.

column8: Malachi
column17: Then they that feared the Lord spake often one to another: and the Lord hearkened, and heard it, and a book of remembrance was written before him for them that feared the Lord, and that thought upon his name.

column8: Malachi
column17: And they shall be mine, saith the Lord of hosts, in that day when I make up my jewels; and I will spare them, as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.

column8: Malachi
column17: Then shall ye return, and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him that serveth God and him that serveth him not.

column8: Malachi
column17: For, behold, the day cometh, that shall burn as an oven; and all the proud, yea, and all that do wickedly, shall be stubble: and the day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the Lord of hosts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.

column8: Malachi
column17: But unto you that fear my name shall the Sun of righteousness arise with healing in his wings; and ye shall go forth, and grow up as calves of the stall.

column8: Malachi
column17: And ye shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I shall do this, saith the Lord of hosts.

column8: Malachi
column17: Remember ye the law of Moses my servant, which I commanded unto him in Horeb for all Israel, with the statutes and judgments.

column8: Malachi
column17: Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord:

column8: Malachi
column17: And he shall turn the heart of the fathers to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations.

column8: The Gospel According to St Matthew
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
