column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had gone a little further thence, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all the city was gathered together at the door.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he went out, and began to publish it much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he entered into Capernaum after some days; and it was noised that he was in the house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he would: and they came unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Simon he surnamed Peter;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The sower soweth the word.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and also concerning the swine.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go home to thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men did marvel.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was of the age of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From whence hath this man these things? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But be shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an house, there abide till ye depart from that place.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when Herod heard thereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief estates of Galilee;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while: for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time is far passed:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they did all eat, and were filled.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, as the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, It is Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; he shall be free.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one of you, and understand:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it unto the dogs.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it;

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples unto him, and saith unto them,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before them; and they did set them before the people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark

column17: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;

column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men? answer me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he began to speak unto them by parables. A certain man planted a vineyard, and set an hedge about it, and digged a place for the winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they caught him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they took him, and killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And have ye not read this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: This was the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they brought it. And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription? And they said unto him, Caesar's.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto them, Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's. And they marvelled at him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments is, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this is the first commandment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the second is like, namely this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him any question.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he then his son? And the common people heard him gladly.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and love salutations in the marketplaces,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called unto him his disciples, and saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For all they did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, even all her living.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any man deceive you:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for such things must needs be; but the end shall not be yet.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when they shall lead you, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against their parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name's sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter therein, to take any thing out of his house:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For in those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect's sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here is Christ; or, lo, he is there; believe him not:

column8: The Gospel According to St Mark
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
