column17: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was present to heal them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought means to bring him in, and to lay him before him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloak forbid not to take thy coat also.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare him stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many that were blind he gave sight.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings' courts.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all the people that heard him, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Lord said, Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But wisdom is justified of all her children.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And stood at his feet behind him weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Simon answered and said, I suppose that he, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with the hairs of her head.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout every city and village, preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God: and the twelve were with him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And certain women, which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities, Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: A sower went out to sow his seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an hundredfold. And when he had said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God: but to others in parables; that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: They on the rock are they, which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but setteth it on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither any thing hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then came to him his mother and his brethren, and could not come at him for the press.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it was told him by certain which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in any house, but in the tombs.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name? And he said, Legion: because many devils were entered into him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When they that fed them saw what was done, they fled, and went and told it in the city and in the country.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then they went out to see what was done; and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: They also which saw it told them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee. And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people gladly received him: for they were all waiting for him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue: and he fell down at Jesus' feet, and besought him that he would come into his house:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And a woman having an issue of blood twelve years, which had spent all her living upon physicians, neither could be healed of any,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Came behind him, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said, Who touched me? When all denied, Peter and they that were with him said, Master, the multitude throng thee and press thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared unto him before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: While he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the synagogue's house, saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; trouble not the Master.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when Jesus heard it, he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he came into the house, he suffered no man to go in, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said, Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Take nothing for your journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the people, when they knew it, followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down by fifties in a company.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: They answering said, John the Baptist; but some say, Elias; and others say, that one of the old prophets is risen again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answering said, The Christ of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he straitly charged them, and commanded them to tell no man that thing;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said to them all, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and in his Father's, and of the holy angels.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment was white and glistering.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept it close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he steadfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men's lives, but to save them. And they went to another village.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain man said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly is great, but the labourers are few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace be to this house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will reveal him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he turned him unto his disciples, and said privately, Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said, A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked on him, and passed by on the other side.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And went to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus' feet, and heard his word.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Give us day by day our daily bread.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, no doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth it in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when thine eye is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If thy whole body therefore be full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over them are not aware of them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they shall slay and persecute:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and unto magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, and be merry.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But God said unto him, Thou fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
