column17: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The life is more than meat, and the body is more than raiment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they suffered such things?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He spake also this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung it:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if it bear fruit, well: and if not, then after that thou shalt cut it down.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up herself.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Jesus saw her, he called her to him, and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he laid his hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The Lord then answered him, and said, Thou hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved? And he said unto them,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they shall come from the east, and from the west, and from the north, and from the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and ye would not!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until the time come when ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they held their peace. And he took him, and healed him, and let him go;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they could not answer him again to these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor thy rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish it, all that behold it begin to mock him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and entreated him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So he called every one of his lord's debtors unto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from thence.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they lifted up their voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And fell down on his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Remember Lot's wife.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Two women shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they shall scourge him, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that way.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore him fourfold.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this man to reign over us.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, here is thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and give it to him that hath ten pounds.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called the mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, Go ye into the village over against you; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring him hither.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose him? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answered and said unto them, I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things which belong unto thy peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent him away empty.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast him out.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence him when they see him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but teachest the way of God truly:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Shew me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered and said, Caesar's.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar's, and unto God the things which be God's.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Last of all the woman died also.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David's son?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which devour widows' houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: As for these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass?

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end is not by and by.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name's sake.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Settle it therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name's sake.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In your patience possess ye your souls.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days! for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Men's hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.

column8: The Gospel According to St Luke
