column17: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain man's house, named Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But if it be a question of words and names, and of your law, look ye to it; for I will be no judge of such matters.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he drave them from the judgment seat.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn his head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after he had spent some time there, he departed, and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, and mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For he mightily convinced the Jews, and that publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John's baptism.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all the men were about twelve.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, and chief of the priests, which did so.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all men: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day's uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, and embraced them, and departed for to go into Macedonia.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: These going before tarried for us at Troas.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you, but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul's neck, and kissed him,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had finished our course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the next day we that were of Paul's company departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was one of the seven; and abode with him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul's girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all men every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Paul said, I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence which I make now unto you.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I am verily a man which am a Jew, born in Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they gave him audience unto this word, and then lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there arose a great cry: and the scribes that were of the Pharisees' part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring him into the castle.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went with him aside privately, and asked him, What is that thou hast to tell me?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So the chief captain then let the young man depart, and charged him, See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he wrote a letter after this manner:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who, when they came to Caesarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that he was of Cilicia;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him away out of our hands,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, and toward men.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Or else let these same here say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to let him have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself would depart shortly thither.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with me, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Caesarea; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Caesar, have I offended any thing at all.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Paul, I stand at Caesar's judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? unto Caesar shalt thou go.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul's cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: About whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus' commandment Paul was brought forth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, and also here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: To open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: That Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus' band.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished them,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man's life among you, but of the ship.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And sounded, and found it twenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and found it fifteen fathoms.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had broken it, he began to eat.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Then were they all of good cheer, and they also took some meat.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves unto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from their purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea, and get to land:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the rest, some on boards, and some on broken pieces of the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: Where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
column9: Of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
column17: And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.

column8: The Acts of the Apostles
